story:
Our Recipe

Angry Troll Brewing was established from a group of local business owners, homebrewers, and from the mutual love of Craft Beer.  We are ready and dedicated to crafting amazing brews for the foothills of North Carolina, and beyond.  Our group formed months ago and, after some thought, we came up with our name based on our proposed location.  Our brewery will be directly under where a beloved landmark bridge had passed, that was demolished in 2011.  And, thus this Troll story begins.

Among the six partners, Kevin Stainback (right below) and Louis Jeroslow (left below) will be the head brewer and brewer/chemist (respectively) teaming up and bringing their combined years of fermentation experience.  

We'd also like to introduce our partners:  Dee Coley, Jeff Gibbs, Cicely McCulloch, and Bob Puckett.  We have spent the last year trademarking our name, creating our logo, refining our recipes, and ensuring that we have what it takes to join this industry.  We are so excited to bring this project to our vibrant small downtown in Elkin, NC.

Our Grainbill and Hops Schedule

Initially, with Phase I, we will purchase and install our first brewing system into the lower level of The Liberty building.  This includes the purchase of the brewing system itself, building the production room, adding fermentation and refrigeration equipment, plumbing and electrical, venting and exhaust, and all the minor details in between.  We will quickly start producing and distributing to area establishments who are already anxious to put us on tap.
  

In Phase II we will construct our "troll cave" taproom for a welcoming community gathering place where we will offer tastings, pints, growler fills, and limited edition bottles.  In Phase III we will grow into our larger system to extend our boundaries of distribution and expand our bottling capabilities.

Fermenting and Lagering

We pitched the yeast with an initial goal of $25,000, but - if we surpass this goal - then we will raise the bar (literally and figuratively) with a stretch goal to quickly initiate Phase II with our Angry Troll Taproom.  Of course, if we blow the roof off this campaign - we will introduce and march onward into Phase III with our larger system.  Join us on our journey!  Plus, you get some pretty cool gear at any contribution level!

More About the Perks

Check out our Perks to the right for their description, item(s) included, and the "contribute" button. Remember that these perks can make great gifts for family and friends!
Visit our gallery for larger pictures of the items.  Below is a preview of what each will look like:

Conditioning

Can't contribute? That doesn't mean you can't support our venture:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out.  Share and like our fan page at www.facebook.com/angrytrollbrewing or follow us on twitter at www.twitter.com/angrytrollbrew.
  • You can also sign up for our newsletter at www.angrytrollbrewing.com
  • Or simply use the Indiegogo share tools!

Cheers

And from the bottom of our hearts to the bottom of our pint glasses...

Thank you for any contribution or support in making this venture a success!!!

Angry Troll Brewing

Cicely, Dee, Louis, Kevin, Bob, and Jeff

story:
We are the Jua Project! In 2012, we started with the passion to empower families to rise above poverty by creating hand crafted products. We originally began in Kitale, Kenya and have recently expanded to working with New Americans in the United States!

This campaign will allow the program in Kenya to become self-sustainable by venturing into livestock farming with chickens. In Kenya, owning and raising livestock is an important source of income for many people.

The impact of the chicken farm will not only bring life-saving food, but it will bring additional, self-sustaining income that will allow the women in our program and their children to provide for their ongoing needs. Partnering with each woman's savings accounts, we want to empower them in a self-sustaining business.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal of this campaign is to raise $5000 to build a sustainable chicken coop for the women in Kenya. This entails buying the land, feed, chickens, etc. 



Even if the funds aren't completely reached the donations will still go towards building a chicken coop on a smaller scale. The goal set is what is needed to make sure it will succeed and be sustainable. 
We need YOU to make this possible!


The Impact

  • The work the Jua Project does is so important in the lives of these women! It creates a job for women, empowering them to get off the streets, feed their families, and send their children to school. It creates community, a sense of ownership, and value as they work to provide for their families.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • We need your help to spread the word about Jua! Tell others how one can partner with us to impact the lives of women around the world. 


Do this by sharing by about us with your friends and family through social media! Spread the word and change the world!

story:
Short Summary

my Background:
"Soorsdey," means hello in Cambodian. My name is Ratha K. Hanh. In 1992, around the same time as the L.A. Watt Riot, my family left Cambodia to come to the U.S. as refugee status. My parents were survivors of the Khmer Rouge mass genocidal killing fields in the mid '70s. There is a well-known film adaptation of the actual real life occurrences called The Killing Fields. Beside my country recent tragic past, Cambodia is a land filled with mysticism, mystery, and archaeology wonders. Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument and Hindu temple complex in the world situated in the jungle. Being there, one can gets a sense of cosmic consciousness. This is just a brief summary of my background, dances of light and shadow, Lila in Sanskrit means divine plays and my sister's name.

This campaign is just one of my many entrepreneurship that can assist me and my family to obtain financial abundance and prosperity through healthy quality coffee and more. The 100% Certified Organic Ganoderma in Organo Gold has over 150 antioxidants and phytonutrients, and is backed up in modern science clinical studies. It is noted for providing considerably more energy and vigour, natural body detoxification, quality of sleep, circulation and immune system support and promoting health and longevity.


Your contributions will help me to spread the many healthy benefits of the Ganoderma Lucidum mushroom through rich tasty delicious beverages, nutraceutically, and hygienically. This species has been used for thousands of years by the Chinese for natural healing, it has been respectfully called the "Mushroom of Immortality." Originally reserved for the “Royalty” of Chinese, regarded as one of the highest valued and treasured herbs in traditional Chinese medicine. The mushroom is well-known as a tonic for supporting general wellness and vitality. What regular coffee is known to do to the body is it dehydrates the body, very acidic and toxic, raises blood pressure, raises the stress level due to increased cortisol, coffee jitters and caffeine crash. Organo Gold Coffee balances pH level of the body, natural detoxification, increased the immune system and provides energy. No jitters or caffeine crash due to the infusion of Ganoderma Lucidum which oxygenates the body. 

What We Need & What You Get

I will need $1,500 dollars to invest in the Organo Gold Coffee promotional gold pack: OG Gourmet Black (15 boxes), OG Gourmet Mocha (10 boxes), OG Gourmet Latte (15 boxes), OG Hot Chocolate (6 boxes), OG Organic Green Tea (6 boxes). Includes in this pack will be nutraceutical and hygienic products also. I will be one of their distributors via e-mail and personal delivery, which I have already signed up for.
The perks are listed to the right accordingly base on the amount the donors contribute.
The funds will still go to my business endeavor if I don't reach my entire goal; it will get me one step closer to my goal. With any business there is some risk involve. I have got nothing to loose. This company has been around for five years; it is up to the individual drives on how successful their business will be. You won't know until you try.

The Impact

The extra value of my business is with the reishi mushroom. Help me to help others by spreading the consumption of Ganoderma Lucidum mushroom. This herb is used to boost your immune system and is said to carry anti-aging properties, help with weight loss, and possibly help prevent certain types of cancer. Organo Gold Gourmet brand coffee is caffeinated with 9 grams or less of caffeine, in comparison to other coffee brands that have numbers at 135 to 330 grams of caffeine. Awesomely, the presence of Ganoderma neutralizes the negative side effects of caffeine so you get the "boost" with out the "crash" from caffeine. Health is wealth, is what I want to share with the world. 

I am a permaculturist who care deeply for my surrounding wherever I go. In the past, my friend and I had a compost delivery service in Long Beach, Ca. Then I left the city to learn and live more sustainably at an Earthship community in Taos, New Mexico and Southern Colorado. While out there, I met Paul Stamets, the mushroom guy, at a tribal festival that I help to coordinate. He was giving a discourse on the many functions of mushroom and its restorative impact on the environment, myco remediation. During his discussions the Ganoderma Lucidum or reishi mushroom was mentioned.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donation is not the only way you can help. You can help me just by referrals. Please helps spread the word about my campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Help bring our community centre back to Cobridge

Three non-for-profit organisations have come together to save Cobridge Community Centre. A communal space at the heart of a vibrant, diverse community and is surrounded by the 'Grange' a beautiful green space. 

Why is this important?

This campaign is important and urgent because this centre has been at the heart of the community for many years and in September 2013 it closed its doors. Through our engagement we aim to restore and build on its past achievements.

About Cobridge

Cobridge is in the City of Stoke-on-Trent. The city is ranked 16th out of 354 English districts across national indices of multiple deprivation. It is ranked as the 3rd most deprived in the West Midlands out of 34 Local Authority districts.

Cobridge also has a diverse ethnic mix, which is expressed through its vibrant culture, a wide variety of foods outlets, passion and a world wide viewpoint, a community centre at the heart of this community is crucial for the wellbeing of the people living here.  

Who Are We?

Cobridge Community Centre Consortium

Chameleon WM CIC - have experience of engaging and working with young people as well as developing arts training and motivational training. 

(http://marieinfinitearts.wix.com/chameleon)

Cobridge Community & Multicultural Association (CCMA) - a charity based in Cobridge who have 30 years experience and expertise in understanding the older generation and its cultural heritage and strong work ethic.
(www.ccmacobridge.co.uk)

SCIPE CIC's objectives are to engage communities, parents and mixed heritage children in consultation to develop meaningful activities and shape services that matter to them.
(www.scipe.org.uk)

All three organisations are involved in community engagement and the synergy between us means that we capture an intergenerational mix across all sectors of the community. We all have experience in facilitating workshops, project managing and running events.

Values

We believe that

  • People are a resource not a problem, everyone has something to contribute.
  • By consulting with the community to find out their individual needs and involving them in developing the centre, that the community will have a voice and sense of ownership.
  • This will enable the development of and support community cohesion.
  • Reenergising the community from within, will give everyone a sense of belonging and purpose.

Aims & Objectives

Short Term - to crowdfund for the extra £50,000 we need to reopen the centre.

Medium Term - To support the redevelopment of the community centre, by creating spaces, opportunities and access for local people to identify and prioritise common goals. To enhance the quality of life for individuals and create a strong cohesive enabling a sense of community where individuals can connect, be involved and access meaningful activities or events shaped by them. Individuals will utilise their strengths and assets to integrate and transform current services ensuring positive outcomes from their investment for sustainability and future growth.  Proposed activities for the community centre are shown below:

  • Community cafe
  • Raising awareness, workshops about health
  • General health checks & community nurse
  • Complementary therapies
  • Provide a respite/day care facility
  • Teaching workshops from an intergenerational perspective
  • Emotional Wellbeing Program
  • Provision for mentoring and coaching
  • Social functions and private hire


Why Support Us?

Case for Support - Local businesses

People within deprived and disadvantaged communities do not always see the benefits that local businesses have on their community, by supporting projects like this we are able to increase your companies visibility and show your commitment to corporate social responsibility and your social values. Please see below the ways you can pledge:

Option One - Public pledge/donations

If you pledge at the start of the 4-week campaign your company will be marketed and promoted throughout the period until the end of December.

Option Two – Individual area sponsorship

Sponsorship opportunities - we are offering four sponsorship opportunities within the centre over a two year period from 1st Jan 2014

a. Building  - £30,000

  • Name on main signage outside front of building and on entrance to building
  • On all social media
  • On web site
  • On marketing activities i.e. leaflets and posters
  • As stated above the earlier they pledge the more visibility they will receive during the campaign

b. Hall area - £20,000

  • Signage on entrance to the hall and near the stage
  • On all social media
  • On web site
  • As stated above the earlier you pledge the great visibility your company will receive.

c. Bar area - £10,000

  • Signage on entrance to the bar area and above the bar
  • On web site
  • As stated above the earlier they pledge the more visibility they will receive during the campaign.

d. Kitchen - £4,000

  • Signage on the kitchen doors and above the serving hatch
  • As stated above the earlier they pledge the more visibility they will receive during the campaign

Option Three – Complete centre sponsorship

If you are interested in taking up all four of the above sponsorships opportunities in Option two, this will cost your company £50,000 for a two year contract.

Option Four – Annual Membership

Your company can become an annual member of the centre and give your staff and company discounts on services, events and activities provided by the centre.

  • Up to 10 staff = £75.00 per year
  • Over ten staff = £99.00 per year

Case for Support - Community Support/Public Pledge

The centre is appealing to the local community to give any amount to help save Cobridge Community Centre this will ensure that the centre reopens its doors and  remains accessible to the local people. It may be that you are looking for a venue for a special occasion such as a wedding or birthday party, or that you want to run or take part in activities at the centre, or that you want to support a local cause.  We value your support, choose an amount to suit your pocket.

Thanks for taking the time to view our project, if you are still undecided about whether or not to support us or have more questions, please feel free to contact us.

story:
Hi, we are 3 guys, 2 Brits. 1 Argentine, who have saved skimped and downright begged enough to make the most of the favorable housing price crash here in Valencia, by buying a completely run down city centre apartment. 

We already have 1 apartment here that we successfully rent to tourists. This has a mortgage and as the banks are less than friendly at the moment they refuse to loan us money to reform the new one. Even though we own the apartment out right, we have been told that they have enough repossessed properties that owning one outright is no good as collateral.

We also have a successful rental company in Ibiza, where we rent properties to tourists.


We need the funds to kick start our business and get this property reformed and back on the market. During the marketing time it will be rented to tourists for holidays. The demand is huge here at the moment, in fact tourism increased here by almost 30% last year. Spain rearly is on the turn and is the place to invest in.

We are offering some pretty cool perks, but if you have something you would like let us know, we are always open to ideas. 

Please watch the video with Steve our project manager to get an idea of what we want to achieve, and you may even spot our mascot , Molly the mini schnauzer pointing out a couple of the better features. 

If you are interested in investing in our company please contact us for some very favorable investment opportunities.

Thanks for taking the time to read this and please share or like this to your social network sites.

WE ARE DETERMINED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN, Be part of it,

H, S and M



P.s. We have noted that most of our visitors are from American friends. Please let us know what perks you would like to receive. We want to reward you in the best way we can. Please leave your ideas in the comment area above. Thank you, and we hope to invite you to stay very soon in our fantastic city.


Extra info on prize draw:   There will be one draw with one prize of a holiday (vacation) at every 1000 euros of donations received. This gives a 1 in 40 chance of winning.

Spain rearly is on the turn and is the place to invest in.We are offering some pretty cool perks, but if you have something you would like let us know, we are always open to ideas. Please watch the video with Steve our project manager to get an idea of what we want to achieve, and you may even spot our mascot , Molly the mini schnauzer pointing out a couple of the better features. If you are interested in investing in our company please contact us for some very favorable investment opportunities.Thanks for taking the time to read this and please share or like this to your social network sites.WE ARE DETERMINED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN, Be part of it,H, S and MP.s. We have noted that most of our visitors are from American friends. Please let us know what perks you would like to receive. We want to reward you in the best way we can. Please leave your ideas in the comment area above. Thank you, and we hope to invite you to stay very soon in our fantastic city.Extra info on prize draw:   There will be one draw with one prize of a holiday (vacation) at every 1000 euros of donations received. This gives a 1 in 40 chance of winning.

story:
Caroline McCarthy passed away last year after a long battle with Cancer. Her final wishes were for us to raise money for 'the flame' holistic healing centre in Coventry.

The centre offers free meditation, yoga, conversation, counselling, space to breathe and compassion to anyone suffering from physical or mental illness. It was Carolines favorite place. She visited whenever she felt well enough to leave the house.

This year, due to the cuts, the flame received no government funding and is now under threat of being closed down. The good news is, a group of us have decided to try and raise the £2000 target by Christmas to keep the centre running. We will be playing live music for a non-stop total of 12 hours in the same room used for the medtaton sessions. The event will be filmed and uploaded onto YouTube as evidence. 

My goal is to raise £500, so I am looking for sponsors. As raising money for the centre was my Mum Caroline's final wish, I consider this to be the most important fund raising event of my life,  therefore anything you can give will be remembered and deeply appreciated.

Thank you.

Rory

story:
Hello everybody. 

We are Tony and Jason. We purchased the Mustang Lounge from our Grandpa in 2007. We also purchased the land, so the building needed to be brought up to code. Because of various construction issues, our renovations ended up being incredibly over budget, leaving us to battle back the last seven years. Things are looking better every year, but we want to give you the absolute best product, immediately:

NEW! 

* BAR STOOLS

* BEER COOLER

* ICE MACHINE

ALONG WITH...

* PAST DUE BILLS

We have set up this campaign to raise $35,000 in 30 days. This will help immensely in our our pursuit to raise our standard and deliver the very best to our Hang at the 'Stang family (and stay out of trouble with "The Man").

WHAT YOU GET!

We will start by giving you awesome perks for helping us achieve our goal. You don't have to take out a mortgage to snag some very unique, limited edition Mustang Swag.  Want the naming rights to one of our barstools? Want a limited edition Hang at the 'Stang tee shirt? Want us to grill Mustang Burgers in your backyard for you and your friends? Then what are you waiting for?!?! 

I mean, thank you! Your contribution will help ensure the future success for the Mustang Lounge for decades to come.

Bonus Perk! Regardless of how much money we raise, 5% of it is going to the Mackinac Island Community's Cancer Fund to help our residents with cancer pay medical bills. If we break $10,000, we'll up it to 7.5%. $20,000--10%. And If we break $30,000 we'll give 15%! 

We feel it's only right to help our community while you are helping us.  

CHECK OUT ALL THE PERKS ->

And check back here daily for updates

and more videos!

Thank you.

story:
Here’s a Crazy Idea…let’s End World Hunger!

This is your chance to get involved in something so good and truly worthwhile, it will make your heart sing…


Our campaign is about 2 things:

1. Feeding Hungry Kids. Getting nutritious food in their hands (and bellies)

2. Doing R and D to make that food even better!

Best of all, it only takes a couple of minutes

You are minutes away from dramatically improving the lives and health of children that go to school hungry and adding dignity to the lives of the homeless who spend too much of their day desperately hoping for their next meal.

You can mend someone’s broken heart, make them feel loved and give them hope for the future, just by doing this one simple thing…

Stopping their hunger. at RTG, we feel passionately that it's NOT good enough to give the hungry the scraps we don't want to eat ourselves. If anything, the hungry need MORE nutritious food to get their health and lives back on track. Optimeal is formulated to give the undernourished the nutritional boost they need. And it tastes great!

Here’s how to do good immediately and get something cool in the process…

The perks you see on the right are different ways you can help the hungry and satiate your own appetite. Everyone wins! 

By selecting a perk you can do the following:

1. You Can Show You Care by Feeding Hungry Kids: You can choose to buy food for others by feeding 1 ("The Nice Guy"), 5 ("The Saint") or 10 ("The Benevolent Deity") kids for an entire month.

2. You Can Grab a Sick T-Shirt: You can get a T-shirt for yourself (the "Compassion is King" perk).

3. You can receive while you give: You can feed a kid while feeling the nutritious effects of Optimeal yourself for a FULL MONTH with the "RTG" or "Superhero Pack" perks.

4. Team Building: And for businesses... We offer a team build program that will transform your organization while feeding hundreds or even thousands of kids. Pretty cool right! Bring this one to the boss and you'll look like a hero :)

So what are you waiting for?! Pick the perk that you know is right for you.  Let’s end hunger together!



Who has Already Contributed?

Example 1: Slim from Videomeals - Almost 800k followers on Instagram

Learn more about Slim and his 15-second Videomeals here


And now, a little bit about RTG Group:


A New Way of Giving for the 21st Century

RTG is not a charity but instead partners with charities around the globe. Together we've created what we call the "New Way of Giving". 

We don't give charities any money. Instead, we give them highly nutritious food like Optimeal. The charities then put the Optimeal in the hands of a child or other undernourished individuals. In many cases, donors can then check online and see where their gifts have ended up.

The New Way of Giving protects you, our contributor, with its efficiency and transparency. If you are like many generous and socially conscious people these days, you've experienced an increasing skepticism in how much of the money you donate to charity ends up actually funding causes. With our New Way of Giving, you can be assured that your money is completely dedicated to buying the food you wish to donate. 

Here is a visualization of our model:

Although we are a for-profit social enterprise, we are far from profit-driven. It is what we do with our profits that makes us unique. Whenever we sell a bag of food, the majority of the profit goes to a variety of the other causes we support and manage.

AND since our model is so flexible and no good cause is off limits, we want to do something that really matters to YOU. That's why, we want you to let us know your favorite cause or initiative in the public comments. We'll pick one and announce how we'll use our model to make a real impact in that area at the end of our campaign.

Here is a visualization of our model:

Although we are a for-profit social enterprise, we are far from profit-driven. It is what we do with our profits that makes us unique. Whenever we sell a bag of food, the majority of the profit goes to a variety of the other causes we support and manage.



AND since our model is so flexible and no good cause is off limits, we want to do something that really matters to YOU. That's why, we want you to let us know your favorite cause or initiative in the public comments. We'll pick one and announce how we'll use our model to make a real impact in that area at the end of our campaign.

Optimeal: a unique solution to end the pain and misery of hunger

Optimeal contains many essential vitamins and minerals as well as high levels of fibre and protein. Optimeal was formulated by our naturopaths and doctors to help the hungry THRIVE, not just to help them scrape by.

What Ingredients are in Optimeal?

Here is an example of the ingredients in our trail-mix Optimeal bars: 

Whole grain rolled oats, grains (barley, wheat), sesame seeds, quinoa, raisins, sunflower seed, honey, dried blueberries (blueberries, sugar, sunflower oil), brown flax seed, whey protein isolate, high oleic sunflower oil, coconut, maple syrup, almonds.

We are very excited to get YOUR feedback to make Optimeal the best it can be!


Why Does RTG Need my Support?

Why Does RTG Need my Support?

RTG, needs your generous donations to jump-start the mass production of Optimeal for the developed world. Ramping up for distribution to accommodate so much of the world is a costly endeavour.

Here are some of the specific things your donations will go towards (other than feeding kids of course!):

1) Validating the formulations with nutritional professionals to continually make Optimeal even better.

2) Marketing and communication programs to introduce to jaded individuals and organizations a New Way of Giving that is transparent, accountable and effective.

3) Hiring the staff needed to carry out the multiple philanthropic programs we have in development.

If we end up EXCEEDING our goal there is a ton more we can do! We will keep you posted along the way with stretch goals to reach together. Let's make a real difference in the world together!


Do you Seriously Expect to END hunger in the Developed World?


With Your Help, Can We Seriously Expect to END Hunger in the Developed World?

Call us crazy, but we believe the answer is yes! In fact, our 5-year plan is nothing short of ending hunger in the developed world while simultaneously putting a massive dent in hunger elsewhere through our other programs. With the deals we are already beginning to implement, we anticipate we will be feeding a staggering

1 million kids a month in the developed world by the end of next year. That’s certainly a good start! 

And, if the history of our company tells us anything, we’ll have to modify those projections again and again. After all, our original goal was to feed a humble 50,000 kids a month over 5 years. Now, we truly think the sky is the limit. So let's go for it together. 


The Story of RTG’s Conception

Stephen Clarke has lived an interesting life. He played professional hockey for 5 years, but was forced to move on after blowing out his knee. He also experienced massive success (and his fair share of failures!) in business with a world-renowned talent in the advertising industry.

One day, Stephen decided he had made his living. Now, he thought, it was time for him to make a difference. But, with a world full of problems, it's hard to know where to start! So, he took the easy way out and asked his mother what to do. 

She explained that she simply couldn't understand why homelessness remained a problem in the developed world. She suggested he focus on ending homelessness. A tall order, but everyone knows you can’t say no to the requests of your mother!



Stephen decided that building a massive homeless shelter would be a good way to appease her. But, the price tag on a 20+ story homeless shelter is NOT a small one. So, it was time for Stephen to start another business. However, this one couldn't be only profit driven, but also had to be a vehicle to do good.

Another, cause Stephen cared about deeply was feeding starving children. So, with his wife Svetlana, he developed an innovative business model that would generate financing from feeding 50,000 starving children a month to build a homeless shelter and sustain it.

However, it didn't take long before Stephen’s creative business strategy roots kicked in and for the business to start scaling much faster than anticipated. Suddenly through innovative corporate team-building programs, deals with a few massive organizations, and the addition of valuable partners, RTG’s original projections suddenly had to be updated. The 5-year plan to feed 50,000 kids a month became a plan to feed 1.2 million kids a month in just 2 years. And, the new 5-year plan is to eliminate hunger all together.


Join RTG in this exciting journey that just keeps expanding in its ambition. With your help our mission to end world hunger may be achieved sooner than we ever thought possible!


Have an idea of how you'd like us to change the world?


FAQ
I don't live in North-America, why should I donate? 
First of all, you can definitely get some Optimeal for yourself and help us perfect the taste and formula regardless of where you are. Furthermore, we can certainly ship Optimeal to a charity in your country that accepts food donations. Keep in mind though, we don't have formal partnerships everywhere yet so we can't guarantee we'll be able to personally vet all the charities we send the food to.

What Ingredients are in Optimeal?
Here is an example of the ingredients in our trail-mix Optimeal bars: 
Whole grain rolled oats, grains (barley, wheat), sesame seeds, quinoa, raisins, sunflower seed, honey, dried blueberries (blueberries, sugar, sunflower oil), brown flax seed, whey protein isolate, high oleic sunflower oil, coconut, maple syrup, almonds.
We hope to continue to to perfect our formulation to make it even healthier and more effective. Order some for yourself and give us a hand!

Is your price to feed a kid good value?
We consider our price to feed a kid FANTASTIC value. The industry standard for charities that do the same sort of thing we do is up at around 35 USD per month. Not only are we less expensive, we also have a more efficient and transparent model.

How do you decide what causes to focus on next with your profits?
We deal with organizations and companies around the world. Often, the causes we focus on are the result of where the biggest of these deals are happening. With thousands and thousands of kids being fed at a time, we can dedicated substantial profits do something meaningful for that region and culture. We try to leave something life-changing wherever we go!

How do you feed so many kids?
We are able to feed such huge amounts of kids because our business model often takes a top-down approach. We approach the decisions makers of companies and organizations and construct win-win partnerships that have us feeding thousands of kids at a time. It's this approach that has us on a pace to feed so many kids within the next 5 years.

Other questions? Please email: crowdfunding@rtgmarketinggroup.com and we'll be glad to help out!

story:
Hi!

I'm mg. You might know me, but if this goes well, odds are that you don't. A bunch of years back I started the 93/94 Magic format; it's a casual approach to the Magic the Gathering card game. For the last couple of years, I've been blogging about it at oldschoolmtg.com.

But this is not about that. This is about people not in the #mtgunderground, but in the real underground.

There are more refugees today than during WW2 and the Holocaust. About one in every 122 humans on the planet are forcefully displaced today. So far the conflict in Syria have killed a quarter of a million, and forced millions to run from their homes. Doctors without borders has reported that suppliers in Syria refuse to sell essential medical supplies such as gauze and surgical threads to doctors due to government intimidation. This is, to put it mildly, fucked up.

I wont retell the horror stories we've all heard, mostly as I can't really grasp them. I have spent 15 months training in the Swedish military, but I never went to a war. People fleeing from ISIS is far outside my context.

So what then? Play the waiting game, and accept that this is not happening to us? Well. Lets do something instead. We're Magic players, so let's give up one of our cards.

What We Need & What You Get

So here's my plan. This is four days salary for a Medicine sans frontiers employee working in Syria:

A fetchland could be food for a week.

This is a golden time to act.  We all have a couple of cards we don't really need, staples sitting in our binders or cards that could be exchanged. If we do this, we might actually save a handful of real people from dying. Using our hobby and the community for the people in the real underground.

So I'll sell that Tundra to get some money to give to Doctors without borders. Instead of that Tundra, I'll write #MtgForLife on a Hallowed Fountain and play that one in my EDH deck instead. It's not like I'll ever be sad drawing that one instead of the Tundra. Hell, I'll play it with much more pride. Then I'll sell a Volcanic Island to buy stamps. Because this is where you come in.

For anyone selling, downgrading or just neglecting to buy a $25+ card, and giving the money to the #MtgForLife project, I'll send you a random 93/94 legal card. I'll sign them and tag the card with the project as a memorabilia. If you don't have any card you want to downgrade, just neglect to buy one or donate some money for the cause anyway, and I'll send you a card. If we get just 10 people to skip a blue dual for a basic land or shockland, we'll reach $1000. If we reach $1000, I'll throw in another Tundra in the pot. I'll sell my own cards to pay for any stamps needed, at least up to the first $200 in postage. In case it would actually go beyond that I reserve the right to use a very small part of the funds to fund postage for the perks.

Anything helps. A Thoughtseize to a Duress. A skipped booster draft.

And let's make this interesting. If this project should actually reach $10,000, I'll use my geek budget for the rest of the year to buy a Mox, find someone skilled to give it an awesome alteration, and give randomly to someone who donated $100 or more. All we need is 100 people giving up a dual or a Tarmogoyf. 10 people willing to downgrade a Mox from Beta to Unlimited.

The Impact

All the money collected will go to Doctors without Borders (MSF). The impact might be small on a global scale, but there will be an impact. We might save someone. We might influence other subcultures to join in and contribute in their way. At the very least we'll do something.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. You can read more about the project at the old school blog.
story_txt:
Hi!
I'm mg. You might know me, but if this goes well, odds are that you don't. A bunch of years back I started the 93/94 Magic format; it's a casual approach to the Magic the Gathering card game. For the last couple of years, I've been blogging about it at oldschoolmtg.com. 
But this is not about that. This is about people not in the #mtgunderground, but in the real underground. 
There are more refugees today than during WW2 and the Holocaust. About one in every 122 humans on the planet are forcefully displaced today. So far the conflict in Syria have killed a quarter of a million, and forced millions to run from their homes. Doctors without borders has reported that suppliers in Syria refuse to sell 
essential medical supplies such as gauze and surgical threads to doctors
 due to government intimidation. This is, to put it mildly, fucked up.
I wont retell the horror stories we've all heard, mostly as I can't really grasp them. I have
 spent 15 months training in the Swedish military, but I never went to a
 war. People fleeing from 
ISIS is far outside my context.
So what then? Play the waiting game, and accept that this is not 
happening to us? Well. Lets do something instead. We're Magic players, so let's give up one of our cards.
  What We Need & What You Get 
So here's my plan. This is four days salary for a Medicine sans frontiers employee working in Syria:

A fetchland could be food for a week. 
This
 is a golden time to act.  We all have a couple of cards we don't really need, staples 
sitting in our binders or cards that could be exchanged. If we do this, 
we might actually save a handful of real people from dying. Using our 
hobby and the community for the people in the real underground. 
So
I'll sell that Tundra to get some money to give 
to Doctors without borders. Instead of that Tundra, I'll write 
#MtgForLife on a Hallowed Fountain and play that one in my EDH deck 
instead. It's not like I'll ever be sad drawing that one instead of the 
Tundra. Hell, I'll play it with much more pride. Then I'll sell a 
Volcanic Island to buy stamps. Because this is where you come in.

For anyone selling, downgrading or just neglecting to
 buy a $25+ card, and giving the money to the #MtgForLife project, I'll 
send you a random 93/94 legal card. I'll sign them and tag the card with
 the project as a memorabilia. If you don't have any card you want to 
downgrade, just neglect to buy one or donate some money for the cause 
anyway, and I'll send you a card. If we get just 10 people to skip a 
blue dual for a basic land or shockland, we'll reach $1000. If we reach 
$1000, I'll throw in another Tundra in the pot. I'll sell my own cards to pay for any stamps needed, at least up to the 
first $200 in postage. In case it would actually go beyond that I reserve the right to use a very small part 
of the funds to fund postage for the perks.
Anything helps. A Thoughtseize to a Duress. A skipped booster draft.
And
 let's make this interesting. If this project should actually reach 
$10,000, I'll use my geek budget for the 
rest of the year to buy a Mox, find someone skilled to give it an 
awesome alteration, and give randomly to someone who donated $100 or 
more. All we need is 100 people giving up a dual or a Tarmogoyf. 10 
people willing to downgrade a Mox from Beta to Unlimited.
  The Impact All the money collected will go to Doctors without Borders (MSF). The impact might be small on a global scale, but there will be an impact. We might save someone. We might influence other subcultures to join in and contribute in their way. At the very least we'll do something. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word. 
You can read more about the project at the old school blog.

story:
Hello,

I am an aspiring entrepreneur looking to lose my corporate shackles and spread my creative wings through my favorite hobby, brewing beer... Join the club, right. I have been saving for years and spending all of my free time learning about brewing up a business as well as beer. 

I would like to open the first Brewpub in Kenosha Wisconsin, and overtime grow the business to provide a chain of brewpub that share the Where and When mission to provide craft brewed beer, and beer infused menu item sin a warm inviting environment.

Visit my site to find out more about My vision and what I would like to bring to Kenosha, and eventually the rest of the world, at www.wwbrewco.com. 

Please help me supplement my initial capital to ensure an amazing experience at my brewpub. Our in house brewed beer and beer infused/inspired products will incorporate brief historical stories and limericks I know you will enjoy.

I hope to see you there!!

Thanks,

-JB

story:
About us:

MIMAI LAZULITE is a young, entrepreneurial partnership which creates bespoke, high quality and distinctive surfaces for feature walls, furniture and interiors. We specialise in verre églomisé (gilded glass) and Venetian plaster. We combine a contemporary look with traditional craftsmanship to deliver innovative finishes for commercial and private interiors.

Check our website here: MIMAI LAZULITE

We will be showcasing at the Clerkenwell Design Week in May and at the London Design fair in September.

Taking part in these fairs will enable us to reach a wider audience and also exhibit alongside many established designers. Using the visibility of these major events, we plan to reach new costumers and get the attention of larger interior design companies.

At Clerkenwell Design Week (CDW), we will be presenting our first range of églomisé box shelves together with gilded framed mirrors. We will also feature two large surface panels, one with gilded glass and one with Venetian plaster, designed exclusively for CDW. A selection of samples will also be available for visitors to learn firsthand about the possibilities these techniques offers to customers and interior design professionals. We will do a similar set up in September.

Your contributions will literally help us rising from the ground up.

One of our Venetian plaster wall creations:

Some gilded glass samples:

 

What We Need:

 

We are asking for £3000 in order to:

-Pay part of the exhibitions fees.

-Exhibitions insurances.

-Transport to the shows and back.

-Production costs.

-Production of your goodies, packaging and posting.

 

What do you get in exchange of your financial help:

 

The coaster: (yours might vary in colours, but you get the idea)

 

The églomisé frame: (might also vary in colours):

 

The Box Shelf, series 1:

​Series 1: 5 boxes.
​Eglomise mirror mounted on a phenolic black wooden box.
Outside measurements:
H: 368 mm, W: 368mm, D: 220 mm.
Inside measurements:
H: 350 mm, W: 350 mm, D: 175 mm.
Eglomise mirror:
 6, 9, 12 and 22 carat gold with a colored background.
Wall mounting: French cleat system.

The Box Shelf, series 2:

Series 2: 5 boxes.
Eglomise mirror mounted on a natural birch plywood box.
Outside measurements:
H: 368 mm, W: 368mm, D: 220 mm.
Inside measurements:
H: 350 mm, W: 350 mm, D: 175 mm.
Eglomise mirror:
silver and 12 carat gold with a coloured background.
Wall mounting: French cleat system.

Choose yours here: http://www.mimailazulite.com/the-boxes.html

And of course, if you are planning to attend any of both shows, we will be delighted to meet you in person and share a chat and a cup of coffee!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! SHARE SHARE SHARE...

Thank you everybody.

story:
You walk across the grass and 15 heads turn to watch and soft nickers fill the air. Black Beauty, Ceniza, Pitu and Thacker are just a couple of the names of the horses who work every day to save the lives of children. 
Vida y Esperanza is an equine therapy program for at risk youth in Cochabamba, Bolivia. According to a study conducted by Aldeas Infantiles SOS, more than 19,000 children have already, or are at-risk of losing parental care and finding themselves in the streets in the city of Cochabamba. 

Founded by Magaly Torres Reyes and her brother Jose Luis Torres Reyes in response to needs they saw in their own neighborhood, which is on the outskirts of Cochabamba’s western perimeter. They saw children and youth on the streets, without supervision or meaningful adult involvement in their lives. Some were working, washing windshields or doing juggling at intersections, and others were already involved in alcohol and drugs, particularly glue-sniffing. Many had already dropped out of school. their mission is to work with impoverished and at-risk children and youth (ages 8-18) to 1) assist with their immediate, direct needs and 2) provide hope and support for a better future.

The cornerstone of the project is the equine assisted therapy and why it is so successful are the 15 horses that work every day to guide the youth on their journey to a better future. 

For youth who struggle with substance abuse or addiction, and various other mental health problems such as behavioral issues, depression and anxiety, low self-esteem, and relationship difficulties, Equine Assisted Therapy can play a vital role in recovery. Caring for the horses and developing relationships with these animals who offer no judgment helps youth to heal, open up, and gain confidence in themselves.

My daughter was one of those youth before she entered the program 3 years ago so I know how important the work of the horses is and for that reason I am asking for support. It is the horses who do the important work and therefore this appeal is for them.  

We need to buy 2 weed whackers which cost a total of $1,400 to cut grass to feed the horses in rainy season when their usual source of food, oats is not available. If we can only raise half the money we will buy one weed whacker. The youth will then use the machines to cut grass in empty lots and green space around the city giving the horses a very inexpensive but nutritious source of food during the rainy season and beyond. 

So thanks for helping and know that 15 heads are looking at you and nickering thanks!!!

story:
About Hybrid Audio Technologies

www.hybrid-audio.com

Inspiration for Hybrid Audio Technologies sprouted as good friends sat in a coffee shop in Louisville, Kentucky, USA as we shared our collective disenchantment with the direction that the current high-end car audio speaker manufacturers were going with their products. At one point the question was posed ‘why don’t you just build the ultimate car audio speaker line and start your own company?’ So we did. And here we are today, producing products that are recognized around the world as the finest car audio speakers available, at any price.

In our nine year tenure, Hybrid Audio has amassed a long list of accolades from the media, dealers, and enthusiastic consumers that use and enjoy our products. And then there are organized sound quality competition results - the ultimate “litmus test” of a products efficacy against its competitors; cars equipped with Hybrid Audio Technologies products have won more North American and World Championships in the past seven years than all other front-stage speaker manufacturers combined. In fact, the highest-scoring sound quality competition vehicle of all time, in any format, in any part of the world is Scott Buwalda's (company founder) own personal show car which, naturally, utilizes Hybrid Audio Technologies products.

In short, our philosophy is to build products that are new and exciting, that have no equal, and are surpassed only by our commitment to honest-to-goodness customer service and guaranteed lifetime value.

Now that we have achieved the success we set out for in the high-end speaker marketplace, we now direct our attention to the high-end mobile audio amplifier marketplace.

Summary of Contribution

The goal of the Hybrid Audio Technologies amplifier program is to design and manufacture a new series of super high-end amplifiers to augment the Legatia LE speaker line from Hybrid Audio Technologies. At the cornerstone of the program, we will endeavor to create a product that will be recognized around the world as the finest mobile audio amplifiers available at any price, and to set the new benchmark for performance in this category.  This goal will be accomplished by employing both timeless and modern, cutting-edge techniques in amplifier design to ensure class-leading signal to noise ratio, stereo separation, power output, and discrete, tonally-neutral operation, in an aesthetically-pleasing package.

All design work is currently underway by a core group of two principal engineers, with a combined 50 years’ experience in 12-volt audio amplification.  Hybrid Audio Technologies has been actively working on the designs since October 2014.  The two designers of the project, whose names are synonymous in this field for creating mobile audio masterpieces, will be included as namesakes for credential marketing, perhaps even as a “signature” line-up of amplifiers.  

Planned Features the Legatia LE Amplifiers*

*subject to change during the product design process.

Obviously, we have attracted the interest of our future, and would-be competitors in this market, so we cannot release product details that would undermine our product launch (product sketches, dimensions, etc.).  That being said, here's what we can divulge:

Dual Mono (2-channel) Audiophile Amplifier (model name TBA) and Dual Stereo (4-channel) Audiophile Amplifier (model name TBA):

·  2-channel; 400 watts per channel @ 4 ohms stereo; true dual mono design (two power supplies).

·  4-channel; 200 watts per channel X 4 @ 4 ohms stereo, true dual stereo design (two power supplies).

·  Gold plated four-layer circuit board.  Gold plated or raw copper bus bars, no staple jumpers.

·  Custom relay out of PCB; surface-mount technology employed. 

·  Single Maxi fuse or Mini ANL fuse verses multiple ATC fuses.

·  No front-end crossovers for maximized S/N ratio; simpleton input stage with a focus on extremely high S/N ratio. Not having crossovers gives quite an advantage in the design; we can go balanced all the way to the power amplifier.

·  The preamp shall be an all J-FET fully balanced design with a servo to eliminate DC offset. This feeds the power amplifier directly via both inputs and the differential to single ended conversion happens in the power amplifier.

·  No remote bass control, with input selection and other preamp style filters removed to maximize S/N ratio and stereo separation.

·  Block terminals for power, binding posts for speaker connection.

·  Input sensitivity - 0.5V – 4V with individual gain pots. Bourne potentiometers and direct plane case grounding for input gain control, for improved S/N ratio.

·  Tiffany style ground unbalanced front end (RCA).

·  Higher frequency power supply (above 50k).

·  Hand-selected ultra-low ESR power supply filter caps.

·  Front end input 10K ohms (using 0.1% tolerance front end components on signal path for improved CMNR).

·  High bias design.

Anticipated Performance of the Legatia LE Amplifiers*

*subject to change during the product design process.

·  High-bias operation then switching to Class-GH topology at higher output levels.

·  Infinity stereo separation on two-channel design given dual power supplies.  Zero crosstalk. Virtually every manufacturer has gotten away from dual power supply designs, which we feel is a compromise in amplifier construction.  It is incredibly more expensive to build dual power supply amplifiers, but one that must be undertaken to create the world’s finest car audio amplifier.

·  Infinity stereo pair separation on four-channel design given dual power supplies.  Zero cross-talk between the two pairs of stereo two-channel outputs.

·  Exceed stated power outputs by 10%.

·  Signal to noise ratio approaching, if not exceeding 120 dB, anticipated to be the highest of any commercially-available amplifier.

·  The largest commercially-available dual mono amplifier as far as Class G/H power output.

·  The largest commercially-available dual stereo four-channel amplifier as far as Class G/H power output.

·  Industry leading aesthetics.

·  Completely transparent tonal operation.

·  Noise-free operation.

What We Need & What You Get

$120,000.00 USD is required.  This funding will be added to existing reserves to commence production. Hybrid Audio Technologies is hereby seeking contributors that see the benefit to this production, see an upside potential for the investment for the benefit of the industry and Hybrid Audio Technologies, and would be willing to share in the up-front costs, in exchange for re-payment in the form of handsome perks.

Any investment amount, up to the total necessary to commence production, is encouraged.  Even $1.00 at a time!

Availability is currently estimated to be late third quarter of 2015. However, it is impossible to know exact availability dates as of the writing of this proposal. Let it be known that the amplifiers will be produced as quickly as possible, while still ensuring superior performance and exceptional QA/QC.

In exchange for your investment, we have set up unique perks at various levels: $50.00, $150.00, $300.00, $400.00, $600.00, $1,000.00, $1,500.00, and $2,000.00.

All funding is encouraged.  If we don't reach our goal, we will supplement with existing investments, line of credit, and a healthy company growth pattern established for the past nine years (consecutive growth).

The Impact

Your investment contribution will enhance the ability of an American company to compete in this category, amidst a sea of European and Asian offerings.

Hybrid Audio Technologies is an Atlanta-based company, owned by an American citizen, and our successful track record of nine consecutive years of double or triple-digit growth ensures the success of our initiative.

Risks & Challenges

We have an amazing and growing market share both domestically and internationally.  Like any new project, there is risk.  But we have mitigated this risk to almost nil.  All of the "up-front" prototyping risk has been borne, and while there are anticipated challenges to bringing the devices to production, we have done it successfully for more than seventy (70) existing products we already manufacture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please get the word out on our initiative, and tell everyone to go and buy Hybrid Audio Technologies products!

· 
Higher
frequency power supply (above 50k).
· 
Hand-selected
ultra-low ESR power supply filter caps.
· 
Front
end input 10K ohms (using 0.1% tolerance front end components on signal path
for improved CMNR).
· 
High
bias design.
Anticipated Performance of the Legatia LE Amplifiers*
*subject to change during the product design
process.
· 
High-bias operation then switching to Class-GH
topology at higher output levels.
· 
Infinity stereo separation on two-channel design
given dual power supplies.  Zero
crosstalk. Virtually every manufacturer has gotten away from dual power supply
designs, which we feel is a compromise in amplifier construction.  It is incredibly more expensive to build dual
power supply amplifiers, but one that must be undertaken to create the world’s
finest car audio amplifier.
· 
Infinity stereo pair separation on four-channel
design given dual power supplies.  Zero
cross-talk between the two pairs of stereo two-channel outputs.
· 
Exceed stated power outputs by 10%.
· 
Signal to noise ratio approaching, if not exceeding
120 dB, anticipated to be the highest of any commercially-available amplifier.
· 
The largest commercially-available dual mono
amplifier as far as Class G/H power output.
· 
The largest commercially-available dual stereo four-channel
amplifier as far as Class G/H power output.
· 
Industry leading aesthetics.
· 
Completely transparent tonal operation.
· 
Noise-free operation.
What We Need &
What You Get
$120,000.00 USD is
required.  This funding will be added to
existing reserves to commence production. Hybrid Audio Technologies is hereby
seeking contributors that see the benefit to this production, see an
upside potential for the investment for the benefit of the industry and
Hybrid Audio Technologies, and would be willing to share in the up-front
costs, in exchange for re-payment in the form of handsome perks.
Any investment
amount, up to the total necessary to commence production, is encouraged.
 Even $1.00 at a time!
Availability is
currently estimated to be late third quarter of 2015. However, it is
impossible to know exact availability dates as of the writing of this proposal.
Let it be known that the amplifiers will be produced as quickly as
possible, while still ensuring superior performance and exceptional QA/QC.
In exchange for
your investment, we have set up unique perks at various levels: $50.00,
$150.00, $300.00, $400.00, $600.00, $1,000.00, $1,500.00, and $2,000.00.
All funding is
encouraged.  If we don't reach our goal, we will supplement with existing
investments, line of credit, and a healthy company growth pattern established
for the past nine years (consecutive growth).
The
Impact
Your investment
contribution will enhance the ability of an American company to compete in this
category, amidst a sea of European and Asian offerings.
Hybrid Audio
Technologies is an Atlanta-based company, owned by an American citizen, and our
successful track record of nine consecutive years of double or triple-digit
growth ensures the success of our initiative.
Risks &
Challenges
We have an amazing
and growing market share both domestically and internationally.  Like any
new project, there is risk.  But we have mitigated this risk to almost
nil.  All of the "up-front" prototyping risk has been borne, and
while there are anticipated challenges to bringing the devices to production,
we have done it successfully for more than seventy (70) existing products we
already manufacture. 
Other
Ways You Can Help
You may not be able
to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please get the word
out on our initiative, and tell everyone to go and buy Hybrid Audio
Technologies products!

story:
You Can Be Among the First War on the Rocks Members

We are taking our next big step and want you to be a part of it! My name is Ryan Evans. I am the founder and editor-in-chief of War on the Rocks, a digital outlet on strategy, defense, and foreign affairs. 

I launched War on the Rocks three years ago because we needed a dedicated platform for public discussion featuring experienced, authentic, authoritative voices. Since then, War on the Rocks has become the outlet of choice for people who have served in government, served in the military, worked abroad, and studied conflict and international affairs in depth. Our daily, free content is widely read in the natsec community and beyond. We are making an impact.

The challenge I face now is how to keep delivering the content you love for free while also allowing War on the Rocks to sustain itself. To do that, we will soon be launching a low-cost, $5 monthly membership plan. Through my interactions with you, I learned that what you want is more opportunities to interact with experts like the folks who write for us, as well as others who — like you — are passionate about national security. So that’s what this new membership is going to do.

So what are the two new services that will form this premium plan for members of the War on the Rocks tribe?

Every week, I will be hosting a War-Cast: a live webcast with War on the Rocks experts, for members only. The experts will rotate based on what’s going on in the world. If you are listening live, you can submit questions for us to answer. If you’re busy, you can watch or listen to it later. It’s like our podcast series, but better, more regular, and more exclusive.

The second service is a gated social network called the War Hall using a new tool called Ryver.  Those of us in the “natsec” community use different tools to interact. We all get too many emails and the tech is limited.  Twitter is noisy and, for some conversations, too public, and there are too many trolls. Facebook is fine but how often do we want to subject our high school friends to our thoughts on the war against the Islamic State?  This gated forum combines all the upsides of Twitter, Facebook, and e-mail and avoids the downsides.  And your favorite natsec experts, including many of our writers, are already in the War Hall waiting for you.

So why am I holding this two-week Indiegogo campaign? I wanted to give an opportunity to you to be the first-in on this membership. Only a limited number of people can access it this year. If you want to get involved, this is your chance. We will open the War Hall and start the War-Casts for members only shortly after this campaign ends. During the remaining presidential debates, the election, the transition season that follows, and as the new administration comes into office, your favorite experts on national security will be there providing real time analysis and interacting with members directly on the issues you care about. Our weekly War-Casts will keep you up to date on what you need to know as a member of the national security community. 

If you want the benefits of this membership starting in October, sign up now by donating to this campaign. If instead you are happy to wait until the membership is available to everyone in January, but you want a discounted rate, you can also pre-register for that here. The different perks of this campaign are explained on this page.

This is also an opportunity for those of you who are passionate about War on the Rocks to show us a little love. Please consider giving above and beyond what just a membership costs. Keeping War on the Rocks content free has been hard. It’s also been worth it, but it’s been possible only through your generosity. I am hoping we can tap into that generous spirit again.

Thanks for reading War on the Rocks and enjoy what comes next!

NOTE: Make sure you select which perk you want.

A special thanks to Phil Murphy for editing our video and adding its most creative elements, which made this successful campaign possible. Contact Phil for all creative video editing: murphy@theinvisiblehand.com

MUSIC CREDIT: Boulevard St Germain by Jahzzar

story:
Short Summary

Chris’ Bakery is part of Oak Harbor’s history. We will bring back to the community your place  to grab that favorite baked treat while you can sit and chat with friends and family while feeling comfort in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. It will be your place to get high quality items baked from scratch such as cookies, donuts, cakes and breads among other things.

We need your help for the down payment on this building.
 

  • I am Patrick, the son of Chris and Betty, the founders of the family dynasty. I have worked side by side with my dad for many years. I like making lotsa dough.
  • Hi, I'm Meghan Vasquez, Chris and Betty's second grandchild and Patrick's daughter. My vision for the bakery is to bring back the love and passion my grandparents had for our community. Betty always had a warm smile on her face as she greeted everyone as the doors opened each day. She has big shoes to fill but I plan on working hard to fill them! 
  • With all the changes in the food industry in the last few decades, I see the need to have quality craft baked goods baked by another generation.
  • With your help we will  be your place  to grab that favorite baked treat while you can sit and chat with friends and family while feeling comfort in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. 
  • It will also be the place to get high quality items baked from scratch such as cookies, donuts, cakes and breads among other things .
  • We want to involve the local culinary schools in order to give the students  broader education in retail baking.
  • Classes will be offered to those that would like to learn some basics in baking.
  • We will also give to the Help House and any other local charities and shelters.

What We Need & What You Get

In order tor restore  Chris’ Bakery with your favorite baked items will require plenty of dough. We need a substantial down payment by November 30, 2016.

There are several considerations of why we want to purchase this location for Chris’ Bakery.

1. No lease, means never to have to move the heavy equipment

2. No increase of lease

3. Building has 4 tenants that help pay the mortgage. Each have agreed to a new lease.

4. No parking issue

5. Location, location, location

Financial Considerations.

Currently there are 4 businesses in the building that generate $6300 monthly. Two want to expand into space we do not need. That will provide an additional $2,200 per month. Now that will provide Chris' Bakery a space for no cost. The projected loan for the building on $650000 is approximately $5200. That is after a down payment of over $200000.

Considering the cost of equipment to start a modern bakery is over $125000, we have a long way to go. 

 

The Impact

 Hans K. Christensen (Chris) started Chris’ Bakery over 50 years ago and it grew to be a special place for the community. Chris and Betty treated their customers like family and we plan to continue that tradition. With the help of our experience of baking and decorating cakes we will be following in their footsteps.

Chris' Bakery operated in Seattle from 1948 to 1968, then in Oak Harbor from 1968 to 1998. Now we want to open in 2017 and be open for many more years with the second and third generation bringing you high quality artisan baked goods. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is actually acquiring the building as an investment property. Nothing better than operating a business without a high lease payment. The more money we have as a down payment, the more favorable the bank will see this as a good risk.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out to your family and friends. Share us on all the social media you use and tell your neighbors. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
As anyone who knows me or has ever known me will tell you - I'm not a runner. I'm not even an exerciser. I'm the kid who skipped PE every week. Up until July 1st 2014 I had never been for a run. On October 5th 2014 I will be running 10k through Glasgow in order to raise money for a great cause - the Greater Maryhill Foodbank. 


As much as I love the people who are involved with the foodbank and the work they do, I wish they didn't exist. I wish they didn't HAVE to exist but that's the sad reality of the country that we live in. Of course the bigger cause is to change this - but right now, people need food and the money for that food has to be raised - so I'm lacing up my trainers and hoping that you'll all open up your wallets in return.

story:
Short Summary

Scouts is the UK's biggest mixed youth organisation. We change lives by offering 6- to 25-year-olds fun and challenging activities, unique experiences, everyday adventure and the chance to help others so that we make a positive impact in communities. But we can only do this with the help from donations so that we can keep the groups running.

Scouts helps children and young adults reach their full potential. Scouts develop skills including teamwork, time management, leadership, initiative, planning, communication, self-motivation, cultural awareness and commitment. We help young people to get jobs, save lives and even change the world.

Unfortunately our local scout hut, at 25th St Johns Wakefield, is in disrepair and urgently needs some work doing to it. As of today we have had to close the scout hut as it is a health and safety hazard. We are hoping to get enough funds to have the floor replaced which will allow us to reopen as soon as possible.

What We Need:

What we need the funding for:
£1500 - the floor needs ripping up as the floorboards are rotten and we need it reflooring and have new vinyl flooring put down.
£2000 - New windows and doors - most of the windows are boarded up because the have been smashed and we cant afford to repair them and the doors are not very secure, especially the firedoor.
£1000 - the walls need reboarding and plastering and painting
£500 - Sort out the over grown garden so it can be used for the children.

The Impact

By helping us repair the hut it not only is providing a safe place for children to be a part of something and keeping them off the streets and also the local community could benefit from using the hut as well. We could also run fundraising events to maintain the hut when it is safe for people to use the hut again.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute financially and you live in the area:

Perhaps you could donate some of your time and come down and help us with some of the smaller tasks, or if you could share this page that would help.

Thank you for your time and donation.
Yours in Scouting
Wakefield 25th St Johns Scouts

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Michael Hagedorn, and I'm writing on behalf of the 'Villagers', as we call ourselves, here in Portland Oregon, USA, a city that is known for a lot of grassroots ventures including the Portland Bonsai Village... a hopeful gang of highly trained bonsai artists trying to share their art with the world.

Several of us studied bonsai in Japan as apprentices, and all together we put in something like 16 billion years (actually just 16 years, but that's still a rather large number) over there training under masters. In all there are nearly a dozen of us here in Portland doing various things related to bonsai, and several more are going to be joining us soon.

See some bonsai- If you don't know much about bonsai, take a minute to look at some:

http://crataegus.com/portfolio/

And definitely see our ridiculous video, above, which clearly proves we're not actors posing as bonsai artists. The outtakes / bloopers are maybe the best part, though, and you can see that in the Gallery...


How does this help?

The Villagers would like to share the beautiful art of bonsai with you. Your contribution will help in promoting bonsai outside of Japan. By helping us form the Portland Bonsai Village, you’re essentially making a huge contribution to education, art, a local economy, and the livelihood of nearly a dozen artisans, once our nifty programs are underway.

This is a big dream project. I know we are all contributing now to Nepal and other places struck by disaster where money is needed, I did so myself. But we also need other kinds of hope, so please support us, too.


UPDATE! 

We've created a beautiful website with the funds raised by this campaign on Indiegogo, which you can see here:

http://www.portlandbonsaivillage.com/#welcome-1

We're so excited to have such a beautiful online home...our sincerest thanks for all donors! 

AND YET ANOTHER UPDATE!

First of all, thank you all for contributing to what is a successful and growing community effort. The campaign has been wildly successful, more than we dreamed possible. And we're now building on that to prove your trust in us.

Something new:

The Village Grants. As our primary and flagship program, the Village Grants assist local bonsai artists to bring their art to the public by funding engaging, educational projects. In January 2016, two of our Villagers, Matt Reel and Bobby Curttright, dreamed up a display show as an educational event, and will be receiving a Village Grant to assist them in their endeavors.

We are essentially a non-profit, and with very low administrative costs (annual website hosting and accounting) almost all of your current donations will go to fund educational programs. Thank you all for making this vision a reality. It is now truly that: A bonsai community. And that's a new reality.


What will we do?

Along with our flagship program, the Village Grants, which are offered to Villagers who have dreamed up engaging, educational programs, here are things we'd like to offer in the future:

  • The Village Campus: Our ‘Bonsai Flight’, or sampler, as it were. Our doors open during the Campus in intensive mini-classes. Sample our various teachers and learn the art of bonsai~
  • The Village Co-Op: Products around the Village will be offered for sale at the Co-Op: Bonsai, pots, stands, tools, and everything else of the art ~
  • Village Dormitory: Our long-term goal of a dwelling in Portland where students, be they long-term apprentices or short-term students, may stay while they study with Villagers. Maybe that will be you!
  • Village Elementary: The Village brings bonsai into classrooms like Head Start to nurture the seed of beauty and responsibility in youth ~
  • Village Tours: Private and semi-private tours are offered to the nurseries and studios of Villagers to see them at work. We've already run a few, and they were a smash hit!


Can we do this?

Although we're quite a friendly mob of people, we're also pretty serious about what we do...check out a few of our websites:
crataegus.com
austinheitzmanfurniture.com
reelbonsai.wordpress.com

bonsaimirai.com

I've also been writing about the Village for a while on my blog:

http://crataegus.com/2013/10/22/the-portland-bonsai-village-tours-continue/

http://crataegus.com/2013/07/31/scenes-from-the-very-first-portland-bonsai-village-tour/

…and here's one of my wonky earlier posts about the Village, if you need a laugh today:

http://crataegus.com/2012/11/06/portland-bonsai-village-gets-on-the-design-board/


What inspired the Village idea? 

The Village was inspired by Omiya Bonsai Village in Japan. Omiya’s history is the stuff of legend. Starting in the early 1920’s about 20 bonsai masters went to Omiya to build their gardens. With so many bonsai professionals in one place, Japan now had a ‘home’ for bonsai. Anyone interested in the art knew that they could find a tree or a professional service in Omiya Bonsai Village. Such a large flow of customers to Omiya brought in business for everyone, took their work up a notch, and they were able to develop specialties. Although many of the nurseries are now closed, some of the most famous ones are still there. 

Portland Villagers like Matt Reel, Ryan Neil, and Michael Hagedorn apprenticed under masters who themselves studied in Omiya Bonsai Village, and so Portland Villagers are essentially recreating the situation that nurtured their teachers in forming a new Village in the United States. We are the 3rd generation from Omiya’s founders, now far beyond the shores of Japan.


What do we need?

The money you donate to the Portland Bonsai Village will go to:

  • Village Grants, offered to Villagers who have dreamed up engaging, educational bonsai programs (the lion's share of donations received currently goes to this)
  • Running our future programs, listed above 
  • A great website (we've wooed top-notch designer Kathy Wu, who has done gorgeous work for big brands like Nike, Intel, Bridgeport Brewing, Jenny Craig, and the LA Marathon.) (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Branding (Kathy) (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Logo design (More Kathy) (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Passports for the tours (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Professional photography for the website (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Deposits for bus tours (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Booth rentals (paid for, THANK YOU)
  • Banner and promotional materials (paid for, THANK YOU)

Your contribution will help jumpstart us and will bring about great new bonsai programs that you can take part in. (thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you)
