story:
Hi,
My name is Jenn and I love making jewelry. My dream was to own my own business. Now, I finally have the chance to make this a reality.
I started my home-based jewelry business 2 yrs ago.

Since then, I have made a lot of sales on new and handmade items but now it is time to take this adventure to a whole new level. My Daughter Kat is getting involved. When she was 2 yrs old, she was diagnosed with Aspergers (a form of autism) and since then has made many strides to overcome her disability. Now, at age 19 we find it is not easy for her to fit in to the regular workforce due to her anxiety and  Ibs (irritable bowel syndrome) so I suggested that maybe she can help me to make a bigger business and one day be able to run her own jewelry store :)



The Campaign

At this moment, we are saving money ($7000 so far) for the start up costs to open a small jewelry boutique. This is not going to be a fast goal I believe it will take about 9 months to 1 yr to be realized but it will be well worth the effort :)
The store will have in it's collection handmade items by my daughter, myself and other community artists. The store will be run by my daughter(Kat) and myself and other members of our disabled community. We will also be having an area in the shop where people can come in and make their own jewelry pieces. There needs to be more awareness in the world that our disabled members of society are able to accomplish great things and we need to help them. So by opening a jewelry store we can help our community by creating a few more jobs and bring more commerce into our city as well as helping to raise money for the Autism Society and several other organizations that need our help.


Our expected operating expenses:

  If a financial contribution isn't possible for you right now, you can still help. We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use.......whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy.
Thank you, thank you, thank you!


Referral Contest

As an incentive for your help, Refer as many people as you can and once their contributions total:
$1000 - the referrer gets a free bracelet of good quality. 
$2500 - the referrer gets a free necklace of good quality.
$5000 - the referrer gets a free sterling silver 4 piece set.



The Perks

We believe in paying it forward, every profit & donation we receive 5% of it will be donated to the Autism Society. This is a wonderful organization that needs our support too :)




This is where we want to have our boutique!




With every donation, we will send you a piece of jewelry from our collection as a thank you for your support & so you can remember us.


After you receive our jewelry, if you could share a picture with us that would be wonderful.  Together, we can make a difference!
Thank you for your help. :)
Sincerely,
Jenn & Kat
(Kat's Jewelry Box)

story:
“What we will do for love will always be far more powerful than what we will do for money. What we can do together will always be far greater than what we can do alone. And when we cultivate the heart of giftivism within ourselves, our companies and our communities, we begin to unleash our true prosperity.”

—Pavithra Mehta, Giftivism: Reclaiming the Priceless

EBMC Dana

The East Bay Meditation Center operates on gift economics, generosity-based “All-Dana” model. Dana is the ancient Pali language word describing generosity arising effortlessly from deep gratitude. Our belief is that everyone has an inherent capacity for generosity, and that together we can co-create a welcoming and thriving spiritual community based in the transformative values of abundance, trust, and connection, rather than scarcity, fear, and separation.

We charge no set registration fees to attend our events (except fundraising programs), and EBMC receives very little outside funding. We rely on joyful reciprocity within our community expressed in different ways, as people are moved to give of their resources, time, and skills to EBMC, according to their ability. In a spirit of paying it forward, the generosity of those before you have made it possible for us to offer the teachings today, and your generosity in the present moment will allow us to continue offerings these teachings into the future.

What is Dana?

Dana is the ancient Pali language word describing Generous Giving, which arises effortlessly from deep gratitude. Many of the teachings offered at EBMC have been offered for over 2,500 years in parts of Asia following an All-Dana model. Monks and nuns offer teachings out of generosity, while the community supports the teachers and the centers, generously giving to the level of their ability.

EBMC is following that tradition by offering its programs with no set registration fees. The practice of Dana invites us to participate in a world where the expression of gratitude and generosity help to keep the wheel of the Dharma turning. EBMC also draws on the indigenous value of Reciprocity, as a way to maintain balance and harmony in community. This principle honors the interconnection of all beings and encourages a heart inclined toward appreciation, joyous contribution, flow of resources, and right relationship with one another.

Though we do not charge set fees, EBMC programs do not come for free. Here is what the approximate costs are to sponsor our different programs at EBMC:

  • EBMC’s costs for a One-Day Retreat, Class, or Workshop: $1,770
  • EBMC’s costs for an Evening Class Series: $885 per class
  • EBMC’s costs for a Weekly Sitting Group: $335 per week

EBMC is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.  All donations made to EBMC by check or online are tax-deductible. We encourage and rely on joyful generosity to be expressed in many different ways, as people are moved to give according to their resources and means.

story:
Fresh Jamz on the Lake

When: July 30 1pm-5pm
Where:  Lake Merritt Amphitheater 

DJ Delgado and I have been throwing the Fresh Jamz party every month for the past eight years. Fresh Jamz celebrates the work of the socially conscious good folks of Oakland: teachers, educators, non-profiters, public defenders, artists and more. After a long month of this challenging work, it's time to get together with like-minded folks and let loose to the freshest jamz.

For July, we're celebrating in the sun. Now who doesn't love a fun summer party at beautiful Lake Merritt? We want to provide a space for folks to build upon the positive energy of Oakland. Throwing a large scale party at the Lake requires costly permits and of course, food, drinks, and DJs. This is where we need your community spirit and partnership. Chipping in a few bucks will help cover the cost for all of these essential party items.

Get the newest Coozie and latest Fresh Jamz Tee

Contributions will help pay for Lake Merritt permits ($500), food, drinks, equipment and DJs.

  • $5 gets you the newest gray and turquoise Fresh Jamz Coozie
  • $10 gets you the Coozie + DJ Odiaka's latest mixtape
  • $35 gets you the latest floral design Fresh Jamz tee 
  • $100 gets you the ultimate Fresh Jamz Package: coozie, tee, mixtape and drink of choice


See you at the Lake on Saturday, July 30!

And feel free to spread the Fresh Jamz word.

story:
A Little Introduction.

First lets give you a little bit of information about us!

Rhys Watkins & Adam Edinborough are the beer loving duo who grew the Cardiff born & bred Crafty Devil Brewery from a humble home-brew shed in their back garden to Untappd's number 1 rated brewery in Wales. And they did this not with big money from huge investors or rich benefactors. They did this by doing things RIGHT. By wearing their love for great beer on their sleeves and putting in some damn hard work.

Chris 'Beardface' Rowlands is a seasoned (and hairy) pub landlord who has worked most of his life trying to change the drinking landscape of Cardiff away from massed produced soulless products chugged down in boring 'cater to the masses' bars to high quality, independent minded pubs that sell great beers that are meant to be enjoyed in a place that puts service and quality first. 

 

So what are we going to do?

We're going to open BEELZEBUBS! A truly independent pub designed to put great beer, great food and great service on the top of the agenda. It will be Crafty Devil's first City Center Pub but more than that, it will be a beacon of great beer, cider, spirits and wine that we hope will become a haven for the people like us, folks who love pubs and socialising but have become disenfranchised with the depressing state of the modern pub.

This campaign is SO important to us as we've worked, drank and endured countless sub-standard, homogenised bars that are run by people who don't see customers as people to be welcomed, served and appreciated but as walking pound-signs and numbers on a P&L sheets that we just feel VERY strongly that it's time independent businesses retake the high street!

So that's what we plan on doing.

Right here.

Right now.

 

How do you come in.

We've already secured our license, the property and a fantastic team ready to serve you but as we said at the start, we're not the wealthiest folk in town by any means! Although we ARE lucky enough to have a number of independent minded, beer loving folk (like you!) who have kindly invested in us and are helping us make this dream a reality.

What we need now is the last little push to ensure we can decorate and re-furbish the pub to the standards the people of Cardiff deserve! (nobody likes sitting on a cheap, wonky chair!)

Your investment will be used to refurbish our unit on High Street, right opposite Cardiff Castle and help turn it into Cardiff's newest independent public house.

We will be using your investment to source and purchase some epic beers, amazing ciders and some of the best spirits and whiskeys on the planet.

And we will also be using your investment to hire our amazing team that, unlike our competition, will all be paid the true Living Wage, not minimum wage. Why? Because we believe in the living wage foundation and we believe that happy, secure, rewarded staff pour the best beer and give the best service.

 

What We Need & What You Get.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are after £15,000 to help finish the final touches to our humble, lovely little pub.
  • For that we are going to be giving you lovely folks free beer, a discount for life and access to a whole host of other events and occasions we'll be running just for you.
  • If for any reason we don't get to £15,000 you can rest assured that every penny will still be going towards Beelzebubs! We just might have to wait a month or two to buy the REALLY comfy chairs.

 

The Impact.

Rest assured, this is not your every day pub or bar. We're Independent, service driven, quality led and HUNGRY! Why? Because we're customers just like you! Cardiff DESERVES more independent businesses and right now High Street is enjoying a huge resurgence of them as the bigger companies stagnate and fail, younger, fresher entrepreneurs and passionate business owners like ourselves snatch the ball and run with it.

  • This project is designed to reward YOU. The socialising, food loving, beer drinking people of Cardiff. You are contributing to your own happiness and helping Cardiff break free of the mass producing doldrums it's found itself in for decades.
  • This isn't a risk. Crafty Devil has grown year on year and provided Cardiff with some of it's freshest, best beers ever. And Chris Rowlands has set up, ran and grown some of the biggest beer pubs in Cardiff and London successfully year in year out. We know what we're doing. We're just fed up of doing it for millionaires and boards of Directors. We want to do it for YOU.

 

What are the risks and challenges?

We value Transparency above everything else and we believe if you're going to ask someone to put their money on the line they better know what the risks are.

Like all new businesses, the biggest risk of all is failing in year one and running into bankruptcy. I think we all agree that's a pretty big risk! But we're not afraid of it. We're meeting it head on! Adam & Rhys joined forces with Chris for that very reason. He has a long track record of taking under-performing pubs and turning them into fantastic, successful businesses. From Cardiff to London and back again he's delivered growth and fiscal success wherever he runs.

He knows exactly what he's doing. We all do. We're just fed up of doing it for millionaires and boards of Directors. We want to do it for YOU and the people of Cardiff!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's ok! We'd never expect anyone to put themselves into debt on our account. But just because you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Beelzebubs!
  • Tell your friends and colleagues who you think will enjoy our new business the most!
  • Share this post EVERYWHERE by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Even come down to the site in January and just say hello! We'll be covered in dust and dirt and will be greatful for the pleasant company!

And that's all there is to it!

We are after £15,000 to help finish the final touches to our humble, lovely little pub.
For that we are going to be giving you lovely folks free beer, a discount for life and access to a whole host of other events and occasions we'll be running just for you.
If for any reason we don't get to £15,000 you can rest assured that every penny will still be going towards Beelzebubs! We just might have to wait a month or two to buy the REALLY comfy chairs.

 
The Impact.

Rest assured, this is not your every day pub or bar. We're Independent, service driven, quality led and HUNGRY! Why? Because we're customers just like you! Cardiff DESERVES more independent businesses and right now High Street is enjoying a huge resurgence of them as the bigger companies stagnate and fail, younger, fresher entrepreneurs and passionate business owners like ourselves snatch the ball and run with it.

This project is designed to reward YOU. The socialising, food loving, beer drinking people of Cardiff. You are contributing to your own happiness and helping Cardiff break free of the mass producing doldrums it's found itself in for decades.
This isn't a risk. Crafty Devil has grown year on year and provided Cardiff with some of it's freshest, best beers ever. And Chris Rowlands has set up, ran and grown some of the biggest beer pubs in Cardiff and London successfully year in year out. We know what we're doing. We're just fed up of doing it for millionaires and boards of Directors. We want to do it for YOU.

 

What are the risks and challenges?
We value Transparency above everything else and we believe if you're going to ask someone to put their money on the line they better know what the risks are.
Like all new businesses, the biggest risk of all is failing in year one and running into bankruptcy. I think we all agree that's a pretty big risk! But we're not afraid of it. We're meeting it head on! Adam & Rhys joined forces with Chris for that very reason. He has a long track record of taking under-performing pubs and turning them into fantastic, successful businesses. From Cardiff to London and back again he's delivered growth and fiscal success wherever he runs.
He knows exactly what he's doing. We all do. We're just fed up of doing it for millionaires and boards of Directors. We want to do it for YOU and the people of Cardiff!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, and that's ok! We'd never expect anyone to put themselves into debt on our account. But just because you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help!

Get the word out and make some noise about Beelzebubs!
Tell your friends and colleagues who you think will enjoy our new business the most!
Share this post EVERYWHERE by using the Indiegogo share tools!
Even come down to the site in January and just say hello! We'll be covered in dust and dirt and will be greatful for the pleasant company!

And that's all there is to it!

story:
Now is the time for Community Mediation in St. Louis

The events of summer and autumn 2014 have highlighted major divisions within the St. Louis community.  We mourn the death of Mike Brown and lament the violence, rioting, and mistrust between citizens and law enforcement in the St. Louis Community.  We regret the impact it has had on Ferguson, especially.  Mediated dialogue between citizens and between citizens and law enforcement will be an essential part in rebuilding the trust and relationships necessary for the healing process.  

If each person that was referred to us in this past year would donate $5, and each person who attended a mediation would donate $10, we would be most of the way toward our goal.  If we were to consider the costs saved, whether they be legal fees, potential investigations, fines, enforcement costs, we would meet our goal many times over.   Mediation saves money, but mediation requires resources.

Community Mediation Offers a Peaceable Alternative to Ramped Up Law Enforcement

The goal of community mediation, in all its forms, is to make sure that all parties are heard.  Community Mediation Services of St. Louis has offered mediation between citizens in St. Louis for more than a decade.  We are one of the few community mediation centers to offer both Neighborhood Mediation and Police-Citizen Mediation.  We make it our mission to provide mediation services at no charge to St. Louis residents.  Time and again, we have found that when people feel they have been heard, they are often prepared to set about the work of resolving differences and moving forward.

Community Mediation Services of St. Louis Must Expand to Serve Ferguson, Other Municipalities

Although Community Mediation Services is well established in St. Louis, we need more mediators to meet predicted demands.  In order to effectively serve the city of St. Louis, our mediators must look like the population they serve.  We need to expand our volunteer base to include mediators from all over the City of St. Louis and the Metropolitan Area.  

In addition to St. Louis City, we are active in Bellefontaine Neighbors, St. Ann, and Ferguson.  Our goal is to recruit mediators from each of these municipalities.

Your Contribution Helps Fund Mediator Training

As part of CMS's efforts to expand services, we are now accepting applications for our next mediation training session, to be held in January and February of 2015.  We place strong emphasis on providing our mediators with the professional training they need to serve as good listeners and conversation facilitators.  Tuition for this next training will be $400 per person.  Because income levels vary throughout the city, we need to help make training affordable to everyone, and to make volunteering possible for more people.  Each $10 contribution will provide 1 hour of training.

Your Contribution Helps People of Lower Income Volunteer

We are an entirely volunteer based organization.  Volunteering as a mediator is a privilege dependent on reliable transportation and sufficient resources to offer the time required for mediation.  We recognize that not all good mediator candidates can afford the transportation or time on their own.  It is therefore also our hope to offer stipends to lower income volunteers to help cover transportation and childcare costs.

story:
We are the Gearheads, team #5521.

We are part of an awesome STEM education program called "First Lego League".

We have been working on 2 big projects this year: programing a robot to solve a certain number of challenges on an obstacle course, and coming up with an original solution to a real world problem.

We developed a research question: "How can we help High School students learn about careers they love so they can save time and money in college?"

The problem is kids are making decisions that will permanently impact their life when they enter college. Many of them have no idea what their talents OR interests really are. They have little real world work experience. They tend to choose careers based only on what they are familiar with.


Our Solution:

Career Kickstart: "Kick Your Career Into High Gear!"

  1. Explore all career options available

    1. Learn about the different career fields

  2. Discover your talents and interests

    1. Take talent and interest inventories

  3. Choose career fields that are a great fit

    1. In 9th and 10th grade do job shadowing in your top 4 career fields

  4. Specialize in your career field of interest

    1. In 11th and 12th grade do weeklong unpaid internships in your top 2 career fields to provide in-depth learning where interests, abilities, and career fields intersect

Our program is unique because it systematically helps kids learn where their talents, interests, and available career fields intersect. This allows them to enter college with a clear goal and dream, which is one of the biggest indicators of college success.


Structure: A four year High School program that would be supported by a local youth organization that is very connected with local businesses AND kids. An example would be the Boys and Girls Club or a similar organization.

Local Business Involvement: Specific advertising and promotion is offered for businesses that are involved in the program. Businesses support the program because of the benefits of having a future workforce with this kind of background. A “directory” of businesses in the different career areas is available, so students can find a good match for their interests.

We shared our idea with:


Ron Ramos/ Staff of the Valley Boys and Girls Club to explain benefits of our program for the kids they work with.

The JA and Kathryn Albertsons Foundation. Based on their enthusiasm, we are continuing communication to see if they could help implement our idea.

The Lewiston High School, explaining how it would benefit their students.

Will Boyd of the Homeschool Institute of Science

Importance of our Research Project:

With the right tools, students can use their college years to prepare for a career that is fulfilling for them and uses their talents to benefit others.

We are crowdfunding on Indiegogo for a $1,000 grant to award to an organization that will implement all or part of our idea.


At least two of the four organizations we shared our idea with have expressed a strong interest in looking for ways to implement it practically. We are middle school students, so we can only pursue this project for so long, then we have to focus on other things, like Junior High and High School! But we feel our idea has real practical value, and your support will help it happen in our community!

story:
Help give deserving Edmontonians a pumpkin pie this Thanksgiving!

With a $6 donation, you can buy a pie for the Edmonton Food Bank.

We hope to raise enough to give 1000 pies this year. Help us reach our goal!!

Donations can be made directly here or to giveedmontonapie@shaw.ca through an Interac/bank e-transfer.

story:
Short Summary

Northeast Oyster Company is an Oyster and Wine bar built from raw space in Mamaroneck,NY 20 miles north east of Manhattan. I am just about ready to open, pending final, sorted inspections. Our focus is serving oysters harvested from all the coastal states from New York to Canada. This campaign will help fund purchasing and operating capital. I have over 25 years experience in the restaurant, oyster/wine bar and retail wine business. Our location and space is small enough to run by myself with one to two servers and big enough to do strong volume, perfect for our business model. It's designed to be a simple, inexpensive start-up. Additionally we installed a great sound system, with a very eclectic music selection, which will set us apart from all our competition. Simply put: great oysters, wine,beer, music and service will clearly make us unique to the area. This is a Social Enterprise prototype and mentoring program where I can help other budding entrepreneurs open their own businesses. Your support will help me help mentor the people who are challenged in getting their ideas off the ground with financing being the biggest roadblock. If I can do this, I can pay it forward to those with big ideas and dreams who have no possibility of getting financed. Your help will, through this medium, allow me to show, mentor and guide those who have thought that this process of raising money is unattainable and unthinkable, is a possibility and achievable. My goals are for this business to spawn another oyster bar first,a wholesale oyster distribution company second, and a wholesale/retail organic produce company using local/regional suppliers third.  Simply put, a small retail space, a walk-in refrigerator and a truck are the major parts needed to get started. These businesses will be created with the intention of developing aspiring entrepreneurs into business owners. I am already working with two potential candidates who want to open their own businesses. 
What We Need & What You Get

Most of the money raised will go to wine purchasing. Having enough money to purchase wine at the top discount level is very important because our wine prices will be very low compared to our competition. I feel most restaurants and bars charge too much yet our pricing will be 25-50% lower than our competition. Furthermore, we can still be quite profitable because we don't have the huge expense of a kitchen payroll. The funding will help move us to profitability sooner and ultimately help others faster as well.

The Impact

I know from personal experience how hard it is to raise money to open a business. I have planned this business with the idea of duplicating it by building it myself (with the help of an experienced carpenter) and keeping it simple and easy to operate, so when the right person comes along we can open another one with that person eventually taking over as majority owner. I am very motivated by the plan that I can help others own their own business.  

Most importantly, Oysters clean the water, remove nitrogen, accelerate denitrification, enhance water clarity, promote eelgrass survival, and provide excellent habitat for myriad juvenile fish and crustaceans. Check out the Billion Oyster Project.By 2030, one billion live oysters will be distributed around 100 acres of reefs, making the Harbor once again the most productive waterbody in the North Atlantic and reclaiming its title as the oyster capital of the world  and  http://blog.nature.org/science/2013/09/10/resto... and  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j8ViaskDSeI   for more.

Risks & Challenges

I have been in the restaurant business for more than  25 years as a bartender, manager and owner. I shucked oysters at the Union Oyster House, full time for three years. I have owned a retail wine store and a wine bar, both in Westchester County NY. I have been a General Manger at two very high volume retail stores, Boston Market and a Fairway Wine Store. I feel with my track record and experience, this venture can be quite profitable. The rent is low ($2200.00 per month) and even if business is slow I can run the business by myself and if need be can work part-time at another job in the morning, before opening at 2 p.m.

Other Ways You Can Help

By reading this far you might be an aspiring entrepreneur with similar ideas, so I urge you to pass this along to your friends and contacts.You might learn something one way or another.This only works by getting the word out to large numbers of people. Thanks !

By reading this far you might be an aspiring entrepreneur with similar ideas, so I urge you to pass this along to your friends and contacts.You might learn something one way or another.This only works by getting the word out to large numbers of people. Thanks !

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to the FU Campaign!   This is Fitness Urbano’s first ever Campaign in crowd funding.

Luis Chirinos and Kevin McCullough are co-owners of Fitness Urbano and we have collectively lived in San Francisco for more than three decades. Together we have 20 years of experience operating businesses in the health and fitness industry. 

We know that every person comes from a different level of fitness with varying skill sets and conditions and each has unique needs in achieving their specific fitness goals. Finding a gym that is truly focused on helping and motivating individuals toward their goals can be challenging. Large chain gyms mostly view their clients as a monthly membership fee; measuring success by more memberships sold rather than individual client achievements. And small studios typically need to limit their focus to a single technique or singular form of workout; not able to address a client’s overall fitness needs.

At Fitness Urbano’s we will provide a wide range of services focused on addressing our client’s specific training needs.  At the core of our service offerings will be our open layout workout area, designed and equipped with functional training methods in mind.  This is where independent personal trainers will develop training programs and provide motivation for our clients, helping them achieve their fitness goals. At Fitness Urbano we also view our personal trainers as our clients.  In addition to providing them with a top notch training facility to host sessions with their clients, we are dedicated to helping them grow their individual businesses.  We do this by keeping hosting fees low and by providing no cost referrals and no cost marketing assistance.

Another major component of Fitness Urbano’s service offerings will include the construction of a 1500 sq ft group exercise studio. Here our clients will benefit from the expertise and motivation of our skilled instructors and the support of the group dynamic. We’ll offer the hottest group exercise classes including Yoga, Zumba, MMA Conditioning, ViPR and more.

We are a full service gym also providing monthly gym memberships, massage, complimentary towel service, brand new locker and shower rooms, complimentary coffee, tea and organic fruits and above all, a friendly and approachable staff.

A key differentiator here at Fitness Urbano will be our “No Crowd” policy. We won't oversell our services so our members won’t be sandwiched into a corner for a class or have to wait to use fitness equipment.

We are building Fitness Urbano to be all about U!

Our goal is to open in early 2015.  

So please join the FU Campaign and say:

  • FU to gyms that only think of you as a monthly membership fee
  • FU to the hassle of overcrowded fitness centers
  • FU to training programs that don’t address your individual needs and goals

The Impact - What We Need & What You Get

We are converting 80 Missouri Street, a ~7,000 sq ft warehouse space, into Fitness Urbano. This requires a lot of upfront capital for construction (along with many other needs!).  We are running the FU Campaign to raise $21,000 for construction of the floor in our group exercise studio.

By selecting one of our perks you can help us bring the exercise studio and Fitness Urbano to life.  YOU will get the advantage of some incredible presale discounts on our group exercise classes and monthly gym memberships.  And in doing so you will also become a founding member of what promises to be an awesome new gym experience designed exclusively around your needs.

Even if you don't live in or commute to San Francisco on a regular basis but you may still want to support the FU Campaign [Hey Mom!].  For you we’ve designed our “Supporting Member” perks. With these, you’ll have our heartfelt appreciation and you'll get formal acknowledgement of that with a listing on the Fitness Urbano website.  We're also providing a special edition Fitness Urbano workout shirt with some of those perks.  Or go BIG with your support and you’ll get naming rights for our group exercise studio.

    Risks & Challenges

    We are a startup.  Startups need capital to get going.  Since neither Luis or Kevin descends from the Rockefeller’s, the Getty’s or even from San Francisco's Tech Nouveau Riche we can’t count on a big inheritance for startup capital.  A successful FU Campaign is going to make us look more attractive to lenders who can help us fund the rest of our project.  So please help us to not only reach but to EXCEED our goal of $21,000. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you're not ready to join the FU Campaign, you probably know several people who would be interested in hearing about us.

      You can help tremendously by letting everyone know about the FU Campaign.  Share with your friends, colleagues and neighbors via:

      • Indiegogo
      • Social Media
      • Email
      • Phone
      • Face to Face
      • Carrier pigeon or however you like to get the word out

      Especially let all the folks around 80 Missouri Street know about us.  We are super accessible to:

      • Potrero Hill
      • Mission Bay
      • Dogpatch
      • SOMA
      • Downtown SF
      • Design District
      • Mission
      • Easy on and off from Route 280 (Mariposa Exit)

workout shirt with some of those perks.  Or go BIG with
your support and you’ll get naming rights for our group exercise studio.Risks & Challenges
We are a
startup.  Startups need capital to get going.  Since neither Luis or
Kevin descends from the Rockefeller’s, the Getty’s or even from San Francisco's
Tech Nouveau Riche we can’t count on a big inheritance for startup capital.
 A successful FU Campaign is going to make us look more attractive to
lenders who can help us fund the rest of our project.  So please help us
to not only reach but to EXCEED our goal of $21,000. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you're not ready to join the FU Campaign, you probably know several people who would be interested in hearing about us.You can help
tremendously by letting everyone know about the FU Campaign.  Share with
your friends, colleagues and neighbors via:

Indiegogo
Social Media
Email
Phone
Face to Face
Carrier pigeon or however you like to get
     the word out
Especially let all the
folks around 80 Missouri Street know about us.  We are super accessible
to:

Potrero Hill
Mission Bay
Dogpatch
SOMA
Downtown SF
Design District
Mission
Easy on and off from Route 280 (Mariposa
     Exit)

story:
*Scroll down for English*

Hej!
Vi er Vinhanen

I 2013 havde vi en drøm om at skabe en vinbar og vinhandel uden fine fornemmelser. Vin til folket! Den drøm gik i opfyldelse, da vi åbnede Vinhanen på Nørrebro i København.

I 2015 tager vi vores drøm videre til Vesterbro, og vi har brug for din hjælp.

Vin og kunst til folket
Vinhanen er ikke helt som de andre vinbarer. Vi opbevarer og tapper vores kvalitetsvin fra store ståltanke i butikken. Vinen, den henter Jacob i Frankrig direkte hos producenten, før vinbonden tapper den på flasker. På den måde skærer vi et led af distributionskæden, og prisen på de dejlige dråber kan vi dermed holde helt i bund. Selve indretningen bærer præg af Julias baggrund i kunstverdenen. På Vinhanen Nørrebro donerede kunstnerne FOS, Bjørn Nørgaard og SUPERFLEX de integrerede værker, som gør stedet helt specielt. Alle møblerne er designet af møbelsnedkeriet Blendwerk. Tilsammen resulterede det i, at vi modtog Hovedstadens Forskønnelses kunst pris i 2013, hvilket vi er meget stolte af.

Hjælp os med at åbne Vinhanen Vesterbro
I vores to år på Baggesensgade har vi haft fornøjelsen af at servere vin til en masse dejlige mennesker og lægge hus til et væld af arrangementer. Én ting vi hører igen og igen, er et ønske om at få en Vinhane i deres del af byen.

Nu er vi klar til at tage springet og åbne Vinhanen Vesterbro, sammen med den nye bestyrer Nicholas Wændelin. Vi er meget taknemmelige for, at vores dygtige venner, kunstnerne John Kørner, Lilibeth Cuenca og Bjørn Nørgaard, har tilbudt deres hjælp og skaber ny integreret kunst til stedet. Resultatet bliver fantastisk, og vi glæder os til at vise jer det. 

Vinhanen Vesterbro skal ligge på Enghavevej 24. Et dejligt hjørne af kvarteret, hvor vi også får plads til udeservering. Placeringen er i top, men meget skal ske, før vi kan slå dørene op og åbne hanerne for gæsterne. Og her håber vi, at du har lyst til at hjælpe.

Pga. lokalernes beskaffenhed bliver vi nødt til at bygge et særligt udviklet anlæg til opbevaring af vinene, hvilket indbefatter et stort kølerum. Det bliver flot og er rigtig godt for vinen men koster desværre mange penge. Nærmere bestemt 100.000 kr...

MEN! Vinhanen er en drøm og en mission. Vin er noget vi i fællesskab deler og deles om, i smukke omgivelser og god stemning. Vinen skal ud til folket. Også på Vesterbro. Og du kan være med til at få det til at ske!

Vil du ha’ Vinhanen til Vesterbro?
Hver en krone (€) vi kan samle ind i støtte her, skal vi ikke låne til i banken. Så vi håber du har lyst til at bidrage til vores projekt ved at købe én af vores perks. Vi garanterer, at de kommer mangefold igen. Men det kræver selvfølgelig, at vi når 100% finansiering inden kampagnens udløb. 

Uendelig mange tak for hjælpen!

Jacob, Julia, Thomas & Nicholas

P.S. Kan du li' vores idé? Så vil vi være super taknemmelig, hvis du vil dele dette opslag med dine venner på Facebook eller Twitter.

P.P.S. Husk at alle perks skal afhentes på Vinhanen Vesterbro.

Ofte stillede spørgsmål

Hvordan køber jeg flere af den samme perk/belønning?

Det er desværre lidt besværligt men ikke umuligt! Først skal du gennemføre købet af den første perk dvs. inkl. betaling. Herefter kan du gå tilbage og købe den samme perk igen (eller en anden perk).

Hvordan får jeg min perk/belønning?

Når kampagnen er fuldt finansieret (100% eller mere), sender vi information til den email, du har brugt ved købet med en dato for hvornår, din(e) perk er klar til afhentning på Vinhanen Vesterbro.

Hvor skriver jeg min hilsen i Pay it forward?

Når kampagnen er fuldt finansieret, sender vi dig en email, som du bede besvare med din hilsen.

Kan jeg få min 12 bottle buzz fyldt op på Vinhanen Nørrebro?

Ja! Skål!

Kan jeg bruge min nøglering og få et glas på Vinhanen Nørrebro også?

Nej, desværre den gælder kun til Vesterbro.

Hvad betyder Early bird?

Early Bird er en betegnelse for de belønninger, som vi har et begrænset antal af til en ekstra god pris. Der er ingen begrænsninger på tidsrummet, hvori vinen kan nydes. It's always wine o'clock somewhere!

Hvad sker der, hvis kampagnen ikke opnår 100% finansiering?

Det er vigtigt at bemærke, at kampagnen kun gennemføres, hvis vi når mindst 100% finansiering inden deadline. Har du støttet med et beløb, vil dette i så fald blive refunderet direkte fra Indiegogo inden for 5 dage fra kampagnens udløb. 

Ved at fortælle venner og andre om kampagnen, kan du hjælpe til med at øge opmærksomheden om Vinhanens projekt og derfor også chancerne for at finansiere kampagnen, så alle kan få deres perks/belønninger. Det vil vi være rigtig glade for!



A MESSAGE FOR OUR INTERNATIONAL FRIENDS:

Hi!

We’re Vinhanen.

For years we wanted to introduce a different kind of wine bar/wine shop in Copenhagen. In 2013 this dream finally came true when we opened Vinhanen in Nørrebro.

In 2015, we take our dream to Vesterbro - and we need your help.

Wine to the people
Vinhanen is not a typical wine bar. We store, tap and serve our quality wine from large steel tanks in the store. Jacob buys the wine directly from the source in France before the winemaker bottles his wine. That way we leave out the middleman and can keep our prices nice and low.

Help us make Vinhanen Vesterbro happen
Vinhanen Vesterbro will be located on Enghavevej 24, a lovely corner of this vibrant neighbourhood, where we’ll also have room for outdoor serving. The location is excellent, but we have a lot of work before we can open the doors and the wine taps. And this is where we need your help.

In the new location we need to build a special facility for storing our wines. A large cooling room that will be great for the wine, but alas, the cost is semi-outrageous. Or more specifically €13,500...

BUT! Vinhanen is a dream and a mission. Wine to the people, as we say. And you can help make it happen!

Want Vinhanen to Vesterbro?
Then please supporting the project by purchasing one of our perks. We guarantee 'bang for the buck'. 

XO & THANK YOU!

Jacob, Julia, Thomas & Nicholas

P.S. If you like our project, we’d be super grateful if you would share this with your friends on Facebook and Twitter.

P.P.S Please note that all perks must be collected at Vinhanen Vesterbro with the exception of the tote bag, which can be send internationally for a €5 fee. 
FAQs

How do I buy more of the same perk?

This is a little tricky but not impossible! First you need to complete the purchase of the first perk incl. payment. Now repeat.

How do I get my perk?

Once the campaign is fully funded (100% or more), we will send you information regarding pick up dates at Vinhanen Vesterbro to the email you used to purchase your perk. Tote bags can be shipped internationally. Please add €5 for s/h.

How do I write my greeting for the Pay it forward perk?

Once the campaign is fully funded, we will ask you in an email to send us your greeting.

Can I get my 12 bottle buzz re-filled at Vinhanen Nørrebro?

Yes! Cheers!

Can I use my key hanger to get a glass of Vinhanen Nørrebro also?

No, please come and enjoy your wine with us at Vesterbro.

What does Early Bird mean?

Early Bird is a term for the rewards that we have a limited number of at an extra low price.

What happens if the campaign is not 100 % funded?

It is important to note that this is a fixed funding campaign. Contributions made to any fixed funding campaign will be refunded in full if the campaign has not met its funding goal by its deadline. Contributors will receive these refunds in their PayPal account, or issuing credit card, within 5 days after the campaign's end.

By telling friends and others about the campaign, you can help raise awareness of our project and therefore increase the chances of a fully funded campaign. That would make us really happy!

story:
Our Story

I was working in our little garden in OTR when the women came up to the fence. They wanted to know what I was up to. 'Is it goin' good? What are you going to do with all these plants?'  I attempted to wipe the sweat from my forehead but only managed to smear dirt across my face as I turned and said, 'this is basil. It is a common herb in cooking cause it is easy to grow and has a great flavor.' I offered them each a leafy stem. The two women appeared to be in their 50's. Grandmothers at least. 'Wow! This stuff is pretty good! What did you say with was?'

 'Basil.' I couldn't believe these women living two blocks away from me, feeding many mouths every night, had never tried fresh basil. I gave them each a bundle of herbs to take home. They beamed and wandered away smiling and talking about starting their own little herb gardens.

That summer, we gave away almost half of what we grew. I discovered the people who lived in the blocks around the garden - an area of town I had been warned to avoid - were curious about the plants and eager to work new items into their families' meals once we presented the greens and a couple recipe ideas. 

I am creating VegCycle™ to help fill the curiosities and the stomachs of these neighbors with food that will improve their health and their wellbeing. 

The Vision
The VegCycle™ campaign will help fund the construction, storage and maintenance of a portable hydroponic growing structure. We want to create a bicycle with a huge tray of plants on the back that are growing in nutrient rich water which is fed by fish that live below the plants. To complete the sustainable growing cycle, the pump that circulates the water between the fish and the plants will be powered by a solar cell.
By contributing to this campaign, you aren't just boosting the diets of people living in one of America's food deserts. You are giving kids and parents alike a chance to think twice about the way they eat, and to change the way we as Americans choose our food. You are joining a movement that pushes against algal blooms that poison drinking water, pesticides that ruin lives, and cheap, processed foods that soil health. Join us as we talk about what it means to take control of your food and your health.

The Problem & Our Solution

What is exciting about VegCycle™ is that the problem we are tackling is two fold - we are building a space to bring the OTR community together to talk about food, and at the same time we are testing out methodologies for urban farming that we can scale and use to support the growth of this project, and others in the future. Food has always brought people together. I grew up thinking 'food, water, shelter' - that's all you need to live. But now, food - growing it and finding it - is one of the top three challenges facing humans in the 21st century, and health problems like diabetes and obesity are prolific across America. VegCycle™ can bring food into focus. The hilarious looking bike-cart-garden-fishpond contraption will intrigue and attract people on the street in ways a garden or flyer never could. By making the growing pod mobile we are expanding the project's reach beyond Over the Rhine and into other parts of town. We will be able to bike to the market on Saturdays, street fairs on Sundays, and schools and learning centers any day of the week!

In the words of Anne Wigmore, 'The food you eat can either be the safest and most powerful form of medicine, or the slowest form of poison.' By motivating a community around good food, we can change health and strengthen our neighborhood as a whole.

What We Need & What You Get

Perks: Beyond the obvious perk of feeling great about supporting a cause you believe in, we have some fun thank you gifts for our supporters. Depending on your financial freedoms and your interest, we can send you anything from lofty poetry about our food, to Plants-inna-Jar indoor garden starter kits. For those looking to make a larger contribution, you can purchase a sponsorship package and we will advertise for you in various sized stickers on the pod, plus, one person can choose the name on our biker's jersey! A special $50 subscription will include a box of Banza - a chickpea pasta made by some of our friends in Detroit - with delicious recipes inspired by our community and our garden. A sneak peak: we are introducing our own Cincinnati chili made with chickpea pasta and OTR herbs!  

Expenses: As mentioned above, what we are trying to build with your help is a mobile growing pod. We will need a rickshaw ($2500), the pod itself ($300), the solar panel ($400) the fish ($50), and of course, the plants ($50). Additionally, we'll need some tools to pull this all together, but most of those can be supplied by friends. Still, we wish to set aside an additional $250 for wires, fasteners, and to pay for the marketing and perks that will help bring this to life.

Extra Funds: This project is scalable - any extra funds raised will grow and diversify prototypes we are able to build, food we are able to grow, people we are able to reach, and conversations we are able to start. 

Falling Short: As excited as we are to create our growing pod and start doling out packages of basil and mustard greens on the street, we recognize that we may not make it. Fortunately, even without all of it's great features, the VegCycle™ can still make an impact in a simplified, stripped down version. Your contributions will, no matter what, lead to advancements in the conversations around food in our city.

Potential Pitfalls

In many ways we are oversimplifying this challenge. We are saying that if we get the right supplies and the funding we need, everything will go perfectly. But of course that isn't true. One of our main goals of the project is to test modern growing tactics out for ourselves, and there is a reason so many researchers and scientists are working to develop new ideas and methods to create food - food is hard to grow!! In many ways, getting the funding to set up the bicycle-pod will be the easiest part because after that we will be challenged to create and moderate the delicate environments in which food-producing plants exist. 

So we are talking to scientists, professors, and farmers. In the months of February and March, Carolyn Jane is taking research on as her full time job. She is traveling around the country talking to the people who specialize in plants. Everyone from community gardeners, dairy farmers, commercial farmers, organic farmers, urban farmers, and professors of agriculture (check out our blog for information about these talks). These people have the insights and the understanding of what it takes to make food, and these are the people whom Carolyn Jane is questioning on her journey. Follow her trip on Instagram at @carolynjanenu and #VegCycleJourney, and please reach out if you know of people who can help answer her questions about how to grow food! 

The Team

Carolyn Jane, the Chief Growth Officer of VegCycle™ is a Mechanical Engineer who loves simple living and healthy eating. She has been studying entrepreneurship with Venture for America for the past 18months, and is launching her first idea through IndieGoGo. Carolyn Jane is passionate about food. She thinks about how to keep the top soil from eroding, keep fertilizers from leeching into ground water, and keep food food. At the same time she looks around her neighborhood, at the streets littered with chip bags and candy wrappers, and she is concerned for the families growing up within a mile of her who don't know what fresh basil tastes like. Carolyn Jane thinks VegCycle™ might be the first step towards addressing both of these problems in her neighborhood.

This project is different for Carolyn Jane, but she is thrilled to begin. In the past she has started gardens, led a team of engineers building a race car, and worked in machine shops. Her work over the past year as a project manager at BTG Labs - a local small business - helped her tune her skills that allow her to bridge the gap between science or engineering and people. Her experience managing (and machining for) Northwestern's Baja SAE team was extremely formative as it showed her for the first time that while she loved engineering, what matters most are the people - and a good company will put people first be those its employees or the surrounding community. Now, she is ready to combine all of those skills to try something bigger. 

Other Ways to Help

Thank you for reading this far! Check out garden and food tips on our IndieGoGo page and follow updates from Carolyn Jane's research trip on Instagram @carolynjanenu or #vegcyclejourney. If you have connections within the agriculture or urban farming industry, or even if someone in your family has an excellent recipe for pesto or compost, we would be honored for you to share those with us.

Talk us up! If you can't contribute now but you like our ideas, please share our page. It will bring you good karma and it will let us know that you are thinking of us. Thank you.

If you are a local and want to get involved, we will try to host workdays in the spring. sign up for our newsletter, and we will keep you posted. Cheers!

To complete the sustainable growing cycle, the pump that circulates the water between the fish and the plants will be powered by a solar cell.
By contributing to this campaign, you aren't just boosting the diets of people living in one of America's food deserts. You are giving kids and parents alike a chance to think twice about the way they eat, and to change the way we as Americans choose our food. You are joining a movement that pushes against algal blooms that poison drinking water, pesticides that ruin lives, and cheap, processed foods that soil health. Join us as we talk about what it means to take control of your food and your health.
The Problem & Our Solution



What is exciting about VegCycle™ is that the problem we are tackling is two fold - we are building a space to bring the OTR community together to talk about food, and at the same time we are testing out methodologies for urban farming that we can scale and use to support the growth of this project, and others in the future. Food has always brought people together. I grew up thinking 'food, water, shelter' - that's all you need to live. But now, food - growing it and finding it - is one of the top three challenges facing humans in the 21st century, and health problems like diabetes and obesity are prolific across America. VegCycle™ can bring food into focus. The hilarious looking bike-cart-garden-fishpond contraption will intrigue and attract people on the street in ways a garden or flyer never could. By making the growing pod mobile we are expanding the project's reach beyond Over the Rhine and into other parts of town. We will be able to bike to the market on Saturdays, street fairs on Sundays, and schools and learning centers any day of the week!
In the words of Anne Wigmore, 'The food you eat can either be the safest and most powerful form of medicine, or the slowest form of poison.' By motivating a community around good food, we can change health and strengthen our neighborhood as a whole.   What We Need & What You Get
Perks: Beyond the obvious perk of feeling great about supporting a cause you believe in, we have some fun thank you gifts for our supporters. Depending on your financial freedoms and your interest, we can send you anything from lofty poetry about our food, to Plants-inna-Jar indoor garden starter kits. For those looking to make a larger contribution, you can purchase a sponsorship package and we will advertise for you in various sized stickers on the pod, plus, one person can choose the name on our biker's jersey! A special $50 subscription will include a box of Banza - a chickpea pasta made by some of our friends in Detroit - with delicious recipes inspired by our community and our garden. A sneak peak: we are introducing our own Cincinnati chili made with chickpea pasta and OTR herbs!  

Expenses: As mentioned above, what we are trying to build with your help is a mobile growing pod. We will need a rickshaw ($2500), the pod itself ($300), the solar panel ($400) the fish ($50), and of course, the plants ($50). Additionally, we'll need some tools to pull this all together, but most of those can be supplied by friends. Still, we wish to set aside an additional $250 for wires, fasteners, and to pay for the marketing and perks that will help bring this to life.

Extra Funds: This project is scalable - any extra funds raised will grow and diversify prototypes we are able to build, food we are able to grow, people we are able to reach, and conversations we are able to start. 
Falling Short: As excited as we are to create our growing pod and start doling out packages of basil and mustard greens on the street, we recognize that we may not make it. Fortunately, even without all of it's great features, the VegCycle™ can still make an impact in a simplified, stripped down version. Your contributions will, no matter what, lead to advancements in the conversations around food in our city.
Potential Pitfalls
In many ways we are oversimplifying this challenge. We are saying that if we get the right supplies and the funding we need, everything will go perfectly. But of course that isn't true. One of our main goals of the project is to test modern growing tactics out for ourselves, and there is a reason so many researchers and scientists are working to develop new ideas and methods to create food - food is hard to grow!! In many ways, getting the funding to set up the bicycle-pod will be the easiest part because after that we will be challenged to create and moderate the delicate environments in which food-producing plants exist. 
So we are talking to scientists, professors, and farmers. In the months of February and March, Carolyn Jane is taking research on as her full time job. She is traveling around the country talking to the people who specialize in plants. Everyone from community gardeners, dairy farmers, commercial farmers, organic farmers, urban farmers, and professors of agriculture (check out our blog for information about these talks). These people have the insights and the understanding of what it takes to make food, and these are the people whom Carolyn Jane is questioning on her journey. Follow her trip on Instagram at @carolynjanenu and #VegCycleJourney, and please reach out if you know of people who can help answer her questions about how to grow food! 
The Team
Carolyn Jane, the Chief Growth Officer of VegCycle™ is a Mechanical Engineer who loves simple living and healthy eating. She has been studying entrepreneurship with Venture for America for the past 18months, and is launching her first idea through IndieGoGo. Carolyn Jane is passionate about food. She thinks about how to keep the top soil from eroding, keep fertilizers from leeching into ground water, and keep food food. At the same time she looks around her neighborhood, at the streets littered with chip bags and candy wrappers, and she is concerned for the families growing up within a mile of her who don't know what fresh basil tastes like. Carolyn Jane thinks VegCycle™ might be the first step towards addressing both of these problems in her neighborhood.
This project is different for Carolyn Jane, but she is thrilled to begin. In the past she has started gardens, led a team of engineers building a race car, and worked in machine shops. Her work over the past year as a project manager at BTG Labs - a local small business - helped her tune her skills that allow her to bridge the gap between science or engineering and people. Her experience managing (and machining for) Northwestern's Baja SAE team was extremely formative as it showed her for the first time that while she loved engineering, what matters most are the people - and a good company will put people first be those its employees or the surrounding community. Now, she is ready to combine all of those skills to try something bigger. 

    Other Ways to Help Thank you for reading this far! Check out garden and food tips on our IndieGoGo page and follow updates from Carolyn Jane's research trip on Instagram @carolynjanenu or #vegcyclejourney. If you have connections within the agriculture or urban farming industry, or even if someone in your family has an excellent recipe for pesto or compost, we would be honored for you to share those with us.
Talk us up! If you can't contribute now but you like our ideas, please share our page. It will bring you good karma and it will let us know that you are thinking of us. Thank you.
If you are a local and want to get involved, we will try to host workdays in the spring. sign up for our newsletter, and we will keep you posted. Cheers!

story:
ABOUT THE CAFÉ

The Connection exists to provide a safe environment where teens can prosper and flourish within themselves and their community, improving their sense of self-value, hope, and visible opportunities. We are constructing a new club located in Thornton this Fall which will also double as a craft coffee shop for the city and surrounding areas!


MEET THE TEAM

CJ: Founder of The Connection with over 14 years of youth work and 3 years of coffee industry experience.

GABE: Thornton Center Director with 8 years of youth work under his belt.

JAMIE: Executive Director with 9 years of youth work experience and over a decade of experience in community development.

Bre: Café Manager with 7 years experience in the coffee industry and over 5 years of startup entrepreneurial experience.


THE WHY

Some time ago, we heard about high suicide rates from the local high school in Thornton.  We strongly believe these students have skills and interests that can lead to a hopeful future! 

The good news: We have outgrown our current location so it is time to construct a second location! Every Connection youth center utilizes a business alongside it as a vocational training opportunity for students. This time we are using our combined years of coffee passion and experience to open a café and fund the next location in Thornton.  



SUPPORT THE CONNECTION

By contributing to the startup of this café, The Connection will receive sustainable support for the Thornton youth center, its staff, and high school students for years to come.

The Connection Café will be the only craft coffee location in the entire city and surrounding areas, providing an environment for high-schoolers and adults alike to enjoy quality service, products, and events in their own community.


FUNDING NEEDS

$30,000 Goal:

    • Café Equipment: $8,000
    • Space build out: $20,000
    • Materials: $2,000  


CHALLENGES

The Connection is in the process of constructing the café space — but there's a long road ahead. We need to pay for electrical work, plumbing, and a bathroom. This a BIG build out requiring licensed contractors. In addition to this campaign, we are holding many events throughout August to raise funds, and applying for grants with local foundations. Since we have a proven track record in the neighboring town of Broomfield, we are hopeful to gain funding by our various methods to support youth in Thornton.


SHARE

Please join us as we work to fund the new Connection Café. We deeply want to bring craft coffee to the NE corner of I-25 and HWY 70 in Thornton. Once we’re up and running, we can assist the next generation coming into the workforce and help them identify skills and interests that will lead them far into the future. 

You can help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and by pledging now. Thank you for all the love and support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Gwen Lubom and I am reaching out to you on behalf of 'Z'Stein Enterprises, a small minority business a friend started almost a year ago. 'Z'Stein Enterprises' goal is to provide an affordable service to those in need of a fresh financial start via the process of Bankruptcy, and to assist individuals with the preparation of Last Will and Testaments and Living Wills. 

Our small business has achieved some success during the last year in providing our services to 35 individuals. Unfortunately, we have been working from  home and it has become a security issue. In order to attain any measurable success, the company needs to expand. To expand we request your assistance by making a monetary contribution.  

What We Need & What You Get

We recently invested in building a web site, which can be seen at zsteinenterprises.net and ask that you visit our site to better understand the services we provide. We are attempting to raise enough money to sustain us for the next three to six months. The needed funding will cover:

  • Office Space over the next three to six months ($1,200 per month x 3 to 6 months) = $3,600 – $7,200
  • Two Desks and two Chairs =  $800.00 to $1,700
  • Larger Office Printer = $400.00
  • Phone line, phone and other utilities = about $300.00 x 3 to 6 months ($900.00 to $1,800)
  • Monthly web site expense = $90.00 to $180.00         

The Impact

With the expansion of the company, not only will the services we provide be an asset to the community, it will create at least two additional jobs within the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monitary contribution we respectfully ask that you assist us through promoting our web site or by other means, such as:

  • Offfice Desk/chairs
  • Printers/copiers
  • Etc

story:
Apologies: You may have to turn the volume up on the video.


Update: Paypal Japan will allow for received funds within the next 2 weeks. Due to certain restrictions I could not enable the function right away.


Our Story

Life doesn't always work out the way we plan it, certainly not with us.

I came to Japan 15 years ago with nothing but clothes and a little money. This was my adventure. I met and married my wife 8 years ago. We desperately wanted a family. I looked forward to what life had in store for me.

IVF was our only option and Japan being one of the most expensive countries in the world, it came at a cost. We had savings but ran through them. The grief was and still is visible on my wife. Unable to bear the physical and emotional toll of another miscarriage, and also stating "We have no money for this." We let go of that hope.

Not long after, my mother-in-law was no longer able to care for herself. With no other living relative on my wife's side, it became our responsibility. At first, things were OK. As time moved on Parkinson's Syndrome and Alzheimer's decided to wreak havoc on our lives.

My mother-in-law requires 24 hour care. We can't provide that for her. There is no government help and even with me working 7 days a week and my wife working a full-time job, we are barely able to keep our heads above water. 

Short term solution for a long term problem:

  • Funds will go to providing more adequate care for my mother-in-law.
  • Funds will help us get some control over the debt of health care costs.
  • Every little bit counts and we're grateful for.

How we will manage long term

  • I hope to start a campaign here for educational material I'm currently writing
  • I am passionate about photography and hope to turn this skill into a viable solution to our problem.
  • With the resent increase in taxes, I hope that the Japanese government will show more support for people wanting families and people caring for the elderly.

Asking for help is hard

This campaign is as much for my mother-in-law as it is for my wife. For the last several years, the care of her mother has taken a great toll on her. The smiles aren't there anymore and there were plenty before. She has no idea that I've created this campaign. She has no idea that there are ways to ask without feeling ashamed. I'm doing this for my family.

If you can't donate, please share and keep us in your prayers.

story:
Having a food allergy or other dietary limitation can be overwhelming, scary and frustrating, I know firsthand! By sharing what I've learned, I hope to create ripples of food-health consciousness, empowering other people to find joy and nourishment in food again. 

During health consultation sessions, clients will:

  • learn to accept the boundaries and restrictions of food allergies by focusing on the freedom of creativity and experimentation.
  • receive menus, shopping lists and cooking instructions, all based on personal restrictions and health goals.
  • learn to enjoy grocery shopping, food-preparation and cooking.
  • discover how eating habits, physical activity, personal time, positive relationships and job-satisfaction impact overall wellbeing. 
  • establish routines to balance and integrate all aspects of life.
  • and eat organic, insanely awesome snacks provided by me!

My dream is that those whom I help will in turn help others... the ripple effect.

For many years as a teenager and through my early 20's, I struggled with my health. I had horrible acne, mood-swings, fatigue, headaches, joint inflammation & pain, thinning hair, brittle nails, digestive issues, et cetera. I just wanted to look in the mirror and be beautiful, feel "normal" and have the freedom to live my life! 

After visiting many various doctors over many years, taking many pills and applying many creams, I was finally diagnosed with Hashimoto's. Unfortunately, knowing what was causing the symptoms didn't make my health improve. 

A few more years passed, and a good friend sent me to her acupuncturist. The acupuncturist could immediately tell that I was suffering and started me on an elimination diet. To my delight, I began to heal! That was 12 years ago.

I currently follow a modified paleo approach: I focus on plants, ferments and healthy fat sources while avoiding gluten, nightshades, pineapple, kiwi and mango. In addition, I have to be very careful of quantity, balance, growing-methods, and cooking-methods used with garlic, ginger, shellfish, other tropical fruits, legumes, meats/dairy, and a handful of other foods. 

Working with so many restrictions has been a challenge. I am a chef: a chef who can't taste most foods without getting sick in some form or another. Initially, there were times when I chose to taste something that I knew would cause suffering later.

However!

I am an artist, I am creative, I am not bound by a prescribed list of ingredients. I have learned to make my favorite foods in ways that I can enjoy them! 

I've created a pizza crust that has gluten-eaters coming back for seconds (and thirds)! My carrot and mushroom ketchups contribute to the tastiest meatloaf. And don't forget dessert... I make cheesecake and cookies that'll make your mouth happy six ways to Sunday! You'll receive these recipes and more when you contribute and choose the perk of "your kitchen is waiting" or "your fridge is calling".

By sharing what I've developed for myself, I hope to create ripples of food-health consciousness, empowering other people to find joy and nourishment in food again.

Ripples make waves.

Your contribution will make a difference! Here's how the funds will be used:

  • ingredients for your "perks", those snacks aren't free to make! :) 
  • Note: you may opt-out of a perk so that the full contribution goes toward funding the business.
  • $2400 in kitchen equipment to make snacks my clients (& you), and to demonstrate to my clients various methods for preparing foods.
  • $400 in licensing & insurance, including: small business license, cottage foods license.
  • $2000 for marketing, networking and outreach.
  • $200 for securing domain name(s) and building a website, and $800 for maintaining over the remainder of the year. Because I'm not afraid to admit my techie-skills are not my strength!
  • approx $500 in fees to Indiegogo
  • STRETCH GOAL: help spread the word even further -- with particular focus in helping educate food-handlers in local schools -- AND, help cover the cost of my health coach tuition/certification.

I understand not everyone is financially able to contribute. You can still help me reach my goal by emailing your friends and family, spread the news by word of mouth, or by using the links at the top of the page to share via social media. If you know of a business, community that resonates with my campaign, or have an idea to help in another manner, please reach out to me via email: hillarybergh@gmail.com.

Let's create ripples... that become WAVES... together! 

Connect with me on linkedIN, instagram, twitter, g+ and my blog... and my website coming soon!



**The role of a Health Coach is not to prescribe or assess micro- and macronutrient levels; provide health care, medical, or nutrition therapy services; or to diagnose, treat, or cure any disease, condition, or other physical or mental ailment. The Health Coach is not acting in the capacity of a doctor, licensed dietician-nutritionist, psychologist, or other registered professional. A Health Coach is a mentor and guide, trained in integrative, holistic health coaching. The Health Coach helps clients reach their own health goals by helping implement positive, sustainable lifestyle changes in coordination with advice and directives given by licensed health professionals.
