story:
Introduction:

I am a British Adventurer about to embark on an 18,000km run from Vancouver to Buenos Aires. I will be undertaking this expedition, which equates to running round the moon one and a half times or 428 marathons, solo and without a support team and estimate that it will take 600 days to complete. The expedition will be a platform to raise money and awareness for a number of charities with the prevention of male suicide being the principal focus. Follow the expedition at www.jamieisrunning.com

THE EXPEDITION:

The route will follow the west coast of north and central America before heading down through Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Bolivia before finally arriving in Argentina. The trip is estimated to take about 600 days and will be equivalent to over 428 marathons. Each day will comprise of running between 35 and 40km. I will take one day off in every five. I will be carrying all my equipment in the below stroller and  will seek shelter wherever I can find it at the end of each day – be it a hotel, a friendly local’s house or in my Force Ten tent.


THE CHARITIES:

I have chosen a number of charities to support throughout this expedition however the prevention of male suicide is a principal motivation. Following a charity event earlier this year I was staggered about just how little I knew about the subject and just how many people it affects. I was shocked to learn that men account for 77% of all suicides in the UK and it is the single biggest cause of death in men under 50. Having worked in the City for over 10 years I am no stranger to stress and have seen the devastating effects that it has on people and their relationships. And while this is not the only cause of suicide in men it highlights the cultural barrier preventing men from seeking help as they are expected to be in control at all times, and failure to be seen as such equates to weakness and a loss of masculinity. This expedition will act as a platform to raise awareness and money for charities that are trying to help those who suffer and educate everyone about the potential  consequences.


CALM, the campaign against living miserably, is an award-winning charity dedicated to preventing male suicide in the UK and  SAVE is an American charity based on the foundation and belief that suicide should no longer be considered a hidden or taboo topic and that through raising awareness and educating the public, we can SAVE lives.

I will also be raising money for WaterAid and Macmillan.

THE WHITE BOARD:

While the sheer mileage of the expedition will be extremely demanding it will not be the toughest test I will face. The mental battle of spending huge amounts of time alone will also be very challenging. Throughout the 600 days expedition it is very likely that I will not spend any more than 24 hours in the company of one person. A lot of people who are in difficult situations also feel alone and find it hard to communicate their concerns with others.

To try and promote positive communication and sharing I have modified my running stroller to include a detachable white board. I will be using this to communicate how I am feeling on the expedition and will be encouraging others to take part. Anyone can share their thoughts, make a statement or send a message to a loved one by sending their short message to jamieramsay@live.co.uk.

If a company would be interested in sponsoring the whiteboard by having their logo attached then please look at the perks.

MAIN EXPEDITION T-SHIRT SPONSOR:
I am still looking for a main shirt sponsor for the expedition. I will be wearing the t-shirt for the full 600 days and it will feature in most of the expedition photography and videos. THE DEADLINE FOR IMAGE SUBMISSION IS 21 JULY 2014.

*Please not that the T-shirt will be professional designed and printed. This is merely a indication of the colour and size.

SIDE PANEL SPONSORSHIP
The expedition stroller will be a very visible part of the expedition. If you are interested in utilising this space then please contact me on jamieramsay@live.co.uk

WHY I NEED CONTRIBUTIONS:

I am trying to fund as much of the expedition as possible on my own but due to its sheer scale I need additional funding to pay for food, accommodation, trainers and equipment. Once I have met the overall cost budget for the expedition all additional monies will be donated to the charities.
story_txt:
Introduction: I am a British Adventurer about to embark on an 18,000km run from Vancouver to Buenos Aires. I will be undertaking this expedition, which equates to running round the moon one and a half times or 428 marathons, solo and without a support team and estimate that it will take 600 days to complete. The expedition will be a platform to raise money and awareness for a number of charities with the prevention of male suicide being the principal focus. Follow the expedition at www.jamieisrunning.com
THE EXPEDITION:The route will follow the west coast of north and central America before heading down through Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Bolivia before finally arriving in Argentina. The trip is estimated to take about 600 days and will be equivalent to over 428 marathons. Each day will comprise of running between 35 and 40km. I will take one day off in every five. I will be carrying all my equipment in the below stroller and  will seek shelter wherever I can find it at the end of each day – be it a hotel, a friendly local’s house or in my Force Ten tent.THE CHARITIES:
I have chosen a number of charities to support throughout this expedition however the prevention of male suicide is a principal motivation. Following a charity event earlier this year I was staggered about just how little I knew about the subject and just how many people it affects. I was shocked to learn that men account for 77% of all suicides in the UK and it is the single biggest cause of death in men under 50. Having worked in the City for over 10 years I am no stranger to stress and have seen the devastating effects that it has on people and their relationships. And while this is not the only cause of suicide in men it highlights the cultural barrier preventing men from seeking help as they are expected to be in control at all times, and failure to be seen as such equates to weakness and a loss of masculinity. This expedition will act as a platform to raise awareness and money for charities that are trying to help those who suffer and educate everyone about the potential  consequences.
CALM, the campaign against living miserably, is an award-winning charity dedicated to preventing male suicide in the UK and  SAVE is an American charity based on the foundation and belief that suicide should no longer be considered a hidden or taboo topic and that through raising awareness and educating the public, we can SAVE lives.
I will also be raising money for WaterAid and Macmillan.

THE WHITE BOARD:While the sheer mileage of the expedition will be extremely demanding it will not be the toughest test I will face. The mental battle of spending huge amounts of time alone will also be very challenging. Throughout the 600 days expedition it is very likely that I will not spend any more than 24 hours in the company of one person. A lot of people who are in difficult situations also feel alone and find it hard to communicate their concerns with others.
To try and promote positive communication and sharing I have modified my running stroller to include a detachable white board. I will be using this to communicate how I am feeling on the expedition and will be encouraging others to take part. Anyone can share their thoughts, make a statement or send a message to a loved one by sending their short message to jamieramsay@live.co.uk.If a company would be interested in sponsoring the whiteboard by having their logo attached then please look at the perks.MAIN EXPEDITION T-SHIRT SPONSOR:I am still looking for a main shirt sponsor for the expedition. I will be wearing the t-shirt for the full 600 days and it will feature in most of the expedition photography and videos. THE DEADLINE FOR IMAGE SUBMISSION IS 21 JULY 2014.
*Please not that the T-shirt will be professional designed and printed. This is merely a indication of the colour and size.SIDE PANEL SPONSORSHIPThe expedition stroller will be a very visible part of the expedition. If you are interested in utilising this space then please contact me on jamieramsay@live.co.ukWHY I NEED CONTRIBUTIONS:I am trying to fund as much of the expedition as possible on my own but due to its sheer scale I need additional funding to pay for food, accommodation, trainers and equipment. Once I have met the overall cost budget for the expedition all additional monies will be donated to the charities.

story:
FAME Africa

Thank you for visiting my fundraising page! I am excited to have the opportunity to go to Karatu, Tanzania, in East Africa to volunteer as a nurse.  I am so proud and honored to be working with the Foundation for African Medicine and Education (FAME) whose mission is to enhance the quality of medical care in Tanzania as well as to educate the local staff and community!


On October 27th, I will be starting my 5 weeks in Tanzania where I will work as a nurse six days a week alongside Tanzanian physicians and nurses.  I will be working in what Dr. Frank started as a community clinic and has now grown into a small hospital with inpatient beds, an operating room, an ICU, and a laboratory. We will have limited or no access to such things as X-rays, CT scans, or many diagnostic tests, which will challenge me to use my clinical skills to treat based on a history and physical exam. FAME treats more than 10,000 patients a year from over 100 different tribes. In addition (and what I am most excited to be a part of), FAME has a mobile medical unit (a 4-wheel drive bus) which sets out for 10 days a month to conduct drop in clinics in distant villages whose people rarely have access to medical care. They see often 100 patients a day with a large number of those patients being children under the age of 5.  

In addition, FAME has asked that I prepare power point presentations to facilitate educating the Tanzanian staff on areas of my expertise. I look forward to sharing my knowledge and passion about pediatrics as much as learning about African medicine, community, and cultures!

Learn More About FAME

I encourage you to take 8 minutes to watch the video above about FAME to understand my passion for this mission.

In addition, take a glance at their website to read about this wonderful organization.

http://www.fameafrica.org/whoweare.html


Why I Need Your Help

Because FAME uses it's funding to help continue to grow the inpatient and outpatient programs in Karatu, it depends greatly on it's volunteers to operate. I am proud to be one of those volunteers and feel that I will be a part of FAME for many years, if not my lifetime. In order to volunteer at FAME, there are costs totaling $3,440 for my flight, immunizations, licensing, and room and board. For this I am hoping that with your help I can raise enough money to cover the funding it will take to get me to FAME. Any dollar raised above the total volunteer costs will go directly to FAME for supplies and equipment. My hope is to raise over $5,000.

To illustrate how far the dollar goes in providing medical care in Tanzania, $2,000 would cover FAME’s total costs (salaries, labs, and medicine) to treat 550 children suffering from intestinal worms. The same amount can treat 88 children diagnosed with pneumonia.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't contribute financially.  Thank you for considering! Another way you can help is to forward this email to your family, friends, communities, colleages, and local organizations.  I would appreciate any help!

Thank you for helping me fulfill this lifelong dream!
Natalie

story:
Short Summary

Joy Bancroft speaking. I'm starting this fundraiser because Kirby is the kind of guy who would never ask for anything for himself. As many of you know, he is finishing up his bachelor's degree this summer, and he has Crohn's disease, which adds up to a lot of stress and anxiety and medical bills. He has been experiencing a Crohn's flare up, and last week, his MacBook suffered a lethal accident. It is very dead.  He needs another computer, and he does not have the money to buy one (understatement), especially in light of upcoming medical bills. However, I thought I'd ask the people who love him if they'd pitch in and help out. In return, I'm volunteering Kirby's and my various skills and services as repayment for your generosity.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal is $1500. That's pretty steep, but $1500 will get him a MacBook Pro with an Apple Care plan that lasts 3 years, which is the dream computer--the same as the one he just lost. 
  • What you can get for your donations:
  1. Creative Genius: handwritten or typed (on a typewriter) short stories or letters; doodles, haikus, collages; paintings, with fingers or brushes
  2. Honed Skills & Services: feedback on writing, professional, academic, or personal; baked goods or cooked dishes; babysitting, house cleaning
  • Kirby is also looking into used/refurbished models or Linux-based PC alternatives. If there is any extra money left over from buying a cheaper alternative, the money will go toward medical bills (those from his last Crohn's treatments and those that are accruing now).

    • The Impact

    As mentioned before, Kirby is about to finish his bachelor's degree this summer, and his last classes are online. He does not have a desktop computer or tablet; as of today, he no longer owns a computer, which is incredibly difficult as a student. He's also paying down medical bills and adding new ones, which makes a computer payment basically impossible.

    Risks & Challenges

    Let's be honest: you're not funding solar-powered roads or getting a groovy vinyl and signed poster by your favorite band. Fifteen hundred dollars is a lot of money to ask for. However, my mentality is that it doesn't hurt to ask, trust God, and dream big. Any donation helps. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't afford to donate, no worries. I know what it's like living paycheck to paycheck, too. But you can help us out and send this along to anyone who might know Kirby and/or being willing to pitch in.

story:
Our goal is to develop a toolkit that consists of scripts, configuration examples and UI patches to bring back manageable mailbox sharing in Zimbra.

We will develop:

  1. CLI command `shareAccount` that shares account A with account B and also adds the proper persona, configures Zimbra to store mail in the correct sent folder, and sets the correct FROM (persona) when replying.
  2. CLI command `createPersona` that adds persona's based on the aliases of an account.
  3. CLI command `cleanupAccount` that removes all shares and persona's from an account. Even if they where created outside these scripts. Useful to clean up after migration, upgrades or other issues where the Ajax webclient fails to load due to invalid shares. (This script will generate commands that you can run at discretion to  avoid loosing data.)
  4. A how-to page on how to enable X-Authenticated-User header. Allowing one to track what person was sending mail when using a shared account FROM header.
  5. An extension for the Admin UI for shareAccount and createPersona (deployment of this extension is optional, in case you only want to use the CLI tools, you do not need this extension)
  6. Add a feature so that when a user clicks a shared mailbox, the inbox of that share is shown instead of 'No results found'.
  7. More goals may be added during the course of this campaign.

50% of the received funding will be used to support the Zeta Alliance operations, this way you also support our other work. See http://www.zetalliance.org/

Need more information?
Read the FAQ. Or send us a comment you can also mail us at barrydg@zetalliance.org

 

Who is Zeta Alliance

We are an alliance of users, partners and contributors for Zimbra Email Collaboration to ensure its success and health as open source project.

  • http://www.zetalliance.org/
  • https://github.com/Zimbra-Community
  • https://github.com/Zimbra-Community/shared-mailbox-toolkit

 

What is Zimbra

Zimbra is one of a few full featured Email Collaboration Suites that is Open Source. It can be compared to Google Mail, Calendar but hosted at your company or in a private cloud.

  • Developers have experience with maintaining Zimbra 6-8 Network Edition and Open Source edition.
  • Experienced software developers.

story:
Jun, like many 6 year olds in Minamisanriku-cho, is living in temporary housing since the 3/11 disaster wiped out 95 % of the town's infrastructure.

He is part of a family of 5 living in a cramped, two room unit sincetemporary housing was built in June/July of 2011. "These conditions give no personal space", says Sato san, principle of the local junior high school. "The children hear every fight, squabble, and tension that the parents live. Even if they don't want to hear, they hear. Even if they don't want to see, they see."

Ongoing life in post 3/11 Tohoku is full of struggle, and the PTSD among the children aged Elementary through to Junior High is a major problem.

There are more memories of the terror and trauma then anything else.  For OGA, the challenge and urgent question has been: How can we help the families begin to create new experiences that are grounded in memories of warmth, positivity, and security?  

The OGA Kids Fund is a program that organises events, educational experiences, and festivals for the surviving communities of the disaster stricken area.

Minamisanriku survivors and OGA for Aid volunteers need your help to raise money and presents — because we are all working together in 2014 to bring Santa to the children of Tohoku.

This holiday party brings survivor families from 3/11 -- now scattered all over Japan --- back together again. This event is carried on year after year to remind survivors that they are not alone and they are not forgotten.

Presents have been donated, but we still need to raise $5,500 USD to fund the logistics, shuttle buses, food and drink supplies, and fuel the Santa buses that will carry presents to the far away villages of rural Tohoku.

We would love for your help in hosting this event, and any donations would be highly appreciated.

Please donate today!

What is the Impact you create?

After 3 and a half years, a lingering sense of helplessness permeates the world of many survivors of 3/11. Cramped temporary housing living quarters are being extended from temporary situations to long-term solutions, and even though many residents are cold and weather beaten, residents have little choice but to remain in these sub standard living conditions.

Christmas is a time for families to get together, have joyful moments with children laughing, decorating trees, opening presents... it is THE time for love and giving.  

This year, Minamisanriku, Kessenuma, Ishinomaki, and Fukushima communities will benefit from this project. Santa’s Christmas bus run will include 260 children from over 500 local families.  400 survivors will be present in Minamisanriku for the celebration on December 13th 2014.  Donations from you will go directly to these families, including the children. 

If you agree survivors of Japan's most devastating disaster could use a few extra moments of laughter and care this year, please help us make it happen.

Donate here, today, and now to help us create these memories, so more kids can say:

"Look Mom! Dad! Look what Santa brought me this year!"

Frequently Asked Questions 
(1) Why is it so important bring Santa to the children in Tohoku?
These children are survivors of Japan's most devastating disaster. With your help they will be laughing, decorating trees, opening presents and having fun. And they will know that you care about them.

(2) Who Are The Children I'm Helping? 
You are helping children (and their families) from Minamisanriku, Kessenuma, Ishinomaki, and Fukushima.

(3) Does All of My Contribution Help the Children? 
Yes! Every penny you give goes directly to the children in Tohoku. We've already raised some money for the "perks" and the fees  that Indiegogo charge us. So absolutely everything you give will go to the children.  

(4) I Can't Give Much, Does My Contribution Still Make a Difference? 
YES! Even a small contribution helps greatly. For example, just 5 dollars  will pay for a Christmas gift for a child. And there's another way your  contribution helps. It inspires other people to give too. So please give  whatever you can afford, you'll be amazed at how far your gift can go.

  (5) Who is Running this Campaign? 
We are OGA, a non-profit, non-religious group working in northern Japan to  help the victims of the 2011 earthquake and tsunami. [Note: OGA is legally registered as an NPO in Japan]   We've been supporting communities here and helping rebuild jobs  and  livelihoods for parents. We've coordinated with the local residents on things like:
   •   Christmas presents
   •   English classes
   •   Computer classes
   •   Exchange programs
   •   Summer camps
   •   Concerts
   •   Festivals
And we've done our best to funnel support to a town that is still on the edge the very of survival.

story:
Hello,

I would like to ask you for donation which would help us to manage the costs with the beginning of new year. We have a very difficult financial situation as we are deeply in debts and although I am the only person in the family who works, it is still very difficult to manage our overdraft account.

To make the things even worse, our son - David has been diagnosed with autism 6 months ago and now he needs more learning aids than before to help him stay in the nursery.

If anyone can help we would be really greatfull for your support.

story: Kathy has been baking these treats for her own dog for a while now. Of course friends and family have received batches for their pets too. The dogs just love them. As we say, “If dogs had opposable thumbs these are the treats they would bake.” They would also be giving them a thumbs up! Kathy and her friend Kim have decided to take this to the next level and they need some support. Bringing the ecommerce website online, registering with the state, sending the recipes out for lab analysis (crude protein analysis, crude fiber analysis, etc.) are all immediate need items that are not coming cheap. They will thank you and reward you with free treats if you support them.
story_txt: Kathy has been baking these treats for her own dog for a while now. Of course friends and family have received batches for their pets too. The dogs just love them. As we say, “If dogs had opposable thumbs these are the treats they would bake.” They would also be giving them a thumbs up! Kathy and her friend Kim have decided to take this to the next level and they need some support. Bringing the ecommerce website online, registering with the state, sending the recipes out for lab analysis (crude protein analysis, crude fiber analysis, etc.) are all immediate need items that are not coming cheap. They will thank you and reward you with free treats if you support them.

story:
(Pictured above, left to right, are Grace Kwamboka, Harison Wamani, Simon Muya, Peter Masuman, Maryann Wangari, Cynthia Wanjiku, Nelson Munyiri)


MATCHING GRANT: Your contribution will be matched dollar-for-dollar by the Dreamfish board from now until end of campaign, up to $3,000.

About People & Project

From August to November our team will build new online community technology for Dreamfish, a global peer development network connecting entrepreneurs and individuals working together to realize their dreams. Dreamfish is the first internet-based global cooperative, co-owned by hundreds of women entrepreneurs, youth entrepreneurs and professionals in 26 countries. Our project team consists of seven youth from Nairobi, Grant, Shiku, Tiff and other Dreamfish co-op owners.

To facilitate Grant Bowman, open source community leader, will travel from California to Dreamfish Place Nairobi, Kenya to manage the project team. The team includes recent Kenyan graduates web developers and designers from Nairobits, an empowering web development training program for youth from Nairobi.

Grace, Cynthia and Nelson on IRC (Internet Relay Chat), using Tiff's computer

Our Story - Person-to-Person development

Imagine three entrepreneurs. Imagine a young mother living in a rural village in Kenya who wants to grow an income-generating project for her community. However she lacks supportive people around her to believe in her, mentor her, and connect her with coworkers and clients. Imagine an entrepreneur coach living in Turkey who has a dream to help rural women entrepreneurs succeed. Imagine a senior IT professional in San Francisco whose dream is to make a lasting impact with his Free / Open Source community leadership skills in a developing country but lacks access to the right project. Your contribution to our community technology will help these entrepreneur peers work together across barriers and differences to realize their dreams.

You will help Dreamfish members to connect, learn and work on projects with people around the world.

Many Dreamfish members come from the streets and deserts of global society. We are creative, enabled with diverse skills and motivated. We have operated with tenacity, generous sweat and faith. We have worked toward a dream; A world where people can work together like humans with love and respect. A world where all people can meet their needs and flourish.

Our teams collaborate using the web, voip, phone, and in person meetings. We work in cafes and art studios. Some work late at night after day jobs. Some of us have never met in person yet we share our love for humanity.

Grant Bowman brings 20+ years of professional Internet experience to the team having served in roles such as IT Manager, Consultant and Sr. Systems Engineer in the environments of Bank of America, Adobe, SuSE Linux, Inc., several startups and open source projects. He is a founder of OpenCanopi providing Intelligent workstations to schools, libraries and community learning centers. Mr. Bowman is a contributor to the One Laptop Per Child San Francisco group, is a recognized Ubuntu Member and a Fedora Project Ambassador.

How will we use the funds?

We'll use your contribution on the following:
  • Seven (7) laptops for youth - Laptop donations may be better! Shipping costs will be taken into consideration. Talk to grantbow [at] dreamfish [dot] com.
  • Training youth in Open Source community and social media practices
  • Designing for first-time web and mobile users
  • Integrating and customizing open technology
  • Workshops and coaching to help entrepreneurs learn technology
  • Room and meals at Dreamfish Place Nairobi
  • Bus fare in Nairobi for youth to get to work
  • Internet connectivity
  • Airfare for Grant to fly SFO-NBO

What will you get?

You can choose among the fantastic perks to the right. All contributors will receive a link from the About Project page on our new site.

How do I pay?

Click on "Contribute" button on upper right. You will be given options. If possible, please use the PayPal option on check out. You can use your credit card via Paypal. We prefer this method because funds are disbursed immediately for use. If you choose Credit Card or Check, the funds are held until end of campaign.

If you don't have a bank account, you can use MPesa, a reliable payment system in East Africa. Send your contribution on your mobile to Dreamfish +254 705 185 020


Is this contribution tax deductible?

No, rather you can choose the perks listed on the right. Dreamfish is a cooperative, co-owned by members, incorporated in California, US. It is not a 501c3.

What if we go beyond our fundraising goal?

There is no cap on the amount of funds we are raising. All additional funds will be used to enhance this project and/or for Dreamfish related activities.

What happens if we don't raise our goal?

All reservations and rewards will be honored. We will get all the funds raised one way or another. The incentive to meet our goal is an extra $300. Indiegogo charges 4% more if you miss your campaign's target)

When will you receive your reward?

As soon as we reach our funding deadline, we will promptly get rewards to you.

Additional ways you can help

  1. Share - Share this page by liking it on Facebook, tweeting about it and emailing people about it.
  2. Talk - Join us using IRC on Freenode, channel #dreamfish If you want to talk to use or help, just let us know and we'll swim, swim! You can /msg grantbow or email grantbow [at] dreamfish [dot] com
  3. Join - Become a Lifetime Dreamfish member. The one time fee is $25. With your profile, tell us how you are "doin' the dream!"
  4. Build - If you are a developer or experienced with online communities, get started here.

story:
Short Summary

How often do you see trans people depicted in fandom culture?  There are some characters on Steven Universe and Adventure Time (Rebecca Sugar) that are no doubt trans...and recently there was some controversy surrounding whether Samus Aran (Metroid) was or was not a trans woman...but the backlash from the bulk of the fandom community was despicable, and assuredly contributed to a lack of safety in convention spaces for trans folks.  What about queer people in fandom culture?  Poison Ivy and Harley Quinn recently made it cannon that they are in fact a non monogamous queer couple, and anything Rebecca Sugar does has queer influences...but it's not prominent.  And fat people?  When we attend cons, we make a habit of doing a once through in Artists Alley and buy every single picture we find of a female character we like depicted with realistic proportions...but have yet to spend more than $50 in a walk through.  What about real life?  Maybe we live in a bubble of queer, but the fact is that most young people experiencing homelessness were kicked out of their families homes for being trans.  They will struggle to find jobs because they are trans.  They will struggle to find housing because they are trans.  They are at higher risks for incarceration and violence because they are trans.  And they are unlikely to find clothes that fit their bodies proportionately, which is likely to contribute to feelings of dysphoria and a lack of self confidence and optimism while trying to gain other resources necessary to survival.

What We Need & What You Get

Additionally, QueersPlay is focused on benefiting the most vulnerable individuals in the Queer community and intends to seek fiscal sponsorship from an existing 501c3 to partner with local drop in spaces to provide made to order clothing and sewing lessons to transgender youth experiencing homelessness to empower individuals to feel safe in their own bodies, skin, and environment.  View QueersPlay as a three circle ven diagram with cosplay, costuming, and social work holding the three circles.  Our goals as an organization are:

•To provide resources to the most vulnerable members of the trans community.

•To empower and uplift voices of the most marginalized individuals within the trans and queer communities.

•To create safer spaces in fandom and convention culture for queer and trans individuals.

•To challenge fandom and convention culture to flex and expand .

Risks & Rewards

We are risking everything to make this work. There is no day job to fall back on here. This is a way to support ourselves and our community and all of our time, energy and money is going into getting this off the ground to be a viable service provider for trans people in Chicago and everywhere.
The payoff here is everything! Our aim is to be a sustainable non-profit that provides trainings and clothing services to vulnerable queer and trans youths. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We can also use donations in the form of fabric, sewing supplies, sewing notions, etc.

We cannot do this without your help and are happy and grateful for any assistance provided to us as we begin our process.  Additional information can be found at facebook.com/queersplay, queersplay.tumblr.com, etsy.com/shop/queersplay, or by emailing Kimber at queersplay@gmail.com

story:
HELP GET THE WHEELS ROLLING ON MAD MIKE'S FOOD TRUCK


Short Summary


I have been working in the food industry for half my life and have seen not only what it takes for a restaurant to succeed but also what causes restaurants to fail. I want to take all my knowledge and experience with food and apply it to Mad Mikes Misfits Grills. To me starting a food truck allows me to  bring people the quality and service of a restaurant combined with the great atmosphere of a night out on the town. 

Mad Mikes will be one of the premier food trucks in Lexington, Kentucky. I personally am making it my mission to bring the people what they want. The food will always be made fresh, the atmosphere will always be lively, and the music will always be inviting. 

Mad Mikes is more than just a food truck to me; it is my livelihood.  You can be assured that your experience will be nothing less than perfect. I aim to satisfy 100% of my customers. The truck's menu will always be evolving so you won't ever get bored with the same old thing. The menu will always reflect something that is going on. (For example on Sunday nights I will do food based on the NFL teams playing.) There will always be something new! But don't worry we have a few classics that remain on the menu. 

If you decide you want to contribute you should know that each donation brings us one step closer to achieving out goals. Your donation will help the truck's wheels start rolling.We have a wide range of perks ranging from our undying gratitude to having a kick ass even catered by us! Feel free to check out the  perks for those of you who are inclined contribute. 


What We Need & What You Get

Mad Mike's goal is to reach $12,000.  If we reach it the money will go towards paying our team members and buying food so YOU CAN EAT! If there ends up being additional funds I want to invest that in a local artist who will do killer graphics for the truck! 


The Impact 

Mad Mikes wants to liven up the Lexington food scene. There are already some pretty awesome food trucks driving around Lex Vegas, but I see the food truck scene growing rapidly in the next five years... I want to be a part of that growth! We want every Mad Mike experience to be part of someone's unforgettable night out! By getting this truck started I can bring a good quality product and a great time to every location. You bring the party we bring the food! 


Risks & Challenges

My biggest concern is taking care of my team members; they are the heart of this operation. This will be my their main source of income and I want to have some working capital when we start to pay them, buy additional equipment, and purchase food product. 
We do have a few hurdles we need to overcome...
Right now I have invested my life's savings into getting this truck started. That is why I am here on Indiegogo. Each dollar donated is a dollar closer to my truck being a success. 


Other Ways You Can Help

You can always follow us on Twitter, Instragram, and Facebook to see the menu and upcoming events that are going on. Please share, like, tweet, and gram us! We like the publicity!

story:
What is Invisible Partners?

Invisible Partners is a not-for-profit entrepreneurship support group that helps small businesses grow. We are a collection of resources that helps create jobs through great business ideas, careful planning, and the execution of proven strategy.

 

My name is CharDale Barnes, and I started this group after being shown the power of service leadership. From 2010-2012, I served as college chapter officer for Phi Theta Kappa honors society (www.ptk.org). In 2011, I volunteered at the Open Door Mission (www.opendoormission.org) to help fight against homelessness. These activities helped me understand how people are positively affected by great leadership. The service-learning experience had a profound effect on my perspective and really changed my life as a result.

 

At the very start of Invisible Partners, I found that there are an overwhelming number of great businesses waiting to flourish. But, they may not yet be ready to have a conversation with organizations such as the SBA, Omaha Small Business Network, or Chamber Of Commerce. In addition to having a great business concept, they also need access to more intimate business counseling sessions, a group of peers to help identify more of their immediate business opportunities, and of course finances.

 

What is the Incubator Project?

 

The Incubator Project is Invisible Partners’ answer to an unnecessary number of great small businesses falling apart prematurely. It is specifically, a place that  encourages the formation and development of small businesses.

 

With a firm understanding of the core elements a company needs in the beginning, and without blindly throwing money and resources at random business ventures, Invisible Partners uses a special process to elect strong candidates for the Incubator Project. Once under our influence, we will utilize the best options for their company-type, and use proven business methods to yield the best outcome scenarios. When members come into the Incubator Project, our location will serve as a hub where they can fine-tune their business before stepping out on their own.

 

Why Should You Help?

 

We want Invisible Partners to be funded by supporters of our mission. As such, the donations we receive will help us acquire space sufficient to house the active members. Your contribution will also help acquire the business counseling, strategy, and marketing materials necessary to produce successful incubator companies. Members will be pleased to utilize this professional hub, as it is initially where clients will visit them to conduct meetings, hold seminars, and other regular business.

 

The Need

 

  • High unemployment.
  • Banks are hesitant to lend money to new businesses.
  • Business owners need guidance to grow the company.

 

Invisible Partners stands to be that positive leadership with proven business methods and a network of individuals. We strive to create jobs with the Incubator Project, and with a helpful contribution from you, together we will be that positive direction for small business!

 

The Ripple Effect

 

We will start in Omaha, NE. We believe that with support, influencing these businesses with the Incubator Project will encourage them to grow. Based on our analysis, a business that is better supported early on in its development process has a much greater potential for success. A company influenced early on stands to flourish, and eventually contributes to its immediate community by promoting job growth.

 

Make Your Mark

 

Make your mark with a contribution to Invisible Partners: Incubator Project! We also encourage you to spread the word about our campaign, and recommend us to others who have a kind heart. The Incubator Project is just one solid effort for us to try and make things better in our local communities. By contributing, you will become an honorary member of Invisible Partners, and become part of one of the most positive ways small business makes a big difference. Let's all work together by doing what we can!

 

Thank you and we hope you enjoyed the video!

 

CharDale Barnes

Invisible Partners, Founder/CEO

story:
The Challenge

Did you know there is an island of plastic in the Pacific Ocean that is larger than the province of Alberta?

Plastic has only existed on are planet for around 60 years, it's everywhere and hard to avoid. More than 40 percent of plastic is used only once and then thrown away. Plastic NEVER actually biodegrades, it just breaks down into smaller and smaller pieces that make their into the food chains of many species, including our own. 

The challenge we face is to move away from this linear model of production and consumption to one where the way we design, produce and use products is transformed to eliminate waste. We have lived in a world free of single-use plastics before - we can do it again!

 

So, now what?

This is where YOU and Canary come in! 

We want to make living a low impact lifestyle enjoyable and easy. The Zero Waste movement is all about waste reduction.  Although the "Zero" can feel impossible at first, little steps to reduce single-use products actually do make a difference.  At Canary, we do the research for you. We've been working with amazing suppliers and designers across Canada and beyond to source beautiful products that take the guesswork out. 

 

The Impact

Support Canary and become a part of the real shift to a circular economy, whereby the development of consumer products takes into account their full life cycle. Put less plastic waste in your bin, keep toxic chemicals out of your body and home, and inspire others to live more sustainably through your actions.  Our rewards feature functional, timeless goods that are beautifully designed and built to last. 

 

Our Shop

We believe it should be easy to shop sustainably. When you visit our refillery, you can bring your own containers with you to refill quality cleaners, soaps and personal care products without all of the packaging waste.  We also offer a curated selection of low impact lifestyle items that are sustainably sourced alternatives to plastic and single-use products.

Our goal is to become a community hub for educating and empowering others towards sustainable living through workshops, speakers series, and programs for all ages. 

We're excited to open our doors in Kensington, Calgary in February, 2019. 

   

How It Works 

 

Our Perks

 The perks we have curated include many of our own favorite products!  They will be available for pick up, in store, when our doors open in February.  If you aren't located in Calgary and would like your items shipped, please contact us (there is an additional shipping cost that will be calculated after the campaign ends). The Gift Cards are simple...the more you contribute the more you get back in return!   

 

Our Ask

While we have secured a space in Kensington and some funding for our startup costs, funds generated through this campaign will help us renovate and equip our shop while minimizing our reliance on interest heavy loans. We are aiming to raise $25,000 through our amazing rewards and while our hope is to exceed this goal, all funds generated will be put to good use.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a small, temporary space to launch from in February where we are space sharing, keeping the rent low. In this way, we will be able to grow the business sustainably without a big overhead. We've done our research and know that Calgary is ready for us - early feedback has been nothing short of incredible! In a short time we've built an engaged audience and an amazing team of people that have helped get us here. We have very exciting plans for the future which will be implemented in the second phase of growth when we secure our permanent home.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are so grateful for every contribution to our campaign.  Even if you are unable to back this project, it would mean the world to us (and the planet) if you would share this campaign with your friends and family on social media via the share buttons up top, email, OR scream it from your rooftop. No matter how big or small the support, it will make a difference. We look forward to welcoming you to our shop!

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
The Challenge
Did you know there is an island of plastic in the Pacific Ocean that is larger than the province of Alberta?
Plastic has only existed on are planet for around 60 years, it's everywhere and hard to avoid. More than 40 percent of plastic is used only once and then thrown away. Plastic NEVER actually biodegrades, it just breaks down into smaller and smaller pieces that make their into the food chains of many species, including our own. 
The challenge we face is to move away from this linear model of production and consumption to one where the way we design, produce and use products is transformed to eliminate waste. We have lived in a world free of single-use plastics before - we can do it again!
 
So, now what?
This is where YOU and Canary come in! 
We want to make living a low impact lifestyle enjoyable and easy. The Zero Waste movement is all about waste reduction.  Although the "Zero" can feel impossible at first, little steps to reduce single-use products actually do make a difference.  At Canary, we do the research for you. We've been working with amazing suppliers and designers across Canada and beyond to source beautiful products that take the guesswork out. 
 
The Impact
Support Canary and become a part of the real shift to a circular economy, whereby the development of consumer products takes into account their full life cycle. Put less plastic waste in your bin, keep toxic chemicals out of your body and home, and inspire others to live more sustainably through your actions.  Our rewards feature functional, timeless goods that are beautifully designed and built to last. 
 
Our Shop
We believe it should be easy to shop sustainably. When you visit our refillery, you can bring your own containers with you to refill quality cleaners, soaps and personal care products without all of the packaging waste.  We also offer a curated selection of low impact lifestyle items that are sustainably sourced alternatives to plastic and single-use products.
Our goal is to become a community hub for educating and empowering others towards sustainable living through workshops, speakers series, and programs for all ages. 
We're excited to open our doors in Kensington, Calgary in February, 2019. 
   
How It Works 

 
Our Perks

 The perks we have curated include many of our own favorite products!  They will be available for pick up, in store, when our doors open in February.  If you aren't located in Calgary and would like your items shipped, please contact us (there is an additional shipping cost that will be calculated after the campaign ends). The Gift Cards are simple...the more you contribute the more you get back in return!   
 
Our Ask
While we have secured a space in Kensington and some funding for our startup costs, funds generated through this campaign will help us renovate and equip our shop while minimizing our reliance on interest heavy loans. We are aiming to raise $25,000 through our amazing rewards and while our hope is to exceed this goal, all funds generated will be put to good use.  

 
Risks & Challenges
We have a small, temporary space to launch from in February where we are space sharing, keeping the rent low. In this way, we will be able to grow the business sustainably without a big overhead. We've done our research and know that Calgary is ready for us - early feedback has been nothing short of incredible! In a short time we've built an engaged audience and an amazing team of people that have helped get us here. We have very exciting plans for the future which will be implemented in the second phase of growth when we secure our permanent home.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We are so grateful for every contribution to our campaign.  Even if you are unable to back this project, it would mean the world to us (and the planet) if you would share this campaign with your friends and family on social media via the share buttons up top, email, OR scream it from your rooftop. No matter how big or small the support, it will make a difference. We look forward to welcoming you to our shop!
 
Thank you!

story:
Crocus Co-Operative: We Help Change Lives

It started in a house. Formed in 1983, Crocus cooperative offers support and a warm accepting environment for individuals with mental health issues. Often, individuals fresh out of the hospital or other facilities might stay isolated at home, but our members step through Crocus’ door and learn to socialize in a warm and forgiving environment, eat healthy food, re-enter the work force in a caring and encouraging environment and earn money which boosts their self-esteem. 

  • Crocus has approximately 2000 lifetime members

  • 500 active members

  • Transitional Employment Program has over 60 currently participating 

The Transitional Employment program provides work opportunities for our members and provides service to the greater community with yard work, snow removal, hauls to the landfill and moves, labour jobs and button making. This program is an integral part of Crocus' program. Our members historically have had difficulty holding down permanent jobs. Giving members the opportunity to participate in the work force in a protected work environment was deemed critical to the recovery journey for members of Crocus. The program has expanded as more members have become available to work. 

The Work Program began with a single truck and has since expanded to include a passenger van, two trucks and a utility trailer used for hauling furniture and garbage. We have a Program Coordinator who oversees the running of the program, including finding customers, lining up the workers, and ensuring the job is completed punctually and efficiently. We have reached the point of being unable to expand our program due to the limitations of our healthy members, lack of equipment and vehicles, and the reluctance to take on new customers without the assurance we will have sufficient healthy workers available to complete the work. 

What Your Donation Will Help With:

 It is our intent to use the money obtained from Affinity to expand the program by increasing the number of vehicles available for use by the program, as well as to upgrade the equipment our workers use.

  • Purchase of a cube van (new or used) for furniture moves within the city as well as garbage hauls to the city landfill
  • Purchase of lawn and garden equipment
  • Expansion of the program to serve the needs of our members

The transportation of workers to job sites is an integral part of the work program, and Crocus currently relies on three vehicles in its supply. The oldest vehicle is 22 years old and on its last legs. The current vehicle is no longer road worthy and we cannot meet our obligations with only two vehicles. The cube van will ensure that residential moves can be completed regardless of weather conditions, as we currently are restricted to fair weather moves. 
Tractors are used in both seasons for lawn care and snow removal, and are in constant need of maintenance and eventual replacement. 
Funds for the program are currently coming from the operational budget of Crocus Co-op. New equipment is not currently budgeted for. Any surplus revenue from the program is used to supplement funding from our other sources. 

The Impact:

The health and wellness of our members is a critical measure of our success. By providing employment and giving members a sense of ownership and control, Crocus is improving the quality of life of its members and working to ensure a smooth transition back into the work force and into the larger community. By doing so, we make the community safer and stronger. 

  • Our goal (with your help) is to increase revenue by 5%
  •  Aboriginal males comprise the largest single work group involved in the program at 50%
  • Employing more aboriginal youth in our program
  • In 2014 we raised over $45,000 in donations, a 50% increase from the previous year.
The workers also are well aware of the financial support the work program provides the organization. Last year, the $87,000 in revenue represented approximately 16% of our entire budget. There is tremendous pride for our members in supporting the cooperative through work. 

In addition Crocus members see increases in their livelihood, self-esteem and self-worth. This program also generates revenue that supports all of the programs run at Crocus. Revenue gained from the employment program will help: 
  • Increase employment opportunities:

    By expanding our work program, Crocus is hoping to create new employment partnerships so more members are able to participate. This goal includes increasing participation of women as well as members unable to participate in labour intensive work. 

  •  Provide affordable meals:

    The kitchen is often the heart of many homes and the same can be said here at Crocus. With money from the employment program Crocus is able to provide affordable meals to members for only $4! We also provide free meals and drinks to members who work for the day so they are well fed and re-energized. 
  • Enhance social programs:

    Healthy bodies and minds go together. Crocus fills a gap in the lives of mental health consumers by organizing activities to develop our members’ socialization and communication skills through interaction with others. It provides them with the opportunity to participate in community fun without having to worry about cost. The social programs also substitute as educational opportunities as it allows them to become more knowledgeable about their community and enhances their life skills.

  • Offer support and advocacy:

    Crocus provides support and advocacy to our members by meeting them where they are at and assisting them with individual needs. We help members navigate the community support system to address their medical, financial, housing and employment needs.  

  • Reduce stigma of mental illness in our community:

    One goal that Crocus is constantly working towards is reducing the stigma of mental illness. Crocus is a place where mental illness is openly talked about, and members are able to share their personal stories and experiences with each other without being judged. By sending out work crews into the community Crocus hopes to educate people about mental health and create a better understanding of those diagnosed with a mental illness.  

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk and challenge to the Transitional Employment Program is, conversely, its greatest strength. The flexibility that we provide our members, allowing them to decide for themselves whether they are well enough to work, gives them the confidence to become part of the program. However, by allowing workers the right to not work, as an organization, we are sometimes deficient in the number of "able bodied" workers we have. 

The solution is to ensure a large enough pool of workers and to limit the amount of work scheduled on a daily basis. We have a great understanding with our customers about the nature of the workers, which allows us sufficient flexibility in meeting their expectations. With an aging population in Saskatoon, we are confident that the source of our work is only limited by the restrictions we set ourselves.

Our Critical Role:

The work done through this program also serves the larger community and is our organization’s most visible interaction in the community. Our reputation for doing good work at a reasonable rate helps us be assured that we have enough work for our members. Our moving or hauling household items service is available all year. Additional work includes landscaping in the summer months and snow clearing during the winter. We appreciate the work we receive from Sherbrooke Community Centre, Central Haven Nursing Home and the citizens of Saskatoon. 

With the recent increases to minimum wage in Saskatchewan we have increased the wages our members earn working for us. The impact of having meaningful and paid work is often hard to measure. The dignity of earning at least part of your living does much for your self-esteem and sense of worth.

Perks!

We wanted our perks to reflect the talent and hard work of our members. The perks that we chose not only support our members by giving them employment, but also gives our members the opportunity to enjoy things such as free coffee and lunch!

               6 Christmas Cards - $25

                         Lakefront Print - $50

                             "Brewer for a Day" at 9 Mile Legacy - $100



Ways You Can Help!

Help spread the word about Crocus! Donate, share, spread, donate! 

  • Vote with your dollar! Every dollar and every vote counts
  • Follow us on social media
  • Share our video on your Facebook page. Tag your friends in it too!
  • Volunteer! Contact Crocus to find out about how you can make a difference
  • Come to Crocus for coffee and meet our amazing members
  • Talk about mental health with a friend, a family member, co-worker, anyone!

story:
We believe that every woman is intrinsically beautiful, but so often the harshness of life makes them forget.

 We are partnering with Central Union Mission, an outreach center for struggling families in the Metropolitan D.C. area, and throwing a catered spa party for single mothers to give them an opportunity to relax and be reminded how beautiful they truly are. This is not just an event, but a movement to restore the beauty within every woman.

All of this is coming together on December 9th, 2012. But we need your help! Everyone can help, and here is how you can:

You can provide a donation here to help us fund the event and be a part of helping renew the hearts and restore the beauty of these wonderful women!

Check out some music from our friends who are contributing to our cause with a free gift to anyone who donates at certain milestones to the cause!

www.714music.com (Get a sneak peak of the type of songs you'll get with a donation of at least $50!)

www.jasonyostband.com (Check out the music that helps advocate for orphans and vulnerable children! Your gift of at least $75 will help both our cause and their cause!)

www.kurtisparks.com (With a donation of at least $100 you will get the 2 other CDs and a third by a highly acclaimed musician that is partnering with us for this cause by providing CDs and at a donation of at least $150 t-shirts as well!)

 

Important note: If your donating and have a paypal account, please go through that way of funding! It is safer and we will get the funds immediately. It will be a great help using paypal over credit cards. Thank you!!

story:
A Family in Harm's Way

(Video coming soon)

Meet Ramona (the Mom), Keren (the oldest daughter), Joel (the man of the house), and JoiElla (the little princess).

Now, imagine them going home one day and it's completely empty. They haven't been burglarized, but the Dad has just left and taken everything with him. Ramona went to check her bank account but every dime had been withdrawn.

For a moment, imagine that happening to you.

Ramona experienced it. Her husband had left her and their children with nothing. She struggled to make ends meet, pay bills, and keep the home. Finally, they were evicted and forced to sleep outside in front of a local Hardee's restaurant. Then she found a homeless shelter. 

Ramona's family has been at the shelter for over a year and has been told she must leave by February 1st.  Although she works, she doesn't make enough money to save. Not to mention, the eviction consumes her credit report forcing "no" after "no", apartment after apartment. 

Ramona needs a "yes."

Her oldest daughter is 18 and in her 1st year of college. Ramona's 8-yr old son is an honor roll student and her 6-yr old daughter is a ball of sunshine. Ramona is rearing incredible children and doing all she can with what she has.

On February 1st, this family of 4 is at risk for being on the street.

Ramona wants just one thing: a home for her family. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Moving expenses and deposits for a new home add up quickly. This is where your help is critical.

  • Security deposit (equal to 1 month's rent)
  • 6 months' rent (2 months are required for most complexes and private owners due to the eviction & the additional 4 months give Ramona a headstart she desperately needs)
  • Utilities' deposit 
  • Uhaul (their entire life's possessions are in storage)
  • Food (for 2 months)

I'm asking a total of $5,000.

Take a look at the Perks to see "what you get" for your generosity ---->>>

If we do not reach our goal, Ramona will still receive your donations!!! 

 

The Impact

I've watched this woman and her family daily. Her experiences have touched me deeply and I am moved to assist. But without a team of generous people like yourselves, I cannot provide what Ramona and her children need. Regardless of the amount you contribute, this family will be one step closer to a home they can call their own. 

Children should never be hungry, lonely, or homeless. These babies are fed, surrounded by their mother's love, but they are homeless.

Your contribution will change that.

story:
For the love of the craft and the community

Welcome to New Main Brewing Company! We're David and Amanda, two homebrewers with a passion for brewing and a love of our local community. About four years ago, we started exploring the basics of brewing in our garages and backyards. We started The New Main Blog to capture that fledgling beer nerdery and share what we were learning. It’s that love of the craft that led us to realize we don’t just want to share beer, but an experience and an education about the magic of brewing.

A round of funding from close family and friends (including a fellow Eagle Scout from back in the day) has enabled us to open a brewery in the heart of the DFW metroplex, the craft beer community we’ve come to know and love. We've secured our brewery location in Pantego, a small town nestled in Arlington, Texas, just off Spur 303 – Pioneer Parkway. We are excited to create an outstanding facility, not only for producing delicious craft beer but for bringing in our community to share a good time over a pint or two, and learn about beer in the process.

That’s where y’all come in!

Our dream is to build an outstanding taproom and beer garden where beer fans can come relax, sample a variety of our main recipes alongside the new variations we roll out every month, and learn about everything craft beer—from brewing to pairings. Our goal is to raise $40,000 to help us fund construction, renovation, and upgrades to your community brewery-to-be. 

Your funding will go toward a spacious indoor taproom with a small stage for live music, a separate and secluded living room area perfect for catching up with friends, and a backyard area for the brewery complete with a deck, additional seating, and yard games. The space will also be perfect for community events.

What’s in it for you?

This isn’t just our brewery, it’s yours, too. When you invest in New Main, you get our undying thanks, plus a bevy of perks:

  • Pint Glasses
  • Stickers
  • T-shirts
  • VIP Membership for 1 year — early access to new beers, VIP events
  • NMBC Special Edition Glassware and stainless steel growlers
  • Name a tank!
  • Private parties
  • Brew your own beer at New Main!

Be a part of New Main Brewing Co. today.

But wait, there’s more!

We’re always experimenting with new batches, and we want you to be a part of it. We’re brewing a special batch that will be ready by the end of the campaign. It's a witbier called Friday Night White. Follow along as we start brewing, monitoring fermentation, and split the batch into different mystery treatments. What will each one taste like? We’ll find out together. Science!

Here's the schedule, so you can follow along at home:

Brew day - 2/19
Fermentation Bubbles - 2/21
Keg base recipe - 3/1
Split 1/2 batch into treatments - 3/1
Base recipe ready - 3/4
Bottle Treatments - 3/8
Treatments ready - 3/22

Not your average beer lineup

We’re bringing the homebrewing spirit to the professional brewing world by making 6 main styles with 4 special treatments each. This way, you can find your Main go-to beer and find New ways to enjoy it!

For example, our Porter comes from a Best-In-Show award winning recipe from our homebrewing days. Aside from the great base style, we will also periodically introduce special versions like a Hatch chile infused porter, a winter spiced version, a hickory wood-aged version, and a whiskey barrel-aged version. Now imagine the variety of flavors for other styles: Saison, Witbier, Pale Ale, IPA, and our very popular Stout. The possibilities are endless.

You might have heard of vertical tastings, where you drink the same beer recipe aged over multiple years. We’ll offer something called "horizontal tastings" where you can enjoy the same batch of beer with four different flavor infusions. We can’t wait for you to try it.

The variety of our offerings gives us the opportunity to get to know our community better and gives you opportunities to learn about brewing through participating in the process. Once our taproom is open to the public, we plan to have a Discussion Series where we’ll bring in our friends from around the craft beer industry, talk about how we make the beer, host food pairings with local chefs, and give each of you the chance to fall in love with craft beer like we did.

We’re proud and fortunate to call our beer award-winning, and we think this spirit of experimentation had a lot to do with it!

Pantego Porter (formerly Rio Bravo Porter)
Best In Show Shannon Brewing's Operation Bravo Homebrew Competition

Prairie Sky Saison (formerly Fiddlers Green Saison)
Gold Medalist, 2015 Deep Ellum Labor of Love Homebrew Competition

Bigger NTX Stout (Formerly 9*8*7 Stout)
Silver Medalist, 2015 Deep Ellum Labor of Love Homebrew Competition

Challenges

Because the brewing industry is experiencing growth never before seen in the United States, there are some, uh, bottlenecks in the brewery opening process. Things like permitting and licensing delays, equipment lead times, and unexpected construction delays make our opening date hard to pinpoint. If everything goes according to plan, we hope to open our doors in late 2017. That said, we will host several small-scale work parties for those who want to help us build the brewery, as well as other opportunities to try our beer before we are open for business.

Other ways to help

Donations are so appreciated, but there are many other ways to help.

  • Post to Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, or share our campaign video and Indiegogo page via the buttons at the top of this page.
  • Subscribe to The New Main Blog for weekly updates on our progress.
  • For those of y’all who have participated in our earlier t-shirt fundraisers, even wearing your nautilus shirt out and about would be a big help.

Thank you to everyone helping us make this dream a reality! We can't wait for you to come find your New Main!

Cheers!

David and the New Main team
story_txt:
For the love of the craft and the community Welcome to New Main Brewing Company! We're David and Amanda, two homebrewers with a passion for brewing and a love of our local community. About four years ago, we started exploring the basics of brewing in our garages and backyards. We started The New Main Blog to capture that fledgling beer nerdery and share what we were learning. It’s that love of the craft that led us to realize we don’t just want to share beer, but an experience and an education about the magic of brewing.A round of funding from close family and friends (including a fellow Eagle Scout from back in the day) has enabled us to open a brewery in the heart of the DFW metroplex, the craft beer community we’ve come to know and love. We've secured our brewery location in Pantego, a small town nestled in Arlington, Texas, just off Spur 303 – Pioneer Parkway. We are excited to create an outstanding facility, not only for producing delicious craft beer but for bringing in our community to share a good time over a pint or two, and learn about beer in the process.That’s where y’all come in!Our dream is to build an outstanding taproom and beer garden where beer fans can come relax, sample a variety of our main recipes alongside the new variations we roll out every month, and learn about everything craft beer—from brewing to pairings. Our goal is to raise $40,000 to help us fund construction, renovation, and upgrades to your community brewery-to-be. Your funding will go toward a spacious indoor taproom with a small stage for live music, a separate and secluded living room area perfect for catching up with friends, and a backyard area for the brewery complete with a deck, additional seating, and yard games. The space will also be perfect for community events.What’s in it for you?This isn’t just our brewery, it’s yours, too. When you invest in New Main, you get our undying thanks, plus a bevy of perks:
Pint Glasses
Stickers
T-shirts
VIP Membership for 1 year — early access to new beers, VIP events
NMBC Special Edition Glassware and stainless steel growlers
Name a tank!
Private parties
Brew your own beer at New Main!
Be a part of New Main Brewing Co. today.But wait, there’s more!We’re always experimenting with new batches, and we want you to be a part of it. We’re brewing a special batch that will be ready by the end of the campaign. It's a witbier called Friday Night White. story:
What is Pink Soles, Inc?

Pink Soles, Inc. is a budding, contemporary non-profit organization designed to ignite a passion of philanthropic giving among young professionals and support breast cancer research and awareness. Based in the U.S., Pink Soles, Inc. plans to produce educational, awareness, and fundraising programs and events that target the young adult community.

Pink Soles became a non-profit 501c3 in 2012, and will begin its first year of programs in 2013. We are raising funds to support our growing business. Pink Soles will provide support services for breast cancer patients, empower and enrich the lives of survivors, promote awareness, provide prevention education, and raise funds for research.

Through its annual Ultimate Fall Fashion Event, Pink Soles is already raising funds to impact the community at large. On October 20, 2012, the 2nd annual Ultimate Fall Fashion Event take place in uptown Charlotte, NC. Pink Soles will raise funds for the Breast Cancer Research Foundation® (BCRF) through tickets sales, silent auction items, vendor booth rentals and general donations to benefit its urgent cause. BCRF works diligently providing critical funding for innovative clinical and translational research at leading medical centers worldwide, and increasing public awareness about good breast health. Pink Soles, Inc. is proud to support BCRF because over 90 cents of every dollar donated to their organization goes to breast cancer research and awareness programs.

By supporting Pink Soles, you are able to make a positive impact on the 1 in every 8 women who are affected by breast cancer. Change starts now, with your support.

How your donation will help:

Support a group of people who have the passion to make change real. The Pink Soles team plans to see an end to breast cancer in our lifetime. Help us exceed our goal of $3000; your funds will:

  • Further develop our programs
  • Fund key research initiatives around the world
  • Reach a larger, more diverse group of young adults to inspire 
  • Fund overhead for educational/awareness events and programs
  • Provide treatment for breast cancer patients without health insurance
  • Sponsor designers to show in our up-coming Ultimate Fall Fashion Event

What You Get:

Supporting Pink Soles is a win-win! Feel great about supporting the lives of others and enter for the chance to win an Apple iPad!

We welcome and greatly appreciate donations of any amount. 

Other ways you can help:

We greatly appreciate any and all financial contributions, and there are many other ways you can support Pink Soles, Inc.

  • Volunteer with us! See www.PinkSoles.org for more details. 
  • Spread the LOVE! Email the link to all your friends! Post our campaign on Facebook and Twitter, often!
  • Send us your ideas, questions, concerns. Let us know how we can best support our community!
  • Get your tickets for the Ultimate Fall Fashion Event, and support the cause in style with us! Proceeds will be donated to the Breast Cancer Research Foundation®.

story:
What is Be My Eyes?

The non-profit app Be My Eyes will connect blind people to a community of fully sighted volunteers. Both parties install the app and when the blind person needs help he/she uses the app which calls out to the network of volunteers and sends a live video stream from the blind person to the screen of the volunteer’s device. This way the volunteers can “be the blind person’s eyes” over the smartphone – therefore we’ve named it Be My Eyes!

The Impact

With a little sighted assistance when needed blind and visually impaired will have better access to information and have specific questions answered which will help them overcomming big and small challenges in their day-to-day life.

Who is behind Be My Eyes?

The initial team met at Startup Weekend Aarhus 2012 and has since grown to 14 passionate people. At present we rely solely on voluntary efforts and we now have a diverse committed team from Denmark, Germany & Sweden, consisting of a iOS developers, a backend developer, a graphic designer and non-tech/business people of whom 5 are visually impaired.

What will the money be spend on?

We have a great volunteer team working on the project and have produced a working prototype, but in order to roll out of the app more development is needed and the main part of money will be spend directly on adding more development resources to the team. A smaller part of the funds will to towards user-testing, marketing and hosting/server costs. Our goal will enable us to finish the basic features of our app for the iPhone and bring it into the hands of blind and sighted alike. It's the most important step and you all rock for making it happen!

In case we don't reach our entire goal we will focus the funds towards user-testing of what we already build and continue development in a slower pace on a purely voluntary basis.

 

Other ways you can help:

  • Signing up as a beta tester

  • Sharing our project

story:
The Synopsis

 

What is it?

 The Young Architects Awards Gala. This is for you. This is about what you have accomplished and celebrating a vibrant and emerging community of young designers and architects. We are focused on creating an event to celebrate our energy and successes past, present and future.

 

What do I get?

  • A new venue to experience and enjoy
  • A Hollywood-inspired awards gala
  • The opportunity to meet and celebrate with old and new friends across the design community
  • Make new connections and plans for your career
  • A bar
  • Door handouts
  • Recognizing that you helped make this happen 
  • Several perks to claim for your donations!
  • Get your name out in front of future colleagues, collaborators, partners and industry professionals. Establish connections with tomorrow's leaders.

 

How Can I Help?

An event of this size requires more financial resources than we can provide out-of-pocket. It requires support from the community. 

We are trying to raise a total of $18,000 dollars, and this is just one component of a larger fundraising initiative.

We, the YAAG planning committee, are excited to present the opportunity to help fund this event. This is your chance to help us create the gala that you want to attend. We have energy, optimism and ideas that coupled with your generous donations will lead to a fun and memorable event.

Everything helps! We don’t want to rely solely on donations from individual benefactors. This is a community event, and we encourage you to engage the community in any way you can. Donate your beer money for the week (there will be plenty there), or donate a larger amount to receive one of our perks!

 

Spread the word and tell your friends!

story:
Carrboro needs affordable holistic healthcare!

I'm Kim Calandra. I'm an acupuncturist that aims to provide Carrboro with a low cost healthcare clinic.  Community Acupuncture is a sustainable way to accomplish this goal. Carrboro is the greatest town and my mission is to improve access to well-being. When Carrboro Community Acupuncture opens, treatments will be a flat rate of $30 with clinics offered in the evenings. By contributing to my campaign, you help me transform Carrboro. 

"Kim is an incredibly compassionate, skilled care provider who is always present with you in the moment."
"I've been to alot of acupuncturists. Kim is the best by far!"
"Kim has the patience, knowledge and craft that heals the mind body and soul."
"Kim Calandra is a wise, intuitive practitioner. She treats my whole family, including my 6 year-old son, and we've all experienced dramatic improvements in our health and well being through her treatment."

There are expenses associated with transitioning from private practice to a community based-clinic.  Since everyone is treated in the same room, I am moving into a much larger space.  With an increased patient flow, more supplies are needed. Please see the specific list below.   Also, some of the campaign funds will go toward marketing and promotion.  Getting the word out is essential to the success of Carrboro Community Acupuncture. The funding goal will cover additional supplies and the first three months of operating costs.

PERKS!!! Acupuncture is offered at most donations levels. This perk will be a gift certificate so that the treatment is transferable. You may use the gift for yourself or a friends. Also, other perks are rewards from Perch Studios (Carrboro's premiere co-working space) and a 50% discount on Ryan Ashley Anderson workshops...all are available in the same building as Carrboro Community Acupuncture.

My plan is to promote local medicine makers. My herbal pharmancy will be stocked with medicine made local to the Carrboro area. Please check out the links page for further information on the medicine makers that will be supported through Carrboro Community Acupuncture.

If you live out of range from Carrboro and feel compelled to donate to my campaign, I am offering a personalized herbal gift from my medicinal wild-crafting business, Foraged For You seen at the country's first Wild Food + Herb Market in Carrboro, NC.

Please share this important campaign to other people that love Carrboro.

Thanks for your support! 


Supply List:  Donations in the from of goods in excellent condition will also be greatly appreciated.  If supplies are donated, I will remove it from the list to avoid duplicates.

small bookshelf, small desk, one massage table, 5 massage table warmers, water dispenser, twin sheets, massage table paper, face cradle covers, acupuncture needles, biohazard sharps containers, a sign for Carrboro Community Acupuncture, e-stim machine, storage cabinet, halogen uplighting with dimmers, file cabinet, office supplies (paper, ink toner, manilla folders, hanging files), chairs for waiting area, wall hangings, indoor plants, small trash cans, samll table, white noise machine, roller chair, desk chair, small fountain, local herbal pharmacy, small battery operated clocks, screens/room dividers, cotton balls
