story:
Kind Auto

My name is Von Ruder, but friends call me "Aspen". I have been an A.S.E. Certified Master Mechanic in Gainesville since 1983.

I have a unique "carmic" approach to auto repair. After years of working large corporate shops, I became dissolussioned (disgusted) by the ethics in my field. So I now work for myself and my clientele.

Auto repair is my Sadhana, my Path. It is how I give back to this sometimes crazy yet wondrous world of ours.

Almost There

  We have found the perfect property with a 4 bay garage just blocks from our present location. The bank will not budge off the price and in 5 days, the place is available to investors (the wolves) and will be snapped up. If we give what they are asking (very firm!) we will be broke and not able to do the $5,000 dollars in repairs needed BEFORE move in.

Closing would be July 1st and we would need funds by then.

Our Ideology

  I was fortunate to grow up in an era where I could follow the Grateful Dead on tour. At one venue, a girl had a sign that read "WATER - $1 or KIND". I had to ask, and her answer changed my life.

 The water was a dollar. But if you didn't have a dollar, you could give out 20 hugs, or help someone, feed someone, pick flowers and hand them out. In other words, no one was going to go thirsty. 

 I try to bring that marraige of old school hippy idealism and reality to evertday practice. If I can help it - you won't have to walk! At K.A.R. we realize there is more than one way to go about a repair, and we work to suit YOUR needs. 

Visit Kind Auto Repair on Facebook and at www.kindauto.com

Other Ways You Can Help Us Spread the Love

  If you can't donate cash, there are many ways to help! We will need a small army of volunteers to clean the place. An A/C duct person to replace all attic duct work (before move-in) and someone good at putting up wood privacy fence. And of course then the big move !

story:
Hello!

My dream has always been to provide a place where vegans, folks in transition, or the "veggie curious" could shop, where they could find something to help them, answer their questions, entertain them, educate them, or just plain make them laugh. Everyne is welcome here.  I provide cruelty-free, hard-to-find products to the South Sound area. I make it my goal to search out specialty vegan products and pantry items not found in my area.

I sell:  Cruelty free bags, shoes, makeup, body care products, jewelry, slogan t-shirts and totes. Gourmet vegan chocolates cookies and treats and  Specialty food items, cheeses, vitamins and mixes,  gift baskets to order, toys and treats for every holiday! Vintage housewares and more!

In our first year, we held our first annual "Blanket Day for EGYHOP" helping collect warm items for Olympia's downtown homeless, held a month-long fund raising campaign for Pigs Peace Sanctuary, Held a two-day "Transition WorkShop Series" for folks looking for help in beginning a vegan lifestyle, and welcomed vegan cookbook author Joshua Ploeg who not only entertained, but made us some amazing food! 

What We Need & What You Get

Heres what we are holding this fund raising campaign for :  Since we are still not taking paychecks, it has been difficult to collect the cash needed to pay off our small opening loan (a credit card) , and order new product for the store at the same time, while making sure we pay rent! Our desire is to be able to continue through the holidays and into our second year, all the while spending our time searching for new and interesting hard to find vegan specialty items, bringing in products that our customers request, and new items from overseas too!
In this we need your help- and dont forget- putting on special events like the ones listed above cost money too! Help us fund projects that help both our human and animal friends in need!

**There are perks listed for specific amounts, but these amounts are not required to donate! Every amount counts! Even the small amounts! **


The Impact

We want to be able to provide a much wider variety in our pantry section- we would like to expand into even more unique food items.

In our second year, a major goal is even more fund raising events for animal welfare organizations and sanctuaries we believe in, continuing to help those in need in our area, and of course to continue our outreach and workshops for those in transition or interested in going vegan but not sure where to start.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help by inviting your friends who can, sharing our story, posting on Face Book and Twitter! Thank you!!
story_txt:
Hello!
My dream has always been to provide a place where vegans, folks in transition, or the "veggie curious" could shop, where they could find something to help them, answer their questions, entertain them, educate them, or just plain make them laugh. Everyne is welcome here.  I provide cruelty-free, hard-to-find products to the South Sound area. I make it my goal to search out specialty vegan products and pantry items not found in my area. 
I sell:  Cruelty free bags, shoes, makeup, body care products, jewelry, slogan t-shirts and totes. Gourmet vegan chocolates cookies and treats and  Specialty food items, cheeses, vitamins and mixes,  gift baskets to order, toys and treats for every holiday! Vintage housewares and more! 
In our first year, we held our first annual "Blanket Day for EGYHOP" helping collect warm items for Olympia's downtown homeless, held a month-long fund raising campaign for Pigs Peace Sanctuary, Held a two-day "Transition WorkShop Series" for folks looking for help in beginning a vegan lifestyle, and welcomed vegan cookbook author Joshua Ploeg who not only entertained, but made us some amazing food! 

What We Need & What You Get

Heres what we are holding this fund raising campaign for :  Since we are still not taking paychecks, it has been difficult to collect the cash needed to pay off our small opening loan (a credit card) , and order new product for the store at the same time, while making sure we pay rent! Our desire is to be able to continue through the holidays and into our second year, all the while spending our time searching for new and interesting hard to find vegan specialty items, bringing in products that our customers request, and new items from overseas too! In this we need your help- and dont forget- putting on special events like the ones listed above cost money too! Help us fund projects that help both our human and animal friends in need! 

**There are perks listed for specific amounts, but these amounts are not required to donate! Every amount counts! Even the small amounts! **

The Impact

We want to be able to provide a much wider variety in our pantry section- we would like to expand into even more unique food items. 
In our second year, a major goal is even more fund raising events for animal welfare organizations and sanctuaries we believe in, continuing to help those in need in our area, and of course to continue our outreach and workshops for those in transition or interested in going vegan but not sure where to start.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please help by inviting your friends who can, sharing our story, posting on Face Book and Twitter! Thank you!!

story:
Who is Dan

Dan Rathbun is one of the top contributor to the Sketchup Plugin community. He created a few usefull tools, but mostly he helped a lot of plugin developers create great plugins for Sketchup ! If you use a plugin, it's probably thanks to the direct or indirect help the dev got from Dan. His contribution is simply huge !
As a novice developer, I don't know what I would do without him and what he contributed to the community.

Why he needs us

When I came across this post from Dan ("I got sick and NEED income"), I thought that I would donate some money to him. That's what a lot of people do when they want to thank a plugin dev. But I said to myself, "wait a second, I'm broke and this guy certainly derserve more than the 20 bucks I can give him..."
So here it is, a donation compaign for this great man. If ever you used a Sketchup Plugin, Dan helped you. Now it's time to help him !

story:
The Staley B. Keith Social Justice Center is an organization that was formed in the city of Hudson, NY to empower young black men to resist the marginalization of our communities.

The mission of our Center is to help eliminate persistent poverty; to provide opportunities for black males to become leaders; and to transform marginalized neighborhoods into vibrant, healthy communities through advocacy, empowerment, and community service.

We are seeking funding in the amount of $15,000 to launch four key programs of our center this year:

1)   A training program focused on systems change advocacy.

2)  A self-empowerment program.

3)  A mentorship program, in partnership with the Hudson City School District and Bard College at Simon’s Rock.

4)  The establishment of a physical space that will bring together individuals from different racial, socioeconomic and religious backgrounds to support black men working for positive change.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about what we're up to.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to assist in getting the message out.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support!

story:
Our Story

My name is Sonya. I've been a stay at home mom for 

18years, thanks to my husband Joey of 24 years.

Now I've decided to do something for me now that all of my children are out on their own. I've always had the desire to own a diverse up-scale  beauty salon where you could bring everyone together and enjoy salon time together. 

The Impact

Bringing everyone together will be a success. We are a small southern town with many races in this area. We want to be the Salon that caters to all and any.


What We Need & What You Get

These funds will be used to purchase salon stations, salon styling chairs, salon dryers, and salon shampoo bowls.

story:
Starting a business? Thinking about it? Startup veteran? Or are you just looking to improve your company?

Right now we’re living in the golden age of entrepreneurship where the rules of the game have changed — there has never been a better time in history to start or be building a business.

But with so much noise on what it takes to become a successful entrepreneur and build a successful business, it’s so hard to know who to follow and what to trust.

And it just so happens that we’ve interviewed them, wrote everything down and we’ve been slaving away to put it all together for people like you.


Foundr Version 1.0 is a beautifully designed coffee table book that contains nothing but actionable tips, strategies and advice from world-changing individuals like Richard Branson, Arianna Huffington and Seth Godin just to name a few.

Just awesome. We know. We know.

 (Share our Kickstarter Campaign and get 3 FREE EBOOKS!)

Foundr Version 1.0 features 7 comprehensive chapters covering everything from starting a business, building a team, raising capital and more from over 30 game-changing entrepreneurs — we’re not talking a simple collection of mumbo-jumbo interviews where you dig for useful little nuggets of gold: we’ve broken it down to deliver the stuff you actually need to know immediately.

 

For the past three years, Foundr Magazine has interviewed hundreds of successful entrepreneurs in our digital magazine that have disrupted every industry possible from Food to Media to Meditation! We’ve compiled the best bits to share with you.


Find out why and how the best in the world got to where they are today. We take a look at not only multi-million dollar companies, but companies that have changed the world as we know it and put them under the magnifying glass. We find out for you that pivotal moment, that pivotal step that made them what they are today.

Learn how Joel Gascoigne took an idea to a product with paying customers in just seven weeks, and went on to hit 1 million users.

Zipcar created a revolutionary business model in the early days of the sharing economy and challenged the concept of car ownership, rising to become a world leader in transportation.

Since Foundr was nothing more than a laptop balanced on Nathan Chan’s lap, we’ve experienced our own fair share of ups and downs on our journey to success. We know what it’s like in the trenches and to suffer those inevitable setbacks and failures every entrepreneur goes through. But one thing became clear — getting through was only possible because we could learn from the best in the world. More than anyone else, we understand the value of learning from the experiences of others and how to stand on the shoulders of giants.


Since March 2013, we we’ve been dedicated to helping entrepreneurs and startups of all shapes and sizes achieve their potential. We’ve had the privilege of interviewing some of the greatest entrepreneurs of our generation and are proud to share knowledge that’s by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs.


As an entrepreneur your most important resource is time — and you can’t be wasting it searching through hours and hours of content to find what's right for you. We’ve done all the hard work and compiled all of the best information from over three years and hundreds of interviews.


We want to give you access to not only the same lessons that have led to our success, but the same lessons that have led to the rise of world-changing companies like AOL, Virgin Group, Huffington Post, Zipcar, Y Combinator, and so many others!

 

 “Foundr’s the perfect platform for the new generation of entrepreneurs who don’t know where to go or what to do. Aspiring entrepreneur looking to start your business? I highly recommend checking out Foundr – an invaluable resource to help get your business off the ground.” 

— Daymond John, Founder of FUBU


“If you’re looking for a great resource to hear the stories of today’s successful entrepreneurs and learn what’s needed to be successful yourself, Foundr is where you should be allocating your time.”

— Gary Vaynerchuk, Founder of VaynerMedia


“If you are looking to learn about entrepreneurship you have to check out Foundr. They have awesome interviews with some of the world’s leading business experts.”

— Marie Forleo, Founder of MarieTV


For the better half of a year the Foundr team have been working diligently to bring this book to life. We’ve spared no expense in making sure we deliver the best reading experience.


We’ve painstakingly chosen the entrepreneurs to feature, we’ve finalised the manuscript and we’ve carefully crafted a beautiful design — there’s only one thing left to do:


 

 EXCLUSIVE to Indiegogo InDemand only.

story:
Summary:

My name is Kevin, my campaign is to initially raise $1000+ (or more) to fund an idea which I call Tiki Taxi iClub. Just to be clear I am not offering to sell shares in a company or any kind of securities here, I am seeking donations from people, who either know me, or know my capabilities and seek to help me reach my initial goal to establish the first steps in getting this started, or perhaps they desire one of the great perks.

My goal is to start a simple online company using these funds. Your funds will build the backbone and get basics completed. The company will own 2 brands which I created. One brand, I invented at age 24, a second at age 37. This business structure is designed to own these brands, and help provide a way to achieve a personal dream that can only succeed by other people helping participating in it by getting the word out.

The dream, I want to fulfill, I need to start now. I need your help.

You see, just like I had this fun model below created and

it was a true model or concept of a tangible idea:

Which then became a real entity below: being a fun tiki theme car.

As you view the photo you are realizing that I don't think like everyone else?

I Never have, perhaps never will. It may seem silly but it worked amazingly well.

This project had a huge impact in its day and is a story in and of itself. But that is not why we are here today.

Well, I came up with a new model below, one I call 'Tiki Taxi iClub' model:

Perhaps a little more grown up than the other idea, but still kept the fun name.

Just as I went from toy car to real car, I have also turned this Software into a real entity. Although it is less visible like the car was to the public due to the way it is constructed, it is perhaps less easy to show a picture of how it even works, but it is a functional online entity just the same.

And we're just about ready to rip, or peel out. Just like the fun image below, we just need to hit the gas pedal, shift gears, and we are going have serious traction and create some real smoke.

                        Are you in?

.

I am in my own race against time, as a few years ago I learned I have a disease attacking a part of my brain which has brought upon its own challenges. I left work and I have taken the past few years of my time to organize what I already knew, get it out of my head, and put it into this company structure. In time, I may no longer be able to get things across the way I can right now,so for me, time is of the essence. 

I have chosen to go the route of indiegogo and rely on friends, family, and people who buy into to fresh ideas. My condition is invisible to most but progressing. Although I am mortgage free, debt free and of sound mind (well that is debateable :) I still struggle to put in a regular work day compared to what I used to achieve in a full day.

However that doesn't mean I haven't already input valueable work and information into this concept. Which I am willing to let you be part of. I have had over $100K of flights spent on me flying me around the globe to chase certain resource hotspots which is just for starters, and I have a fairly good grasp on where the future is going in many industries. I also spend a few years at a $300 Billion corporation that helped build the internet, which just means I have a good guess as to where things are headed.

This isn't about me, so I'm not going to get all personal here, this is about sharing valuable ideas and truthful knowledge in order to bring about needed change to where it is needed, seeding other peoples dreams with capital and having fun doing so.

We are on the brink of some huge changes on this planet, and I want my brands to be part of the goodness of what I know is coming down the pipe.

The magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve will be impossible to express in words but can be summed up as this "I am grateful for all you have done for me." this is my gift back to friends, family, the planet. 

For years I wanted to set up a structure that has potential for perpetual growth and excludes no one from participating, allows all to learn what I have learned the hard way, and which uses some of the data and knowledge I have worked so hard to acquire to propel ideas to a new level. I didn't have the tools before, now I do, and so do you. So take action now.

What We Need & What You Get

We need fuel, and capital is the fuel. Why just a $1000?, well I hope to exceed this amount by alot X2,X3,X10, but I also want to hit my target so $1K is our first monetary goal to hit by June 20th, and should be easily met by the intended date required. Any amount over the goal will be deployed in further setting up the iclub structure or expanding it.

First I need $500 to file an LLC or a Limited Liability Company. Next, I will use this entity to obtain a Trademark under its name that will survive me and be owned by the LLC. An additional $400 to set-up a 2nd entity and join the 2 by agreements. $100 to file fees and paperwork. Sounds simple enough.

Then what I need is MEMBERS, people who want to participate in this idea, I'm good at that part. I'm good at attracting people.

The rest of the necessary funds to build our model will come in via online memberships sold to interested parties who want to be a part of this project and its concept and its model. I also have a grant application pending but that is independent of this indiegogo site effort.

The plan is the LLC will buy a 50% stake in an existing private numbered canadian corporation. This company already exists, and it has already obtained 100% rights to all my intellectual property via a pre-existing registered security agreement. Its ready to go. This was expensive and timely to set-up, its done. If I were to be hit by a bus tomorrow this structure would be in place to keep things going.

A partnership between the LLC and a legitimate formed investment club entity will uses my service mark as its partnership trade name. The partnership will be called "Tiki Taxi Investment Club", it will be part owned by a USA LLC who will initially fund it using any proceeds raised here or from its new members. It will also have a part ownership from a Canada entity who feeds it intel and data that has been in the works for quite some time. It will use TDAmeritrade Platform and myiclub.com accounting software.

The First 100 Members or so, will visit a website and receive an email inviting them to join by signing simple agreements.

Then via mail or electronic signature via Docusign.net or Yousendit.com, a very simple 1 page arrangement. Membership Payments online via paypal or (interac in Canada) or (ACH in USA). It can all be done at home from your computer. Easy. Simple. Legal.

The iclub entity will operate transparently and visibly at myiclub.com as a legitimate registered investment club in the USA, and for Canada a similar deal, utilizing some of the newest technology only just years old. The club will allow users from anywhere in the world to login, and see what we are upto.

Meaning of name: Tiki to me means a spiritual wanderer, and Taxi means mechanism to get from A to B, so Tiki Taxi to me meant a way to get people to join me from getting from one place to another. In this case, the club is just an online method of pooling intel from many locations and resources into viable ventures that I hope will grow enough to help assist others in carrying out their dreams too.  

The iclub will initially have 2 membership categories for sale:

1)Watch and learn member which is $12/year and which these members can see what is going on, but have no financial stake in the club, they can just watch and learn. If they want to copy us on their own, no problem. If they want to join up they become and active stakeholder member, see below.

2)Active and Stakeholder member which do have a stake in club assets and can vote on what the raised funds will go into, which can be from min $100/yr per person upto a maximum of 25% of the total club assets at any given time. If the assets were $1000, then the max for any one new member would be $250. If the assets were $50,000, then the max would be $12,500. The minimum to vote or have a stake in club is $100/year.

Each club member will have the opportunity to just watch and learn, or if they choose to, they can become an active paid member for the price of a movie ticket, whom also can recieve a share of this club assets in proportion to what they choose to  participate which can be as little as $8.33/month or one time for $100/year.

I have sold all my intellectual property to a numbered company in Canada whom holds everything I own or ever created, of which the LLC will own 50%, and of which the iclub will also benefit from data and intellectual property in certain other ways. (This IP is non-public information as it is pending filing intellectual property documents but will be revealed over time as needed.)

As additional resources are raised over time, a second investment club entity in Canada will be started usind a second Brand already set-up, to do what cannot necessarily be done in the USA pertaining to certain Canadian Securities rules or ones not listed in US, or on, USA exchanges. Each side of the border will have a 50% stake in the other entity so that all cross-border bases are covered.

The funds will be deployed in things I understand. established Brand Names, and certain Resources. Their is a whole Business Plan developed that manages risk but exploits some of the hottest property on the planet in silver, gold, oil, and rare materials, plus land positions that are set to capitalize on discoveries I am aware of.

Taxes, the LLC and investment club do not pre-pay state or individual taxes. USA Members are therefore required to file any capital gains they withdraw themselves where they reside. Canada Members are the same deal. Withdrawals are only allowed 3x per year at or on online meeting dates, as are extra contributions to keep it simple and organized.

Who am I? My work background is rather diverse, I have been in Marketing, Sales, Engineering firms and Oil and Gas industries. I have promoted several Brands, some of which were world class brand names, some were not. I have run a small business, and been a manager with major corporations, and a bunch of other skilled jobs that seem to matter less now facing these other personal issues. I have also been on exploration discovery wells in 4 continents and I know where the best future oil and gas reserves are situated, who owns them, and who has best chance succeeding. I intend to put non-proprietary data into a business model to benefit all the members.

One fact remains is it takes money to solve many problems in this world, more than money it takes mindful people to direct the money appropriately to solve those problems. I promote mindful capitalism, governments try and succeed in certain areas but the heart and minds of regular people seem to be more impactful, more resourceful and faster acting than big entities like the governments. I intend to attract those who share this sentiment.

I have a super pipeline of up and coming ventures already researched to seed this model for 2-5 years to get it going, the rest will be up to the calibre of the members. For me, I have no time to wait, I must act now, so I hope you can believe that I know what I am doing, and come along for the ride.

I intend to proove that last statement as best I can. So part of the plan is to return or re-seed money raised to help other peoples dreams be realized. So 10% of any money raised here that is over the initial $1000 mark will be used to help fund other peoples goals (5% here on indiegogo and 5% on our Kiva microfinance page).

http://www.kiva.org/invitedby/kevin30729234

THE PERKS.

I have obtained some interesting books, art, photos, collectables in my travels which I realize I can't take with me. So I have created some incentives to those who choose to help me reach my goals. I am offering you perks, for your choice of some interesting things which are mailable. I organized the Perks into levels, I call 'Elevator Levels'.

ELEVATOR LEVEL Parking, $0.00

No funds contributed but you help get the word out. A .pdf file future newsletter of the iClubs goals, and plans for 2012. A synopsis of what we intend to do within the first year. Leave your email to claim this perk.

ELEVATOR LEVEL 0, $2

A thank you email. Password Access to our wordpress blog.

ELEVATOR LEVEL 1, $15

A mailed card. A thank you. A signed logo mark. A random photo.

An email sharing the Kiva loans ,or indiegogo donations we made.

http://www.kiva.org/invitedby/kevin30729234

ELEVATOR LEVEL 2, $50

A copy of a Selected USED BOOK, your pick, first come, first serve

(Scroll to the bottom to pick from the list).

ELEVATOR LEVEL 3, $100 

A copy of a First Edition Book from our select picks,

or a limited edition print #1 of only 200 of Select Artwork called "BELIEVE".

Great gift for daughters bedrooms.

ELEVATOR LEVEL 4, $250

Choice of 1 of these 3 beautiful Artworks.

A series of 3 'Peter Lik' Original Photographs from a gallery.

. 

Shipping not included.

ELEVATOR LEVEL 5, $1000+

Choice of 1 Artwork. 1 of 1 Framed Pair of 501's. With contact shots

Trademark Artwork, Created by Owner with a series of B/W photos.

The Brand was created in 1994. This item was framed in 2008

professionally and is now behind glass.

Shipping not included.

(Scroll to the bottom to view 'pick from' list).

THE 'PICK FROM' LIST IS GOING TO BE EMAILED TO YOU AS A .PDF FILE. SEND US YOUR EMAIL AND intended ELEVATOR LEVEL#, the list is first come first serve, when each perk is gone, its gone. So don't delay. We will update Perk# not available on this site.

 'PICK FROM' LEVEL 2 BOOKS: Choose 1

Paperback 007 IAN FLEMING - MOONRAKER, LIVE AND LET DIE,CASINO ROYALE, DR.NO, FROM RUSSIA WITH LOVE, THE MAN WITH THE GOLDEN GUN.,DIAMONDS ARE FOREVER,'LIVE and LET DIE,THUNDERBALL,YOU ONLY LIVE TWICE.

Others not shown.

WHERE EVER YOU GO THERE YOU ARE. Jon Kabat Zinn

THE ART OF THE START Guy Kawasaki

OLIVER TWIST - Charles Dickens

More to come.

 'PICK FROM' LEVEL 3 BOOKS: Choose 1 below

First Edition: ALDOUS HUXLEY - BRAVE NEW WORLD, Hardcover 1932, 1946.

First Edition: CHARLES DICKENS - TALE OF TWO CITIES, Hardcover london

First Edition: JOHN GARDNER, 007 JAMES BOND FOR SPECIAL SERVICES 1982 Cape.

First Edition: RUYARD KIPLING, 21 Tales, 1946 Shown

First Edition: RUYARD KIPLING, KIM, 1901 (worn cover 111 year old) (not shown)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Link, Email a friend, you can print off a sheet.

A bulletin board or campaign for us. Email or social network your friends. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Summary:
My name is Kevin, my campaign is to initially raise $1000+ (or more) to fund an idea which I call Tiki Taxi iClub. Just to be clear I am not offering to sell shares in a company or any kind of securities here, I am seeking donations from people, who either know me, or know my capabilities and seek to help me reach my initial goal to establish the first steps in getting this started, or perhaps they desire one of the great perks.
My goal is to start a simple online company using these funds. Your funds will build the backbone and get basics completed. The company will own 2 brands which I created. One brand, I invented at age 24, a second at age 37. This business structure is designed to own these brands, and help provide a way to achieve a personal dream that can only succeed by other people helping participating in it by getting the word out.
The dream, I want to fulfill, I need to start now. I need your help.
You see, just like I had this fun model below created and
it was a true model or concept of a tangible idea:

Which then became a real entity below: being a fun tiki theme car.
As you view the photo you are realizing that I don't think like everyone else?
I Never have, perhaps never will. It may seem silly but it worked amazingly well.
This project had a huge impact in its day and is a story in and of itself. But that is not why we are here today.

Well, I came up with a new model below, one I call 'Tiki Taxi iClub' model:
Perhaps a little more grown up than the other idea, but still kept the fun name.

Just as I went from toy car to real car, I have also turned this Software into a real entity. Although it is less visible like the car was to the public due to the way it is constructed, it is perhaps less easy to show a picture of how it even works, but it is a functional online entity just the same.
And we're just about ready to rip, or peel out. Just like the fun image below, we just need to hit the gas pedal, shift gears, and we are going have serious traction and create some real smoke.
                        Are you in?
.
I am in my own race against time, as a few years ago I learned I have a disease attacking a part of my brain which has brought upon its own challenges. I left work and I have taken the past few years of my time to organize what I already knew, get it out of my head, and put it into this company structure. In time, I may no longer be able to get things across the way I can right now,so for me, time is of the essence. 
I have chosen to go the route of indiegogo and rely on friends, family, and people who buy into to fresh ideas. My condition is invisible to most but progressing. Although I am mortgage free, debt free and of sound mind (well that is debateable :) I still struggle to put in a regular work day compared to what I used to achieve in a full day.
However that doesn't mean I haven't already input valueable work and information into this concept. Which I am willing to let you be part of. I have had over $100K of flights spent on me flying me around the globe to chase certain resource hotspots which is just for starters, and I have a fairly good grasp on where the future is going in many industries. I also spend a few years at a $300 Billion corporation that helped build the internet, which just means I have a good guess as to where things are headed.
This isn't about me, so I'm not going to get all personal here, this is about sharing valuable ideas and truthful knowledge in order to bring about needed change to where it is needed, seeding other peoples dreams with capital and having fun doing so.
We are on the brink of some huge changes on this planet, and I want my brands to be part of the goodness of what I know is coming down the pipe.
The magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve will be impossible to express in words but can be summed up as this "I am grateful for all you have done for me." this is my gift back to friends, family, the planet. 
For years I wanted to set up a structure that has potential for perpetual growth and excludes no one from participating, allows all to learn what I have learned the hard way, and which uses some of the data and knowledge I have worked so hard to acquire to propel ideas to a new level. I didn't have the tools before, now I do, and so do you. So take action now.
What We Need & What You Get
We need fuel, and capital is the fuel. Why just a $1000?, well I hope to exceed this amount by alot X2,X3,X10, but I also want to hit my target so $1K is our first monetary goal to hit by June 20th, and should be easily met by the intended date required. Any amount over the goal will be deployed in further setting up the iclub structure or expanding it.
First I need $500 to file an LLC or a Limited Liability Company. Next, I will use this entity to obtain a Trademark under its name that will survive me and be owned by the LLC. An additional $400 to set-up a 2nd entity and join the 2 by agreements. $100 to file fees and paperwork. Sounds simple enough.
Then what I need is MEMBERS, people who want to participate in this idea, I'm good at that part. I'm good at attracting people.
The rest of the necessary funds to build our model will come in via online memberships sold to interested parties who want to be a part of this project and its concept and its model. I also have a grant application pending but that is independent of this indiegogo site effort.
The plan is the LLC will buy a 50% stake in an existing private numbered canadian corporation. This company already exists, and it has already obtained 100% rights to all my intellectual property via a pre-existing registered security agreement. Its ready to go. This was expensive and timely to set-up, its done. If I were to be hit by a bus tomorrow this structure would be in place to keep things going.
A partnership between the LLC and a legitimate formed investment club entity will uses my service mark as its partnership trade name. The partnership will be called "Tiki Taxi Investment Club", it will be part owned by a USA LLC who will initially fund it using any proceeds raised here or from its new members. It will also have a part ownership from a Canada entity who feeds it intel and data that has been in the works for quite some time. It will use TDAmeritrade Platform and myiclub.com accounting software.
The First 100 Members or so, will visit a website and receive an email inviting them to join by signing simple agreements.
Then via mail or electronic signature via Docusign.net or Yousendit.com, a very simple 1 page arrangement. Membership Payments online via paypal or (interac in Canada) or (ACH in USA). It can all be done at home from your computer. Easy. Simple. Legal.
The iclub entity will operate transparently and visibly at myiclub.com as a legitimate registered investment club in the USA, and for Canada a similar deal, utilizing some of the newest technology only just years old. The club will allow users from anywhere in the world to login, and see what we are upto.
Meaning of name: Tiki to me means a spiritual wanderer, and Taxi means mechanism to get from A to B, so Tiki Taxi to me meant a way to get people to join me from getting from one place to another. In this case, the club is just an online method of pooling intel from many locations and resources into viable ventures that I hope will grow enough to help assist others in carrying out their dreams too.  
The iclub will initially have 2 membership categories for sale:
1)Watch and learn member which is $12/year and which these members can see what is going on, but have no financial stake in the club, they can just watch and learn. If they want to copy us on their own, no problem. If they want to join up they become and active stakeholder member, see below.
2)Active and Stakeholder member which do have a stake in club assets and can vote on what the raised funds will go into, which can be from min $100/yr per person upto a maximum of 25% of the total club assets at any given time. If the assets were $1000, then the max for any one new member would be $250. If the assets were $50,000, then the max would be $12,500. The minimum to vote or have a stake in club is $100/year.
Each club member will have the opportunity to just watch and learn, or if they choose to, they can become an active paid member for the price of a movie ticket, whom also can recieve a share of this club assets in proportion to what they choose to  participate which can be as little as $8.33/month or one time for $100/year.
I have sold all my intellectual property to a numbered company in Canada whom holds everything I own or ever created, of which the LLC will own 50%, and of which the iclub will also benefit from data and intellectual property in certain other ways. (This IP is non-public information as it is pending filing intellectual property documents but will be revealed over time as needed.)
As additional resources are raised over time, a second investment club entity in Canada will be started usind a second Brand already set-up, to do what cannot necessarily be done in the USA pertaining to certain Canadian Securities rules or ones not listed in US, or on, USA exchanges. Each side of the border will have a 50% stake in the other entity so that all cross-border bases are covered.
The funds will be deployed in things I understand. established Brand Names, and certain Resources. Their is a whole Business Plan developed that manages risk but exploits some of the hottest property on the planet in silver, gold, oil, and rare materials, plus land positions that are set to capitalize on discoveries I am aware of.
Taxes, the LLC and investment club do not pre-pay state or individual taxes. USA Members are therefore required to file any capital gains they withdraw themselves where they reside. Canada Members are the same deal. Withdrawals are only allowed 3x per year at or on online meeting dates, as are extra contributions to keep it simple and organized.
Who am I? My work background is rather diverse, I have been in Marketing, Sales, Engineering firms and Oil and Gas industries. I have promoted several Brands, some of which were world class brand names, some were not. I have run a small business, and been a manager with major corporations, and a bunch of other skilled jobs that seem to matter less now facing these other personal issues. I have also been on exploration discovery wells in 4 continents and I know where the best future oil and gas reserves are situated, who owns them, and who has best chance succeeding. I intend to put non-proprietary data into a business model to benefit all the members.
One fact remains is it takes money to solve many problems in this world, more than money it takes mindful people to direct the money appropriately to solve those problems. I promote mindful capitalism, governments try and succeed in certain areas but the heart and minds of regular people seem to be more impactful, more resourceful and faster acting than big entities like the governments. I intend to attract those who share this sentiment.
I have a super pipeline of up and coming ventures already researched to seed this model for 2-5 years to get it going, the rest will be up to the calibre of the members. For me, I have no time to wait, I must act now, so I hope you can believe that I know what I am doing, and come along for the ride.
I intend to proove that last statement as best I can. So part of the plan is to return or re-seed money raised to help other peoples dreams be realized. So 10% of any money raised here that is over the initial $1000 mark will be used to help fund other peoples goals (5% here on indiegogo and 5% on our Kiva microfinance page).
http://www.kiva.org/invitedby/kevin30729234
THE PERKS.
I have obtained some interesting books, art, photos, collectables in my travels which I realize I can't take with me. So I have created some incentives to those who choose to help me reach my goals. I am offering you perks, for your choice of some interesting things which are mailable. I organized the Perks into levels, I call 'Elevator Levels'.
ELEVATOR LEVEL Parking, $0.00
No funds contributed but you help get the word out. A .pdf file future newsletter of the iClubs goals, and plans for 2012. A synopsis of what we intend to do within the first year. Leave your email to claim this perk.
ELEVATOR LEVEL 0, $2
A thank you email. Password Access to our wordpress blog.
ELEVATOR LEVEL 1, $15
A mailed card. A thank you. A signed logo mark. A random photo.
An email sharing the Kiva loans ,or indiegogo donations we made.
http://www.kiva.org/invitedby/kevin30729234
ELEVATOR LEVEL 2, $50
A copy of a Selected USED BOOK, your pick, first come, first serve

(Scroll to the bottom to pick from the list).
ELEVATOR LEVEL 3, $100 
A copy of a First Edition Book from our select picks,

or a limited edition print #1 of only 200 of Select Artwork called "BELIEVE".
Great gift for daughters bedrooms.


ELEVATOR LEVEL 4, $250
Choice of 1 of these 3 beautiful Artworks.
A series of 3 'Peter Lik' Original Photographs from a gallery.


. 
Shipping not included.
ELEVATOR LEVEL 5, $1000+
Choice of 1 Artwork. 1 of 1 Framed Pair of 501's. With contact shots
Trademark Artwork, Created by Owner with a series of B/W photos.
The Brand was created in 1994. This item was framed in 2008
professionally and is now behind glass.


Shipping not included.
(Scroll to the bottom to view 'pick from' list).
THE 'PICK FROM' LIST IS GOING TO BE EMAILED TO YOU AS A .PDF FILE. SEND US YOUR EMAIL AND intended ELEVATOR LEVEL#, the list is first come first serve, when each perk is gone, its gone. So don't delay. We will update Perk# not available on this site.
 'PICK FROM' LEVEL 2 BOOKS: Choose 1
Paperback 007 IAN FLEMING - MOONRAKER, LIVE AND LET DIE,CASINO ROYALE, DR.NO, FROM RUSSIA WITH LOVE, THE MAN WITH THE GOLDEN GUN.,DIAMONDS ARE FOREVER,'LIVE and LET DIE,THUNDERBALL,YOU ONLY LIVE TWICE.
Others not shown.

More to come.

story:
WHAT IS SUGHAR?


Sughar (which in local language means skilled and confident woman) is a social enterprise program in Pakistan aiming to end ending the negative customs of exchange marriages, child marriages, honour killings by promoting the beautiful traditions and providing socio-economic empowerment to women in tribal communities of Pakistan.

Sughar establishes Women Centers in villages offering a 6 month course to tribal women. The course involves value-adding the traditional embroidery, basic education and literacy skills, enterprise development, and life skills sessions. It also raises awareness of rural women on their equal status and rights. 

Each course offers a minimum loan to each woman after graduating to initiate their own small businesses using their newly learned skills of value adding the traditional embroidery!

ABOUT THE SUGHAR PRODUCTS!

The beautiful products that you are seeing below are a creation of women in Tribal and Rural areas of Pakistan, who even living under the strict customs of their tribes have the best knowledge in design and quality! 

Having to see these amazing skills of rural women in villages of Pakistan, Sughar in early 2012 launched Pakistan's first ever rural Women Fashion Brand! This was a big step in the fashion industry of Pakistan when Rural and tribal women were defining fashion in their own style!

Right now, when the program reaches to more then 700 women, we are struggling with the sustainability as well as helping these women launch their businesses as the only market being targeted was Pakistan's. What Sughar needs from you now is to take Pakistani Rural Women Embroidery Art to the world out there and let everyone see, feel, and wear with pride the products that these women create! 

WHY SHOULD YOU SHOP AT SUGHAR?

Along with contributing towards providing socio-economic empowerment to women with Sughar, following are the reasons you would like to Shop as well!

  • A beautiful and unique product which is sure to turn heads when you carry it!
  • The top quality embroidery where every stitch defines the love and dignity these women have put into it. 
  • With your shopping you would make possible for several women in Pakistan, to launch their businesses with the help of Sughar and their products reaching to almost every continent around the world!

HOW DOES THIS WORK?

On Your right is the Perks column for Indiegogo campaigns which we have taken the liberty of using as our product order rack. [Please Attention: The cost of Shipping is already added to the prices showed on the right]

  • Read through the details of each product and view the photo provided on the left. (Please scroll to the photo to see the title)
  • Click on [Claim this Perk] to order your purchase!
  • Fill in your address where you want your product to be sent, 
  • Make the payment online right here at Indiegogo

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

We totally understand if you are unable to make purchases this time, but there are other important ways you can help!

  • Tell 3 more people who would definitely be interested in shopping for a cause!
  • Send this campaign to your staff/team if they might be interested 
  • Share the links below! 

Thank you so much! Please find below the photos of each product mentioned on the right: 

Product photos: 

Sughar Frog Clutch!

Sughar Bridal Bag (First one on the left)

Sughar Rili Bag!

Dancing Camel Clutch

Sughar Tribal Bag carried in a Fashion Show!

Sughar Balochi Gaj Clutch

Marvi Art Work Wall Hanger

CAMEL STOLE PHOTO TO BE UPLOADED SOON!

Sugahr Peacock Bag

story:
The Mercy and Wisdom Community Health Clinic is a non-profit organization that was formed to provide comprehensive health care to Portland communities and to serve as an educational institute to teach the public how to sustain a healthy lifestyle. We are strongly dedicated to serving an under-insured, non-insured and low-income population. The clinic’s mission is to help low-income and non-insured people to achieve health through integrative medical care and education.

Mercy and Wisdom is building a community garden for patients and providers on the clinic property by transforming a portion of the parking lot into a usable and accessible garden that will promote mental and physical health.

Through the garden, we have several goals that will benefit the patients in need. First, we want to eliminate food struggles and hunger among patients who are experiencing food insecurity. Second, we want to provide a green space in southeast 82nd Ave and Powell Blvd. This neighborhood is covered in concrete with limited trees or vegetation. Third, the garden will provide an area for practitioners to grow medicinal herbs for treatments. Finally, as an alternative health clinic we focus on health care solutions that treat the whole patient. To this aim, the garden provides a green space to exercise, communicate and learn about gardening while growing food.  

The first stage the funds will be spent to obtain permits for concrete removal, move business sign transform and expand the perimeter fence and install the water system. 

We are also seeking other funding sources and have applied for grants to finance the project. Future stages include building garden beds, soil testing and preparation, landscaping and planting vegetables and fruit trees.

Although Portland has more than 50 community gardens, however non of them are active in outer southeast. Also, this area lacks accessible grocery stores. There are so many people who are hungry and not able to afford to buy food for their families!

If you like our project get the word out. All efforts count!

story:
Spring Run Market is Greenville’s first outlet for organic & local foods, soon to be an organic market, juice/ smoothie/ snack bar plus workshops!


Rooted in the connection to Farmers and Makers of Real Food

Spring Run Market, a farm-direct co-op & market, dreams of opening a neighborhood market showcasing local and organic foods, and where we can educate folks about Real Food and Real Health!

We founded Spring Run over 5 years ago with a vision of creating a community hub centered on the message of fresh foods and holistic living! At Spring Run, we focus on “Real Food”, providing organic freshness, nothing refined, processed or modified.

Our Crowdfunder Appeal is calling for help in transforming a space on Charles Blvd. into an organic market filled with fresh produce, meats & more, a fresh juice/smoothie/snack bar, plus a space to hold our workshops. There are currently very few places to buy fresh local AND organic foods in Greenville, so the need for a market dedicated to these foods is great, not only for the community that lives here but also the 20,000+ students and transients that come through Greenville every year!


Our History

Spring Run Market was born in fall of 2008, when we formed a co-op for a local beef Farm, Nooherooka Natural, who had no outlet in Greenville at the time. Organically grown produce was added through Jones Farm, then Brothers Farm, then later Gray's Garden, and we just grew from there :)

In Sept 2009, we had our first major open-air market event in Arlington Village, becoming the very first outlet in Greenville for local organics, with our winter markets indoors at the Tipsy Teapot to keep us year-round. 

                                  "2009 Fall Pirate Invasion"

We grew from there over the next few years to a 6-8 tent open-air market, with local farms, vendors, non-profits, CSA’s, and an online marketplace. In those early days, it felt like an insurgence, as the resistance to buying foods in this way was not exactly well received. Things like sprouted flours, local & organic produce, and truly natural meats raised on pasture, were pretty foreign to our area.

But today, SRM feels like a revolution, with hundreds of folks patroning our market, with a core of about 75 families, that connects them directly to over 50 local small-scale farmers, ranchers, various food producers, bakers, body care producers, and more, who all care about healthy people and a healthy environment!

    

2012 Market at the Tipsy Teapot

Over time, we added in a few non-local bulk order items, such as raw organic cheeses and sprouted grain flours & berries, as the quality and availability was hard to source nearby. We’ve become home to local businesses, such as Healthy Vibrant YOU (gluten free snacks and health coaching), and Good Stuff NC (cold-pressed organic juices), and to non-profits, such as ENC Stop Human Trafficking.

Local non-foods such as handcrafted soaps and Alpaca products, have been regulars to our markets. We’ve organized many events, like Brothers Farm Potlucks, “Local Dinner & a Movie” nights, and workshops ranging from how to make smoothies, to gluten-free living. It’s been an absolutely amazing journey, and we’ve loved serving our community to a healthier life!!

We are poised at the brink of a food renaissance, but we need your help

Today, however, our product selection, availability, and breadth is still limited. Because we don’t have the means or equipment necessary to carry much inventory, orders from some of our suppliers have to be limited to certain times of the month and, to get better pricing, some have high minimum-quantity requirements. These restrictions mean that members need to plan their meals and pickups in advance, which can be tough for busy families.

Our supporters, farms & customers alike, have been telling us for a long time, they’d love to see us open a place that’s open more days and hours, rather than just a few hours on Saturdays. We know that the community values our services and the access we provide to farm-direct and bulk foods, and we feel the imperative, the call to action: we must better meet the need for local & organic products!

Click to see "OUR PASSION" video :)


Our mandate is clear and our vision inspires us every day

Our vision is to create a sustainable entity that will allow not just our present supporters, but the public at large, to support local and organic farmers, ranchers, bakers, and other producers. Our dream: to open a small, but bountiful storefront market offering a wisely selected inventory of organically raised Real Food, organic bulk items, and truly natural household goods, with a Smoothie/ Juice/ Snack “Cafétte”, PLUS continued offerings of our Real Food & Real Health Workshops in the space, while continuing connection with the community with other events at our farms and network of supporters!

The market would share space with several of our vendors, including Healthy Vibrant YOU (gluten-free snacks) and Good Stuff Juices, and have daily hours of operations, setting our members free from the restrictions of a once-a-week 3-hour pickup window.

Johnny & Brittany, Good Stuff Cold-pressed Juices

Debbie Kettler, Health Coach & Gluten-free Snacks


Having a storefront would give us so much, and would change our impact on the community immeasurably. It would allow us to serve a more diverse population, to provide increased visibility for our valued growers and producers, and to have that high-touch, high-service connection with all our community members we so would like opportunity to give more than once a week! We want to see our vision expand into a dynamic community space where people can come to learn and share in the joy of organic, Real Food. We’re asking you to join us in that quest.


Access to fresh seasonal produce, meats, seafood, eggs, and more begins here

For the past few weeks, we have been working hard on planning, and are now renovating the space on Charles Blvd, next to ASAP Photo & Camera. We have the enthusiastic support of our project by the owners at ASAP (our wonderful landlords), from our patrons of the market, and family and friends, and we have close working relations with dozens of local producers who care about the health of families and the environment. We have conducted a survey (you can have your opinion counted too!) and know what the community wants us to stock. With nearly 200 folks responding so far, the TOP 4 REQUESTS are:

Fresh Produce & Herbs
Chicken & Eggs
Nuts & Seeds 
Beef

Click to take our Short Survey :)

Other items we plan to have in the store are: Local and Pastured Pork, Lamb, and other Meats; Organic Bulk items; Organic Sprouted Flours and Berries; Organic Jarred and Canned Goods; Organic Raw Cheeses; Carefully selected Organic Dry (Shelf) Items; Organic Body Care; Other Locally Produced Non-food items; and MORE!!

Most of our inventory will be locally produced, and nearly all will be organically produced and raised! One thing that will set us apart and will be vital to busy families is our incorporation of recipes and menus based on what is available seasonally and on the items in our store. And if we don't carry recipe ingredients, we'll be constantly adding to our list of of those items and where you can buy them! Our "Caffete" will slowly expand to eventually be a full cafe, so providing meals to take home will be our goal for the future!

You are the vital ingredient, our needed coalition

Your generous contributions, rewarded with useful items and mouth-watering yummy goodness (see right hand side bar) will help us with our start-up list:

• Our biggest purchase by far...coolers and freezers
• Commercial Oven/ Stovetop
• Commercial Blenders/ Juicers
• Glass display cases
• Stainless Prep Tables
• Seating & tables
• TV, Sound System for our workshops
• Exterior Sign

• Misc In-Store (shop carts/ baskets, mats, etc)

• Lighting

(These add up to  $19,900, with some items priced as new and some at used pricing)


We've set our "Stretch Goal" for another $5000, which would cover:
Office Equipment & Supplies (includes our POS)
Marketing & Promotions


Our goal ($20,000)  is about a third of what we need to open, with a fully renovated, equipped and stocked store. However, we haven't raised the amount we need and be ready to open the market by June. And that’s why we are here now, asking for your help to meet our goals for the equipment we need to get started.

The majority of the rest of our budget (renovations, consumable expenses, small starting inventory, and working capital) is coming from a small business loan; after that, from a couple of fundraising events in May, investors, and small personal loans from individuals (implemented through Slow Money Organization).


All funds raised, whether investment loans or donations, will be kept separate from the present market operations and dedicated solely to the new market project. Money raised will be used carefully & efficiently, demonstrated in our business plan, with our vision of a functional, energy efficient, sustainable organic market as a blueprint.

We also wanted to mention that we will consider any non-cash donations, esp in the form of any equipment mentioned above!

Help us feed our community the best food on the planet
 
We are now appealing to our greater community to help Spring Run continue to grow, share and educate in the model of socially responsible and healthy lifestyle choices. We know that your energetic support will help us exceed our goal; after all, our work supports our farmers and growers, too, and we want to see them thrive and be rewarded for all the hard work they do making all this delicious goodness available!

Please join us at the forefront of the Food Revolution and help make this dream a reality! Tell your friends and family; support, share, inspire, give -- and get rewarded...your taste buds (and the rest of your body) will thank you! 

We are so close and with your help we can have the store open in just a few weeks. Thank you, from the bottoms of our hearts, for pledging generously and supporting Local Organic Food!


Spring Run Market T-Shirt, an example of one of our perks!

Spring Run Market tote bag, an example of one of our perks!
story_txt:
Spring Run Market is Greenville’s first outlet for organic & local foods, soon to be an organic market, juice/ smoothie/ snack bar plus workshops!
Rooted in the connection to Farmers and Makers of Real FoodSpring Run Market, a farm-direct co-op & market, dreams of opening a neighborhood market showcasing local and organic foods, and where we can educate folks about Real Food and Real Health!
We founded Spring Run over 5 years ago with a vision of creating a community hub centered on the message of fresh foods and holistic living! At Spring Run, we focus on “Real Food”, providing organic freshness, nothing refined, processed or modified.Our Crowdfunder Appeal is calling for help in transforming a space on Charles Blvd. into an organic market filled with fresh produce, meats & more, a fresh juice/smoothie/snack bar, plus a space to hold our workshops. There are currently very few places to buy fresh local AND organic foods in Greenville, so the need for a market dedicated to these foods is great, not only for the community that lives here but also the 20,000+ students and transients that come through Greenville every year!
Our History

Spring Run Market was born in fall of 2008, when we formed a co-op for a local beef Farm, Nooherooka Natural, who had no outlet in Greenville at the time. Organically grown produce was added through Jones Farm, then Brothers Farm, then later Gray's Garden, and we just grew from there :)

In Sept 2009, we had our first major open-air market event in Arlington Village, becoming the very first outlet in Greenville for local organics, with our winter markets indoors at the Tipsy Teapot to keep us year-round. 
                                  "2009 Fall Pirate Invasion"
We grew from there over the next few years to a 6-8 tent open-air market, with local farms, vendors, non-profits, CSA’s, and an online marketplace. In those early days, it felt like an insurgence, as the resistance to buying foods in this way was not exactly well received. Things like sprouted flours, local & organic produce, and truly natural meats raised on pasture, were pretty foreign to our area. 
But today, SRM feels like a revolution, with hundreds of folks patroning our market, with a core of about 75 families, that connects them directly to over 50 local small-scale farmers, ranchers, various food producers, bakers, body care producers, and more, who all care about healthy people and a healthy environment!     2012 Market at the Tipsy TeapotOver time, we added in a few non-local bulk order items, such as raw organic cheeses and sprouted grain flours & berries, as the quality and availability was hard to source nearby. We’ve become home to local businesses, such as Healthy Vibrant YOU (gluten free snacks and health coaching), and Good Stuff NC (cold-pressed organic juices), and to non-profits, such as ENC Stop Human Trafficking.Local non-foods such as handcrafted soaps and Alpaca products, have been regulars to our markets. We’ve organized many events, like Brothers Farm Potlucks, “Local Dinner & a Movie” nights, and workshops ranging from how to make smoothies, to gluten-free living. It’s been an absolutely amazing journey, and we’ve loved serving our community to a healthier life!!We are poised at the brink of a food renaissance, but we need your helpToday, however, our product selection, availability, and breadth is still limited. Because we don’t have the means or equipment necessary to carry much inventory, orders from some of our suppliers have to be limited to certain times of the month and, to get better pricing, some have high minimum-quantity requirements. These restrictions mean that members need to plan their meals and pickups in advance, which can be tough for busy families.Our supporters, farms & customers alike, have been telling us for a long time, they’d love to see us open a place that’s open more days and hours, rather than just a few hours on Saturdays. We know that the community values our services and the access we provide to farm-direct and bulk foods, and we feel the imperative, the call to action: we must better meet the need for local & organic products!
Click to see "OUR PASSION" video :)

Our mandate is clear and our vision inspires us every dayOur vision is to create a sustainable entity that will allow not just our present supporters, but the public at large, to support local and organic farmers, ranchers, bakers, and other producers. Our dream: to open a small, but bountiful storefront market offering a wisely selected inventory of organically raised Real Food, organic bulk items, and truly natural household goods, with a Smoothie/ Juice/ Snack “Cafétte”, PLUS continued offerings of our Real Food & Real Health Workshops in the space, while continuing connection with the community with other events at our farms and network of supporters!The market would share space with several of our vendors, including Healthy Vibrant YOU (gluten-free snacks) and Good Stuff Juices, and have daily hours of operations, setting our members free from the restrictions of a once-a-week 3-hour pickup window. 
Johnny & Brittany, Good Stuff Cold-pressed JuicesDebbie Kettler, Health Coach & Gluten-free SnacksHaving a storefront would give us so much, and would change our impact on the community immeasurably. It would allow us to serve a more diverse population, to provide increased visibility for our valued growers and producers, and to have that high-touch, high-service connection with all our community members we so would like opportunity to give more than once a week! We want to see our vision expand into a dynamic community space where people can come to learn and share in the joy of organic, Real Food. We’re asking you to join us in that quest.Access to fresh seasonal produce, meats, seafood, eggs, and more begins hereFor the past few weeks, we have been working hard on planning, and are now renovating the space on Charles Blvd, next to ASAP Photo & Camera. We have the enthusiastic support of our project by the owners at ASAP (our wonderful landlords), from our patrons of the market, and family and friends, and we have close working relations with dozens of local producers who care about the health of families and the environment. We have conducted a survey (you can have your opinion counted too!) and know what the community wants us to stock. With nearly 200 folks responding so far, the TOP 4 REQUESTS are:Fresh Produce & HerbsChicken & EggsNuts & Seeds Beef Click to take our Short Survey :)Other items we plan to have in the store are: Local and Pastured Pork, Lamb, and other Meats; Organic Bulk items; Organic Sprouted Flours and Berries; Organic Jarred and Canned Goods; Organic Raw Cheeses; Carefully selected Organic Dry (Shelf) Items; Organic Body Care; Other Locally Produced Non-food items; and MORE!! 
Most of our inventory will be locally produced, and nearly all will be organically produced and raised! One thing that will set us apart and will be vital to busy families is our incorporation of recipes and menus based on what is available seasonally and on the items in our store. And if we don't carry recipe ingredients, we'll be constantly adding to our list of of those items and where you can buy them! Our "Caffete" will slowly expand to eventually be a full cafe, so providing meals to take home will be our goal for the future!You are the vital ingredient, our needed coalitionYour generous contributions, rewarded with useful items and mouth-watering yummy goodness (see right hand side bar) will help us with our start-up list:• Our biggest purchase by far...coolers and freezers• Commercial Oven/ Stovetop • Commercial Blenders/ Juicers • Glass display cases • Stainless Prep Tables • Seating & tables• TV, Sound System for our workshops • Exterior Sign 

• Misc In-Store (shop carts/ baskets, mats, etc) 
• Lighting 
(These add up to  $19,900, with some items priced as new and some at used pricing)

We've set our "Stretch Goal" for another $5000, which would cover:Office Equipment & Supplies (includes our POS)Marketing & Promotions 

Our goal ($20,000)  is about a third of what we need to open, with a fully renovated, equipped and stocked store. However, we
haven't raised the amount we need and be ready to
open the market by June. And that’s why we are here now, asking for your help
to meet our goals for the equipment we need to get started.The majority of the rest of our budget (renovations, consumable expenses, small starting inventory, and working capital) is coming from a small business loan; after that, from a couple of fundraising events in May, investors, and small personal loans from individuals (implemented through Slow Money Organization).

Money raised will be used carefully & efficiently, demonstrated in our business plan, with our vision of a functional, energy efficient, sustainable organic market as a blueprint. We also wanted to mention that we will consider any non-cash donations, esp in the form of any equipment mentioned above!Help us feed our community the best food on the planet We are now appealing to our greater community to help Spring Run continue to grow, share and educate in the model of socially responsible and healthy lifestyle choices. story:
Tibatane 

OUR STORY


In the summer of 2013, Founder Bernice Jere was invited to a sustainable business conference by a family friend. At the event she met with inspiring entrepreneurs that were using the power of business to make a change in the world. That event led to numerous conversations and thinking about how she could begin to make a difference and sustainably improve the problems in her home country, Zimbabwe. A country that has been undergoing high levels of unemployment and limited economic opportunity.

Growing up surrounded by poverty, while having a fortunate upbringing, Bernice always felt she wanted to do something to sustainably alleviate the poverty around her. Back in college at Salisbury University, in the fall of 2013, Bernice reached out to some college friends and together decided to create some products that they felt could connect to Africa while also enabling other students to help and join the community. The Tibatane fashion brand was born.

Learn more about Tibatane at www.tibatane.org

WHAT we want to do

Tibatane will hire and train unemployed women and young people in Zimbabwe to sew our t-shirts and accessories. They will be paid fair wages and provided education, gardening and business mentorship support that will empower them to get out of poverty. We believe in the dignity of work, and provide a holistic approach to enabling people to permanently rise out of poverty.

For every product purchased, 10% will support specific community development projects in Zimbabwe. We are starting off with two agriculture projects in December 2014.

WHERE your contribution will go

Here is a breakdown of our budget. With your help we will cover our initial production costs here in the US, which requires we meet production minimums. That means $7,000 to hire a contract manufacturer, including patternmaking, sourcing fabric, sewing, packaging, shipping and labels. In addition, we will use $10,000 of the money to set up our Zimbabwe factory including training, getting machines, legal  and set up fees. $3000 will be used for setting up our brand rep program and legal fees,  that’s $20,000 which is why we really need your help.

  • You can SIGN UP for our weekly email updates to stay in the loop!

    Email Bernice Jere: bernice@tibatane.org

  • Share our story on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.


  • We will be giving away a Pocket Tee w/ African fabric to one of our Facebook community members at the end of our Indiegogo campaign, so make sure to "like" our Facebook page!

And lastly, visit our new website to see our lookbook & see how to join our community.

[FAQs at the bottom]

_______________________________________________________________________

The Rewards!

Logo Tee: S-XL (unisex) (larger sizes available upon request)

 Men's Cross Tee: S-XL


"Men's Cross Tee w/ Mazowe fabric"

Ladies' Cross Tank: XS-XL


"Ladies' Cross Tank w/ Angwa fabric"

Men's  Denim: XS-XL (larger sizes available upon request)


"Men's Denim w/ Mazowe fabric"

Ladies' Denim: XS-XL (larger sizes available upon request)

Men's Bowtie: please specify PRE-TIED or CLASSIC style.


"Bow-tie w/ Mazowe fabric"

Ladies' Headband: one size fits all.


"Headband w/ Limpopo fabric"
"Ladies' Denim w/ Limpopo fabric"


"Headband w/ Mazowe fabric"

Men's Dress Shirt: S-L, white or black (larger sizes available upon request)


"Men's White Dress Shirt w/ Chiredzi fabric"
"Men's Black Dress Shirt w/ Mazowe fabric"


"Men's Black Dress shirt w/ Mazowe fabric"


"Men's White Dress shirt w/ Chiredzi fabric"
"Ladies' Denim w/ Munyati fabric"

______________________________________________________________________

AFRICAN FABRICS

      Mazowe                Angwa                 Munyati            Sebakwe             Zambezi
      Limpopo               Ngezi                  Chiredzi                 Pungwe               Shamva

_______________________________________________________________________

FAQs

What does the name Tibatane mean?

--Tibatane means "together" in Shona, one of Zimbabwe's official languages.

How do I pronounce Tibatane?

(tea - but - ahn - ay)

Will buying Tibatane products create jobs?

--Yes! Buying Tibatane products will create jobs for the women in our factory. Additionally, the funds we raise from the clothing line will go toward helping Zimbabwean micro-entrepreneurs start their own sustainable businesses.

How does it work?

--You purchase a Tibatane product and pick the fabric of your choice. We donate 30% to community development projects that help develop micro-entrepreneurs. We commit to two specific projects a year.

Who did your video?

--David Parks of Dew Point Media did all videography and editing.

story:
Mushroom City POP-UP FARM PROJECT     www.mushroomcity.ie
 A new non-profit urban farming project in the heart of Dublin City Centre.

Spearheaded by the people behind the hugely successful www.urbanfarm.ie

The concept is simple.

1,000's of kilos of used Coffee Grounds are wasted every day in Ireland and it just so happens these Coffee Grounds can make a great resource for Growing Mushrooms.

So the idea is to collect the grounds and help you become an " Oyster Mushroom Farmer "

How does it all work?  

Daily we will be collecting used grounds from our Project Partners in the local area by cargo bicycle. Once the fresh coffee grounds arrive at the farm they are mixed with Oyster spawn and portioned off into individual bags & stored for three weeks to inoculate within a climate controlled space.

After this period the bags are then packaged into Mini Oyster Farm boxes with full instructions ready for delivery.

This is a Pop-up Pilot Project  that we hope will inspire and instigate other such waste resource food growing enterprises & example the global enterprise of growing  mushrooms on coffee. More details on how this initiative is spreading around the world  Zeri The Blue Economy Pulp to Protein PDF

Worldwide  coffee is consumed, the coffee cup is at the end of  the process, where less than 1% of the coffee biomass is used after the brewing, these grounds are then sent to landfill, where they decompose, creating harmful methane gases.

This is an increasing problem as we create coffee culture waste daily .

Unwanted resources into local food is a simple solution to this problem.

After harvesting, the Mini Oyster Farm can be used as a nutrient rich soil enhancer & each Mini Oyster Farm contains a free packet of seeds to help continue the cycle by growing your own delicious fresh herbs.

Coffee grounds are perfect because they are full of essential minerals and necessary elements for the Oyster mushrooms. Which also aren’t too difficult to grow and they taste spectacular.

Mushroom City is a simple idea but an important one.
We are taking an unwanted waste resource and turning it into gourmet produce.

We think that with some funding,innovation and lots of fun.....

We need funds early to purchase the necessities like mushroom spawn, grow bags, cardboard packaging, printing & clean room sundries.

We already have all the expensive equipment at Urban Farm, including a climate controlled inoculation chamber, all the fans, heaters, lights, shelving, timers and of course our trusty cargo bike for collections.

We don't have to look too far for coffee grounds either.


We can make the Mushroom City Project a success and build on the great work already established by Urban Farm.

You can support this project by RESERVING your Mini Oyster Farm, Today !! 

Simply use your PayPal Account or choose to contribute by Credit Card

Find out more details about PayPal & "Pay-as-a-Guest" Option .http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20501786-how-to-contribute-via-paypal-without-a-paypal-account 


Overseas Perkers Please Note : We can only ship Within Ireland, Sorry !!
